original: @239b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @239b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: panytsa skan dha pra ka ra na /
analyzed: panytsa skan dha pra ka ra na /
translated: Pañcaskandhaprakaraṇa

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa /
translated: The Analysis of the Five Aggregates

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.🔽In order to open the mouths of the minds

original: blo gros sbyangs pa med rnams kyi //🔽blo yi kha ni dbye ba'i phyir ;🔽/ phung po skye mched khams rnams kyi //
analyzed: blo gros sbyangs pa med rnams kyi // blo yi kha ni dbye ba'i phyir ; / phung po skye mched khams rnams kyi //
translated: of those whose intellects are untrained,🔽I will state the correct characteristics in brief

original: mdor bsdus yang dag mtshan nyid brjod //
analyzed: mdor bsdus yang dag mtshan nyid brjod //
translated: of the aggregates, sense bases, and elements.

original: de la phung po lnga ni gzugs kyi phung po dang // tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: de la phung po lnga ni gzugs kyi phung po dang // tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The five aggregates are the form aggregate, the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the formation aggregate, and the consciousness aggregate.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis ni /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis ni /
translated: The twelve sense bases are

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: as follows:

original: mig gi skye mched dang / rna ba'i skye mched dang / sna'i skye mched dang / lce'i skye mched dang / lus kyi skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / dri'i skye mched dang /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang / rna ba'i skye mched dang / sna'i skye mched dang / lce'i skye mched dang / lus kyi skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / dri'i skye mched dang /
translated: the body sense-sphere,🔽the mind sense-sphere,🔽the form sense-sphere,🔽the sound sense-sphere,🔽the smell sense-sphere,🔽the taste sense-sphere,🔽the tangible sense-sphere,

original: ro'i skye mched dang / reg bya'i skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ces bya'o //🔽khams bco brgyad dag ni /
analyzed: ro'i skye mched dang / reg bya'i skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ces bya'o // khams bco brgyad dag ni /
translated: and the entity sense-sphere.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The eighteen constituents are as follows:🔽The eye constituent,🔽the form constituent,🔽the eye consciousness constituent,🔽the ear constituent,🔽the sound constituent,

original: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
analyzed: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
translated: the ear consciousness constituent,🔽the nose constituent,🔽the smell constituent,🔽the nose consciousness constituent,

original: lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: the tongue element, the taste element, and the tongue consciousness element; the body element, the tangible element, and the body consciousness element; the mind element, the dharma element, and the mind consciousness element.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa /
translated: The form aggregate is described in terms of the following:

original: de ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus te dbang po lnga dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya ste yul lnga dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba ste rdzas bcu gcig gi bdag nyid ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus te dbang po lnga dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya ste yul lnga dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba ste rdzas bcu gcig gi bdag nyid ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: The form aggregate is made up of eleven substances: the five sense faculties of eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body; the five sense objects of visible form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible; and non-informative form.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /🔽'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te / 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: This is twofold:🔽the primary elements and the derivative form.

original: de la 'byung ba ni chen po @240a * //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba ni chen po @240a * //
translated: The primary elements are the four great elements.

original: bzhi ste / sa'i khams dang chu'i khams dang me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams zhes bya ba'o //🔽nye bar bzung ba'i gzugs thams cad 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: bzhi ste / sa'i khams dang chu'i khams dang me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams zhes bya ba'o // nye bar bzung ba'i gzugs thams cad 'dzin pa'am /
translated: There are four: the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas ni khams te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas ni khams te /
translated: The elements are so called because they hold their own characteristics and because they hold all derivative form.

original: de dag ni reg bya'i skye mched kyi khongs su 'dus so ;
analyzed: de dag ni reg bya'i skye mched kyi khongs su 'dus so ;
translated: They are included in the sense sphere of tangibility.

original: / reg bya'i skye mched lhag ma ni 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / reg bya'i skye mched lhag ma ni 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The remaining part of the sense sphere of tangibility is smoothness, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa bcu po rnams ni 'byung ba las gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bcu po rnams ni 'byung ba las gyur pa ste /
translated: The ten beginning with the eye are derived from the elements,

original: 'byung ba las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise from the elements.

original: ji ltar rtsig pa la brten nas ri mo dang / rtsva dang shing la brten nas khyim dang / me long la brten nas gzugs brnyan dang / shing mag la la brten nas me ltar 'byung ba chen po la brten nas mig la sogs pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir nye bar gzung ba'i gzugs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ji ltar rtsig pa la brten nas ri mo dang / rtsva dang shing la brten nas khyim dang / me long la brten nas gzugs brnyan dang / shing mag la la brten nas me ltar 'byung ba chen po la brten nas mig la sogs pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir nye bar gzung ba'i gzugs zhes brjod do //
translated: Like a painting which arises in dependence on a wall, a house in dependence on grass and wood, a reflection in dependence on a mirror, and fire in dependence on kindling, the eye, etc. arise in dependence on the great elements. Therefore, they are called derivative form.

original: sa'i khams ni 'thas pa nyid dang / mkhrang ba nyid dang / sra ba nyid de de'i las ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i khams ni 'thas pa nyid dang / mkhrang ba nyid dang / sra ba nyid de de'i las ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The function of the earth element is support.

original: chu'i khams ni gsher ba nyid dang / snum pa nyid dang / zhu ba nyid de /🔽de'i las ni sdud pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams ni gsher ba nyid dang / snum pa nyid dang / zhu ba nyid de / de'i las ni sdud pa'o //
translated: The function of the water element is cohesion.

original: me'i khams ni dro ba nyid de /🔽de'i las ni chos pa dang skems pa'o //🔽rlung gi khams ni yang zhing g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: me'i khams ni dro ba nyid de / de'i las ni chos pa dang skems pa'o // rlung gi khams ni yang zhing g-yo ba ste /
translated: The function of the fire element is maturation.

original: de'i las ni bskyed pa dang 'phel ba'o //🔽de las skyed pa ni rang gi yul dang mngon par 'brel pa lhag par de'i steng du 'byung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i las ni bskyed pa dang 'phel ba'o // de las skyed pa ni rang gi yul dang mngon par 'brel pa lhag par de'i steng du 'byung bar byed pa'o //
translated: The function of the wind element is expansion.

original: 'phel ba ni yul gzhan du bar ma chad par 'byung bas yul gzhan 'thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba ni yul gzhan du bar ma chad par 'byung bas yul gzhan 'thob par byed pa'o //
translated: Expansion is the increase of that which is born from the elements, in its own place, and the acquisition of another place by the uninterrupted arising of that which is born from the elements in another place.

original: 'phel bar byed pa 'di nyid la rgyas pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa 'di nyid la rgyas pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: This expansion is also called growth.

original: 'byung ba chen po 'di rnams ni gang na gcig yod pa na lhag ma yang yod la /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po 'di rnams ni gang na gcig yod pa na lhag ma yang yod la /
translated: These great elements exist wherever the others exist.

original: gang na lhag ma yod pa na gcig kyang yod de phan tshun dbyer med do //
analyzed: gang na lhag ma yod pa na gcig kyang yod de phan tshun dbyer med do //
translated: When there is a remainder, there is one, for they are not mutually exclusive.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni phan tshun ma ltos par med pas rang gi ngo bor grub pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni phan tshun ma ltos par med pas rang gi ngo bor grub pa med do //
translated: Thus, since they do not exist without mutual dependence, they do not exist as self-subsistent entities.

original: de dag las gzugs kha cig ni dngos su yod pa nyid du rang gi dbang po'i rnam par shes pas rtogs so //
analyzed: de dag las gzugs kha cig ni dngos su yod pa nyid du rang gi dbang po'i rnam par shes pas rtogs so //
translated: Some forms are directly perceived as existing by the sensory consciousnesses.

original: kha cig ni 'bras bu mthong ba rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'bras bu mthong ba rjes su dpag go //
translated: Some are inferred from the perception of their effects.

original: de dag ni 'byung ba yang yin pas 'byung ba chen po ste /
analyzed: de dag ni 'byung ba yang yin pas 'byung ba chen po ste /
translated: They are also elements, thus they are great elements.

original: rgya che ba'i nam mkha' khyab par gnas pa na 'di dag nyid chen po'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba'i nam mkha' khyab par gnas pa na 'di dag nyid chen po'o //
translated: They are great because they are extensive and pervasive, abiding in space.

original: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa de las kyi khyad par las 'byung ba nyid @240b kyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa de las kyi khyad par las 'byung ba nyid @240b kyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: They are elements because they are the source of the specific and non-specific effects.

original: de lta bas na nam mkha' ni gzugs thams cad 'byung ba'i skabs 'byed pas chen po yin yang 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na nam mkha' ni gzugs thams cad 'byung ba'i skabs 'byed pas chen po yin yang 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, space is great because it provides the opportunity for the occurrence of all forms, but it is not an element,

original: 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a product.

original: de bas na nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, space is not a great element.

original: de ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams bshad zin to //🔽yang ji ltar 'byung ba chen po 'di dag reg bya'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa nyid kyis 'jig rten pa'i dbang po dang dbang pos so sor rtogs pas mngon sum nyid yin pa ltar mig la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams bshad zin to // yang ji ltar 'byung ba chen po 'di dag reg bya'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa nyid kyis 'jig rten pa'i dbang po dang dbang pos so sor rtogs pas mngon sum nyid yin pa ltar mig la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus the great elements have been explained.

original: dbang po'i yul las 'das pa nyid kyis na rang gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa las rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas rtogs so //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul las 'das pa nyid kyis na rang gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa las rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas rtogs so //
translated: The eye and the rest are not directly perceived, like the great elements, by the ordinary person, because they are not included in the sense-sphere of tangibility and because they are beyond the range of the senses. They are understood by inference, because they are inferred from their effect, the visual consciousness, etc.

original: 'di ltar ma dang pha la brten nas bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na de'i ma rig gnas lta bu ni mig ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma dang pha la brten nas bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na de'i ma rig gnas lta bu ni mig ste /
translated: Just as a son is born in dependence on his mother and father, so visual consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form. The eye is like the mother, because it is the cause of the visual consciousness through its transformation.

original: de'i yongs su gyur pa las rnam par shes pa'i 'gyur ba 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i yongs su gyur pa las rnam par shes pa'i 'gyur ba 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The transformation of the visual consciousness arises from the transformation of the eye.

original: phan btags pa dang gnod pa byas pa dag gis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag tu rjes su sgrub pas so //
analyzed: phan btags pa dang gnod pa byas pa dag gis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag tu rjes su sgrub pas so //
translated: because it is the cause of the clear and unclear states of consciousness, whether one is helped or harmed.

original: de lta bas na mig gi dbang po ni 'di'i rten du 'gyur bas na mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes de yis bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na mig gi dbang po ni 'di'i rten du 'gyur bas na mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes de yis bstan to //
translated: Therefore, since the eye faculty is the basis of that consciousness, it is called eye consciousness.

original: mig gi dbang po 'di ni mig gi rten gyi mig gi 'bras bu'i nang na rgun 'bru'i 'bras bu'i tshad tsam zi ra'i me tog lta bu ltar med pa pags pa dang bas g-yogs pa dang bar gnas pa rang gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa las rtogs
analyzed: mig gi dbang po 'di ni mig gi rten gyi mig gi 'bras bu'i nang na rgun 'bru'i 'bras bu'i tshad tsam zi ra'i me tog lta bu ltar med pa pags pa dang bas g-yogs pa dang bar gnas pa rang gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa las rtogs
translated: This eye faculty, which is the basis of the eye, is located in the eye’s eyeball, which is like a grape in size, and is covered by the thinnest membrane, like a flower petal. It is known from its own effect, consciousness.

original: pa ste / de yang 'di ltar ce re long  rnams kyi mig gi rten 'dra bar gnas kyang rnam par shes pa mi 'byung bas dbang po med par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: pa ste / de yang 'di ltar ce re long  rnams kyi mig gi rten 'dra bar gnas kyang rnam par shes pa mi 'byung bas dbang po med par rab tu shes so //
translated: And that is known in this way: even though the eye faculty of the blind is present in the same way as the eye faculty of those who are not blind, consciousness does not arise. Therefore, it is known that the eye faculty does not exist.

original: mig gi brten pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rab tu rnyed nas 'byung bar 'gyur mod kyi //
analyzed: mig gi brten pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rab tu rnyed nas 'byung bar 'gyur mod kyi //
translated: The visual consciousness arises when the conditions of the eye, form, light, and mental activity are present.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyus nye bar brten te ji ltar rnga bo che'i sgra dang / nas kyi myu gu zhes bya ba bzhin du rten de'i rnam par shes pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyus nye bar brten te ji ltar rnga bo che'i sgra dang / nas kyi myu gu zhes bya ba bzhin du rten de'i rnam par shes pa zhes bstan to //
translated: But it is designated as the consciousness of that support, as in the case of the sound of a drum or the sprout of barley, because it is the special cause of the support.

original: rab tu byed pa'i gzhung dang yang rjes su mthun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i gzhung dang yang rjes su mthun par 'gyur te /
translated: This is also in accord with the Abhidharma treatise, which states:

original: mig gi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the eye faculty?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs @241a * //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs @241a * //
translated: It is the form that is the basis of visual consciousness.

original: dang po'i zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dang po'i zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The first is the eye.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'di'i rten ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'di'i rten ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The basis of this visual consciousness is twofold:

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i mig dang 'das pa'i yid do //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i mig dang 'das pa'i yid do //
translated: the eye that is co-arisen and the past mind.

original: de la mig la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du brjod na yid kyis kyang mi gces bya ba 'thob par 'gyur ba rgyu de bas na gzugs dang ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: de la mig la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du brjod na yid kyis kyang mi gces bya ba 'thob par 'gyur ba rgyu de bas na gzugs dang ba zhes smos so //
translated: If the eye is called the basis of the eye consciousness, then the mental faculty would also obtain the name eye, because it is the basis of mental consciousness.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the ear and so on.

original: khyad par ni 'di yin te /🔽rna ba'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab ni gro ba'i mdud pa lta bur gnas so //
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di yin te / rna ba'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab ni gro ba'i mdud pa lta bur gnas so //
translated: The difference is as follows.🔽The subtle particles of the ear sense faculty are arranged like a flower bud.

original: sna'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab ni mtshul pa'i nang ltag khung gi thad ka na mig sman gyi thur ma gshibs pa ltar gnas te /
analyzed: sna'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab ni mtshul pa'i nang ltag khung gi thad ka na mig sman gyi thur ma gshibs pa ltar gnas te /
translated: The subtle particles of the nose sense faculty are arranged like a pair of needles inside the nostrils.

original: dbang po dang po gsum ni phreng ba ltar gnas so //
analyzed: dbang po dang po gsum ni phreng ba ltar gnas so //
translated: The first three sense faculties are arranged like a garland.

original: lce'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab ni zla ba kham pa ltar gnas so //🔽lus kyi dbang po'i rdul phra rab ni lus bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: lce'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab ni zla ba kham pa ltar gnas so // lus kyi dbang po'i rdul phra rab ni lus bzhin du gnas so //
translated: The subtle particles of the tongue sense faculty are arranged like the crescent moon.🔽The subtle particles of the body sense faculty are arranged like the body.

original: lus kyi dbang po'i khyad par nyid mod dpa' dbang po'o ;
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i khyad par nyid mod dpa' dbang po'o ;
translated: The body sense faculty itself is the sense faculty of touch.

original: / de la mo'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab ni rnga bo che ma g-yos pa'i sbubs ltar gnas so //
analyzed: / de la mo'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab ni rnga bo che ma g-yos pa'i sbubs ltar gnas so //
translated: The female organ is located in the female organ itself, like a drum.

original: pho'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab ni mthe bo'i rnam pa lta bur gnas so //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab ni mthe bo'i rnam pa lta bur gnas so //
translated: The male organ is located in the male organ itself, like a thumb.

original: mig la sogs pa lnga po 'di rnams ni rang gi yul la nye bar dmigs pa'i bdag po yin pas dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa lnga po 'di rnams ni rang gi yul la nye bar dmigs pa'i bdag po yin pas dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The five beginning with the eye are called organs because they are dominant with regard to the perception of their own objects.

original: de lta bas na mig ni gzugs la nye bar dmigs pa la lhag par dbang byed kyi gzugs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mig ni gzugs la nye bar dmigs pa la lhag par dbang byed kyi gzugs ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the eye is dominant with regard to the perception of visible form, but not vice versa.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the ear, etc.

original: mo nyid dang pho nyid la dbang byed pas mo dang po'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: mo nyid dang pho nyid la dbang byed pas mo dang po'i dbang po ste /
translated: The female organ and male organ are dominant with regard to the distinction of sex.

original: de la mo'i ngo bo ni mo'i rang bzhin dang skad dang byed pa dang bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de la mo'i ngo bo ni mo'i rang bzhin dang skad dang byed pa dang bsam pa'o //
translated: The female nature, voice, behavior, and desire are the female sex.

original: pho'i ngo bo ni pho'i rang bzhin dang skad dang byed pa dang bsam pa ste /
analyzed: pho'i ngo bo ni pho'i rang bzhin dang skad dang byed pa dang bsam pa ste /
translated: The male nature, voice, behavior, and desire are the male sex.

original: de dag la dbang byed pas mo dang pho'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: de dag la dbang byed pas mo dang pho'i dbang po'o //
translated: The female and male organs are dominant with regard to these.

original: de ltar dbang po rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbang po rnams bstan nas /
translated: Having thus explained the faculties,🔽

original: da ni don rnams bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni don rnams bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having thus explained the faculties, he now explains the objects.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba nyid ni gzugs kyi skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba nyid ni gzugs kyi skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The nature of the form base is the intrinsic identity of that which is cognized by the eye consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa ni rang rang gi dbang po'i rnam par shes pas shes par byed pa nyid ni sgra la sogs pa'i skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa ni rang rang gi dbang po'i rnam par shes pas shes par byed pa nyid ni sgra la sogs pa'i skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Similarly, the intrinsic identity of the sound base, etc., is that which is cognized by the individual consciousnesses of the ear, etc.

original: so so'i dbye bas phye ba na gzugs kyi skye mched ni rnam pa gnyis su @241b 'gyur te /
analyzed: so so'i dbye bas phye ba na gzugs kyi skye mched ni rnam pa gnyis su @241b 'gyur te /
translated: When divided by individual categories, the form base becomes two types:

original: kha dog dang dbyibs so //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs so //
translated: color and shape.

original: de la kha dog ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la kha dog ni bzhi ste /
translated: Color is of four types:

original: sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: blue, etc.

original: gzhan ni de'i bye brag go //
analyzed: gzhan ni de'i bye brag go //
translated: The others are its subdivisions.

original: dbyibs ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: dbyibs ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Shape is of eight types:

original: ring po la sogs pa nas mi mnyam pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa nas mi mnyam pa'i bar du'o //
translated: long, etc., up to uneven.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched de nyid yang rnam pa nyi shur brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched de nyid yang rnam pa nyi shur brjod par bya ste /
translated: That form base is also said to be of twenty types:

original: 'di lta ste sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ring po dang / thung du dang / zlum po dang / lham pa dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ring po dang / thung du dang / zlum po dang / lham pa dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang /
translated: yellow, red, white, long, short, square, round, high, low, even, uneven,

original: sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: cloud, smoke, dust, mist, shadow, sun, light, darkness.

original: de la mnyam pa ni mi mnyam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la mnyam pa ni mi mnyam pa med pa'o //
translated: Among them, even is the absence of uneven.

original: mi mnyam pa ni mthon dman du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ni mthon dman du gnas pa'o //
translated: Uneven is the state of being high and low.

original: khug rna ni lho bur ro //
analyzed: khug rna ni lho bur ro //
translated: Mist is fog.

original: nyi ma ni nyi ma'i 'od do //
analyzed: nyi ma ni nyi ma'i 'od do //
translated: Sun is the light of the sun.

original: snang ba ni zla ba dang / skar ma dang / me dang / sman dang / nor bu rnams kyi 'od do//
analyzed: snang ba ni zla ba dang / skar ma dang / me dang / sman dang / nor bu rnams kyi 'od do//
translated: Light is the light of the moon, stars, fire, herbs, and jewels.

original: grib ma ni gang na gzugs rnams snang ba'o //
analyzed: grib ma ni gang na gzugs rnams snang ba'o //
translated: Shadow is where forms appear.

original: bzlog pa ni mun pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni mun pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is darkness.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched bshad zin to //
translated: The form base has been explained.

original: sgra ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: sgra ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Sound is of eight kinds:

original: zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po rgyu las byung ba dag so sor sems can dang sems can ma yin par ston pas rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po rgyu las byung ba dag so sor sems can dang sems can ma yin par ston pas rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The fourfold classification is based on the distinction between sentient and non-sentient beings, and on the distinction between the great elements that are conjoined and those that are not conjoined with the mind.

original: yang de nyid re re zhing yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: yang de nyid re re zhing yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: Each of these four is further divided into two, pleasant and unpleasant, making eight in all.

original: de la sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba'i rten nyid du bzung bas zin pa'o //🔽de ni sems dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de la sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba'i rten nyid du bzung bas zin pa'o // de ni sems dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The conjoined are those that are the basis for the arising of mind and mental factors.

original: dbang po las tha dad du gyur ba ma yin pa'o /
analyzed: dbang po las tha dad du gyur ba ma yin pa'o /
translated: This means that they are associated with mind, and are not separate from the sense faculties.

original: gang la rgyu zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po yod pa de ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can te lag pa dang ngag gi sgra lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang la rgyu zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po yod pa de ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can te lag pa dang ngag gi sgra lta bu'o //
translated: Those that have conjoined great elements as their cause are called “having conjoined great elements as their cause,” like the sound of hands and speech.

original: gzhan ni ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can te /
translated: Others have unconjoined great elements as their cause.

original: ji ltar rlung dang nags tshal dang chu klung gi sgra lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rlung dang nags tshal dang chu klung gi sgra lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the sound of wind, forest, and river.

original: sems can du ston pa'i sgra ni sems can du nges par byed pa'i sgra ste /
analyzed: sems can du ston pa'i sgra ni sems can du nges par byed pa'i sgra ste /
translated: The sound that indicates a sentient being is the sound that definitely makes a sentient being.

original: sgra gang gis sems can te srog chags so zhes nges par 'gyur ba de ni sems can du ston pa'o //
analyzed: sgra gang gis sems can te srog chags so zhes nges par 'gyur ba de ni sems can du ston pa'o //
translated: The sound by which a sentient being, a living being, is definitely understood is the sound that indicates a sentient being.

original: bzlog pa ni sems can ma yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni sems can ma yin par ston pa'o //
translated: The opposite is the sound that does not indicate a sentient being.

original: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can sems can du ston pa'i sgra ni ngag @242a * //
analyzed: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can sems can du ston pa'i sgra ni ngag @242a * //
translated: Among those, the sound of speech is the sound that indicates a sentient being, having the nature of conjoined great elements.

original: gi sgra'o // sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ni de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: gi sgra'o // sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ni de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: The sound that does not indicate a sentient being is the opposite of that.

original: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can du sems can du ston pa ni sprul pa'i dag gi sgra'o //
analyzed: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can du sems can du ston pa ni sprul pa'i dag gi sgra'o //
translated: The sound of emanated speech is the sound that indicates a sentient being, having the nature of unconjoined great elements.

original: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ni rlung dang nags tshal dang chu klung gi sgra'o //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ni rlung dang nags tshal dang chu klung gi sgra'o //
translated: The sound that does not indicate a sentient being is the sound of wind, forest, and river.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni yid dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni yid dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: Pleasant is that which delights the mind.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Unpleasant is the opposite of that.

original: gzhan dag na re zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can gyi sgra yang yod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can gyi sgra yang yod do //
translated: There is also sound that is the effect of the great elements that are both grasped and not grasped.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: lag pa dang rnga'i sbyor ba las byung ba lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lag pa dang rnga'i sbyor ba las byung ba lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: the sound that arises from the contact of the hand and the drum.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: This is not correct.

original: kha dog gi rdul phra rab gcig la 'byung ba chen po bzhi mtshan gnyis kyis bskyed par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du 'di yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kha dog gi rdul phra rab gcig la 'byung ba chen po bzhi mtshan gnyis kyis bskyed par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du 'di yang mi 'dod do //
translated: Just as one does not accept that a single atom of color is generated by the two natures of the four great elements, one should not accept that sound is generated in this way.

original: dri ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dri ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Smell is of four types:

original: dri zhim pa dang / mi zhim pa dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: dri zhim pa dang / mi zhim pa dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: good smell, bad smell, equal smell, and unequal smell.

original: bstan bcos las ni dri zhim pa dang / dri mi zhim pa dang / dri mnyam pa zhes rnam pa gsum 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni dri zhim pa dang / dri mi zhim pa dang / dri mnyam pa zhes rnam pa gsum 'byung ngo //
translated: In the treatise, three types of smell are mentioned: good smell, bad smell, and equal smell.

original: ro ni drug ste /
analyzed: ro ni drug ste /
translated: Taste is of six types:

original: mngar ba dang / sgyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: mngar ba dang / sgyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

original: rtsa ba'i ro 'di rnams kyis yang dag par sbyor ba las ro'i bye brag mtha' yas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ro 'di rnams kyis yang dag par sbyor ba las ro'i bye brag mtha' yas par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the combination of these basic tastes, an infinite variety of tastes are produced.

original: reg bya ni bcu gcig gi bdag nyid de 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang / lci ba nyid dang / yang ba nyid dang / grang ba nyid dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: reg bya ni bcu gcig gi bdag nyid de 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang / lci ba nyid dang / yang ba nyid dang / grang ba nyid dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Touch is of eleven types: the four primary elements, smoothness, roughness, heaviness, lightness, cold, hunger, and thirst.

original: de la 'byung ba chen po ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba chen po ni bshad zin to //
translated: The four primary elements have been explained.

original: 'jam pa ni reg pa na bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni reg pa na bde ba'o //
translated: Smoothness is that which is pleasant to the touch.

original: rtsub pa nyid ni reg par mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rtsub pa nyid ni reg par mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: Roughness is that which is unpleasant to the touch.

original: lci ba nyid ni gang gis dngos po rnams 'jal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lci ba nyid ni gang gis dngos po rnams 'jal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Heaviness is that which causes things to fall.

original: yang ba nyid ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: yang ba nyid ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Lightness is the opposite of that.

original: grang ba ni dro ba 'dod par byed pa'o //🔽bkres pa ni zas 'dod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba ni dro ba 'dod par byed pa'o // bkres pa ni zas 'dod par byed pa'o //
translated: Cold is that which causes a desire for warmth.🔽Hunger is that which causes a desire for food.

original: skom pa ni btung ba 'dod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: skom pa ni btung ba 'dod par byed pa ste /
translated: Thirst is that which causes a desire for drink.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa'o //
translated: The cause is figuratively designated by the effect.

original: de yang 'di ltar /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar /
translated: This is how it is.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba bde ba ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba bde ba ste //
translated: The appearance of a Buddha is happiness.

original: chos bstan pa yang bde ba yin //🔽dge 'dun mthun pa bde ba ste //
analyzed: chos bstan pa yang bde ba yin // dge 'dun mthun pa bde ba ste //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is happiness.🔽The harmony of the Saṅgha is happiness.

original: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub bde //🔽zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub bde // zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The austerity of those who are in harmony is happiness.

original: dngos po gang la 'byung ba me dang chu'i khams shas che ba de ni 'jam pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po gang la 'byung ba me dang chu'i khams shas che ba de ni 'jam pa nyid do //
translated: The softness of a thing is due to the predominance of the fire and water elements.

original: sa dang rlung shas che ba de ni rtsub pa nyid do //
analyzed: sa dang rlung shas che ba de ni rtsub pa nyid do //
translated: The roughness of a thing is due to the predominance of the earth and wind elements.

original: @242b sa dang chu shas che pa de ni lci ba nyid do //
analyzed: @242b sa dang chu shas che pa de ni lci ba nyid do //
translated: The heaviness of a thing is due to the predominance of the earth and water elements.

original: me dang rlung shas che ba de ni yang ba nyid do //
analyzed: me dang rlung shas che ba de ni yang ba nyid do //
translated: The lightness of a thing is due to the predominance of the fire and wind elements.

original: chu dang rlung shas che ba de ni grang ba'o //
analyzed: chu dang rlung shas che ba de ni grang ba'o //
translated: The cold of a thing is due to the predominance of the water and wind elements.

original: rlung shas che ba de ni bkres pa'o //
analyzed: rlung shas che ba de ni bkres pa'o //
translated: Hunger is due to the predominance of the wind element.

original: me dang rlung shas che ba de ni skom pa'o //
analyzed: me dang rlung shas che ba de ni skom pa'o //
translated: Thirst is due to the predominance of the fire and wind elements.

original: dbang po lnga dang don lnga ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang don lnga ni bshad zin to //
translated: The five sense faculties and the five objects have been explained.

original: de la mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga ni rang rang gi 'bras bu las rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig gis shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga ni rang rang gi 'bras bu las rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig gis shes par bya ba'o //
translated: The five sense faculties, eye, etc., are to be inferred from their effects, and are known only by the mental consciousness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa lnga ni so sor rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis rnam par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa lnga ni so sor rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis rnam par shes par bya ste /
translated: The five sense objects, form, etc., are known by two kinds of consciousness.

original: de la gzugs kyi skye mched ni mig gi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong nas yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi skye mched ni mig gi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong nas yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so //
translated: The sense base of form is experienced by the eye consciousness and known by the mental consciousness.

original: de bzhin du reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar du rang rang gi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag gis rnam par shes so zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar du rang rang gi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag gis rnam par shes so zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to the sense bases of sound, etc., up to the sense base of tactility, which is known by the body consciousness and the mental consciousness.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-informative form?

original: gzugs gang chos kyi skye mched du gyur pa bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam gyis shes par bya ba ste //
analyzed: gzugs gang chos kyi skye mched du gyur pa bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam gyis shes par bya ba ste //
translated: It is form that is included in the sense base of the mental object, is not visible, and is not capable of being indicated. It is known by the mental consciousness alone.

original: sdom pa dang / sdom pa ma yin pa dang / bar ma bsdus pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyun gyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa dang / sdom pa ma yin pa dang / bar ma bsdus pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyun gyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: The nature of the continuity of virtue and nonvirtue that is not included in the categories of restraint, unrestraint, or the indeterminate is nonindicative form.

original: de la kha cig ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de la kha cig ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa ste /
translated: Some of it is concomitant with mind.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i ngo po'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i ngo po'o //
translated: the nature of the restraint of meditative attainment and the nature of uncontaminated restraint.

original: kha cig ni yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Some of it arises from correct assumption.

original: sems g-yengs pa dang sems ma g-yengs pa dang / sems med pa'i gnas skabs gsum char na'ang chu po'i rgyun bzhin du 'jug pa dang / nyin dang mtshan du ji srid 'phags par rjes su 'jug pa ji srid 'tsho'i bar ram /
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa dang sems ma g-yengs pa dang / sems med pa'i gnas skabs gsum char na'ang chu po'i rgyun bzhin du 'jug pa dang / nyin dang mtshan du ji srid 'phags par rjes su 'jug pa ji srid 'tsho'i bar ram /
translated: It occurs in the three states of distracted mind, undistracted mind, and mindless states, like the current of a river, and it occurs for as long as one is an ārya, for as long as one lives,

original: nyin zhag gcig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: or for one day and night.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: For example, the nature of the restraint of individual liberation.

original: kha cig g-yengs ba dang ma g-yengs pa'i gnas skabs ni rjes su 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig g-yengs ba dang ma g-yengs pa'i gnas skabs ni rjes su 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Some of it occurs in the states of distracted mind and undistracted mind.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of non-restraint.

original: sdom pa yang ma yin sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni kha cig 'ga' zhig la zhing khyad par can gyis sbyin pa'i dngos po longs spyad pa las byung ba ste rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po lta bu'o //
analyzed: sdom pa yang ma yin sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni kha cig 'ga' zhig la zhing khyad par can gyis sbyin pa'i dngos po longs spyad pa las byung ba ste rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po lta bu'o //
translated: The nature of neither restraint nor non-restraint is, for example, the merit that arises from the enjoyment of a gift given to a special field, or the merit that arises from the enjoyment of a gift given to a special field.

original: kha cig @243a * //
analyzed: kha cig @243a * //
translated: Some,

original: ni sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dkyil 'khor la sogs pa yi dam du blangs nas byed pa'o //
analyzed: ni sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dkyil 'khor la sogs pa yi dam du blangs nas byed pa'o //
translated: having taken a vow to make offerings to the Buddha and to the mandala, etc.,

original: kha cig ni gus pa dang bcas pas mchod rten la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni gus pa dang bcas pas mchod rten la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: some, with devotion, perform acts such as prostrating to stupas.

original: mi dge ba ni lha mo du rga la sogs pa'i rten byed cing longs spyod pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i shugs drag pos bya ba rtsom pa la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni lha mo du rga la sogs pa'i rten byed cing longs spyod pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i shugs drag pos bya ba rtsom pa la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: Non-virtue is, for example, the worship of goddesses such as Durga, and the undertaking of actions such as the composition of texts, with strong afflictions.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan gyi sems thob pa las ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan gyi sems thob pa las ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa 'thob bo //
translated: From the attainment of a mind of dhyana that is contaminated, one attains the restraint of dhyana.

original: zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gyi sems thob pa las ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa 'thob pa //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gyi sems thob pa las ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa 'thob pa //
translated: The uncontaminated vow is obtained from the attainment of the mind of uncontaminated meditative stabilization.

original: de dag btang bas ni de dag gtong ngo //
analyzed: de dag btang bas ni de dag gtong ngo //
translated: They are relinquished by relinquishing them.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni gzhan la gsol ba 'debs pa'i rnam par rig byed la sogs pa las 'thob ste /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni gzhan la gsol ba 'debs pa'i rnam par rig byed la sogs pa las 'thob ste /
translated: The pratimoksa vow is obtained from the indicative form of requesting it from another.

original: yang dag par blangs pa btang ba dang / shi ba dang / mtshan gnyis byung ba dang / nyin zhag 'das pas gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa btang ba dang / shi ba dang / mtshan gnyis byung ba dang / nyin zhag 'das pas gtong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is relinquished by relinquishing the proper undertaking, by death, by the occurrence of two organs, and by the passing of a day.

original: de la dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge ba snyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i sdom pa rnams ni nyin zhag zad pa las gzhan pas gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge ba snyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i sdom pa rnams ni nyin zhag zad pa las gzhan pas gtong ba'o //
translated: The vows of fully ordained monks and nuns, male and female novices, female probationers, and male and female laypeople are relinquished by the passing of a day.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma'i sdom pa dag ni pas pham pa'i ltung bas kyang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma'i sdom pa dag ni pas pham pa'i ltung bas kyang ngo //
translated: The vows of fully ordained monks and nuns are also relinquished by downfalls that are like the grounds of defeat.

original: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ni nyin mtshan zad pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ni nyin mtshan zad pas kyang ngo //
translated: The vows of one day fasting are relinquished by the passing of a day and night.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa ni nya pa la sogs pa'i ste /
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa ni nya pa la sogs pa'i ste /
translated: Non-restraint is in the case of fishermen, etc.

original: de rnams kyis rgyu dang mtshon cha la sogs pa'i sbyor bas sdom pa ma yin pa 'thob la /
analyzed: de rnams kyis rgyu dang mtshon cha la sogs pa'i sbyor bas sdom pa ma yin pa 'thob la /
translated: They obtain non-restraint through the application of the cause, the weapon, etc.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rigs kyis ni de dag gi las yang dag par blangs pas 'thob po //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rigs kyis ni de dag gi las yang dag par blangs pas 'thob po //
translated: Others obtain it through the acceptance of the action.

original: gtong ba ni shi ba dang / mtshan gnyis byung ba dang / sdom pa thob pa las gtong ngo //
analyzed: gtong ba ni shi ba dang / mtshan gnyis byung ba dang / sdom pa thob pa las gtong ngo //
translated: It is lost through death, through the appearance of the two sexes at one time, and through the acquisition of restraint.

original: sdom pa yang ma yin sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni nyon mongs pa drag po dang / rab tu dang ba'i thugs dang / yang dag bar blangs pa chad pas 'chad do //
analyzed: sdom pa yang ma yin sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni nyon mongs pa drag po dang / rab tu dang ba'i thugs dang / yang dag bar blangs pa chad pas 'chad do //
translated: That which is neither restraint nor non-restraint is lost through the cutting off of the roots of virtue, through the acquisition of restraint, and through death.

original: de la dmigs pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i lus kyi de dang de lta bu'i dbyibs kyi khyad par ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i lus kyi de dang de lta bu'i dbyibs kyi khyad par ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed do //
translated: The special shape of the body that is produced by the mind that has that as its object is bodily intimation.

original: ngag gi rnam par rig byed ni de la dmigs pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i @243b brjod par bya ba brjod pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: ngag gi rnam par rig byed ni de la dmigs pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i @243b brjod par bya ba brjod pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Verbal intimation is the speech that expresses what is to be expressed, which is produced by the mind that has that as its object.

original: de lta bu de gnyis ni kun nas slong ba'i sems rnam par rig par byed pas na rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu de gnyis ni kun nas slong ba'i sems rnam par rig par byed pas na rnam par rig byed do //
translated: These two are informative because they inform others through the mind that instigates them.

original: rnam par rig byed dang 'dra ba'i chos gang 'phen pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i 'byung ba chen po la brten pa dang gnas pa ni rnam par rig byed dang 'dra bar gzhan la rnam par rig byed pa ma yin pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa
analyzed: rnam par rig byed dang 'dra ba'i chos gang 'phen pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i 'byung ba chen po la brten pa dang gnas pa ni rnam par rig byed dang 'dra bar gzhan la rnam par rig byed pa ma yin pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa
translated: Noninformative form is a phenomenon similar to informative form that is supported by the great elements that hold the projected form and is not informative to others in the way that informative form is.

original: ste / man ngag 'ba' zhig tsam gyis shes par bya zhing dge slong la sogs par 'jog pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ste / man ngag 'ba' zhig tsam gyis shes par bya zhing dge slong la sogs par 'jog pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is known only through inference and is the cause for positing a fully ordained being and so on.

original: de dang 'dra ba las dgag pa'i rkyen gyis te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba las dgag pa'i rkyen gyis te /
translated: It is similar to informative form, but it is called noninformative form because it is a cessation that is dependent on an antidote.

original: bram ze ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bram ze ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a non-Brahmin.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni bshad zin to //
translated: The form aggregate has already been explained.

original: tshor ba'i phung po'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa de la sim pa dang / gdung ba dang / de gnyi ga las grol ba'i yul gyi ngo bo mngon du byed pa gang yul nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo rnam par shes pa'i myong ba de ni tshor ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa de la sim pa dang / gdung ba dang / de gnyi ga las grol ba'i yul gyi ngo bo mngon du byed pa gang yul nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo rnam par shes pa'i myong ba de ni tshor ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The feeling aggregate is described as the experience of the object that is pleasant, unpleasant, or neither of the two, which is the nature of the experience of consciousness that experiences the object.

original: de la gtso bo sems ni sems las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gtso bo sems ni sems las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: The mind is not a mental factor.

original: der ni gtso po sems sems las byung ba ma yin par ji ltar shes /
analyzed: der ni gtso po sems sems las byung ba ma yin par ji ltar shes /
translated: How do you know that the mind is not a mental factor?

original: gang sems kyi bya ba'i ngo bo logs shig tu rang rgyud du grub par sems pa yid kyi las dang / dang ba sems kyi dang ba dang / rtog pa ni sems rtsing bzhes bya ba la sogs par brjod pas sems las byung ba'i sems kyi gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang sems kyi bya ba'i ngo bo logs shig tu rang rgyud du grub par sems pa yid kyi las dang / dang ba sems kyi dang ba dang / rtog pa ni sems rtsing bzhes bya ba la sogs par brjod pas sems las byung ba'i sems kyi gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
translated: The mental factor is not the state of the mind, because it is considered to be a separate entity that is the activity of the mind, such as the mental activity of the mind, the clarity of the mind, and the discursiveness of the mind, which are described as the coarseness of the mind, and so on.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: don tha dad du gyur pas so //
analyzed: don tha dad du gyur pas so //
translated: Because it is a different object.

original: de la kha cig sems kyi bya ba'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pas sems kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni sems las byung ba'o zhes 'dod do de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la kha cig sems kyi bya ba'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pas sems kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni sems las byung ba'o zhes 'dod do de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Some believe that since it is taught as the essence of the activity of mind, the specific states of mind are mental factors.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i nges pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i nges pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is not logical, because the rule that they are co-existent would be violated.

original: des na 'dir ni rnam par shes pa'i yul nye bar spyad par bya ba nyams su myong bas nyams su myong ba de ni tshor ba zhes brjod de rig pa ni tshor ba zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: des na 'dir ni rnam par shes pa'i yul nye bar spyad par bya ba nyams su myong bas nyams su myong ba de ni tshor ba zhes brjod de rig pa ni tshor ba zhes bya bas so //
translated: Therefore, here, experience is described as feeling because it is the experience of the object of consciousness that is being experienced.

original: yang na myong bar byed pas myong ba gang yin pa de tshor bas nyams su myong bar byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na myong bar byed pas myong ba gang yin pa de tshor bas nyams su myong bar byed pa nyid do //
translated: Or else, that which is experienced by the experience of feeling is the experience of feeling.

original: de ni yang na sems su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yang na sems su shes par bya'o //
translated: That should be understood as mind.

original: tshor ba nyid ni rnam par shes pas myong bar bya zhing /
analyzed: tshor ba nyid ni rnam par shes pas myong bar bya zhing /
translated: Feeling is to be experienced by consciousness,

original: nyams su myong bar bya bas nyams su myong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyams su myong bar bya bas nyams su myong ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the experience of that which is to be experienced.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa dang 'dra bar nye bar spyad par bya ba nyid do //🔽des na 'di ltar 'di @244a * //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa dang 'dra bar nye bar spyad par bya ba nyid do // des na 'di ltar 'di @244a * //
translated: It is to be enjoyed like food and drink, etc.

original: ni sems kyi zas so zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ni sems kyi zas so zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, it is established as the food of the mind.

original: yang de lta bu'i tshor ba de ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang de lta bu'i tshor ba de ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, that feeling is twofold:

original: lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
translated: bodily and mental.

original: de la dbang po'i gzugs can lnga ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis lus kyi skar brjod la /
analyzed: de la dbang po'i gzugs can lnga ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis lus kyi skar brjod la /
translated: The five sense faculties that have form are called bodily because their nature is the aggregation of atoms.

original: de la brten nas byung ba'i tshor ba ni lus las byung bas lus kyi zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la brten nas byung ba'i tshor ba ni lus las byung bas lus kyi zhes brjod do //
translated: The feeling that arises in dependence on them is called bodily because it arises from the body.

original: yid kyi dbang po la brten pa'i tshor ba ni sems kyi zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po la brten pa'i tshor ba ni sems kyi zhes brjod do //
translated: The feeling that is based on the mental faculty is called mental.

original: yang tshor ba de nyid rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang tshor ba de nyid rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, that feeling is threefold:

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de la tshor ba bde ba ni gang yongs su bzung bas dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po 'phel bar byed cing gang bzung ba de dang 'bral bar mi 'dod pa de ni bde ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la tshor ba bde ba ni gang yongs su bzung bas dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po 'phel bar byed cing gang bzung ba de dang 'bral bar mi 'dod pa de ni bde ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Pleasant feeling is that which, when grasped, causes the great elements of the sense faculties to increase, and one does not wish to be separated from that which is grasped.

original: sdug bsngal ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: Painful feeling is the opposite of that.

original: nye bar gnod pas 'bral bar 'dod pa de sdug bsngal zhes brjod do //🔽gang phrad pa dang bral ba'i srid pa'i rten du ma gyur pa yongs su 'dzin pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: nye bar gnod pas 'bral bar 'dod pa de sdug bsngal zhes brjod do // gang phrad pa dang bral ba'i srid pa'i rten du ma gyur pa yongs su 'dzin pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is called painful because one wishes to be separated from it due to the harm it causes.

original: rjes su gtong ba yang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su gtong ba yang ma yin pa ste /
translated: Neutral feeling is that which is neither a basis for the continuation of existence due to contact or separation, nor is it grasped or relinquished.🔽It is that which, when grasped, does not cause the great elements of the sense faculties to increase, nor does one wish to be separated from it.

original: de la brten nas gti mug 'byung ba ni btang snyoms te /
analyzed: de la brten nas gti mug 'byung ba ni btang snyoms te /
translated: Ignorance arises in dependence on that, and it is called neutral feeling.

original: bde ba yang ma yin /🔽sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa ni tshor ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa ni tshor ba zhes brjod do //
translated: It is neither pleasant nor painful.

original: yang tshor ba de nyid rnam pa lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang tshor ba de nyid rnam pa lngar 'gyur te /
translated: Again, that very feeling becomes fivefold:

original: bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: the faculty of pleasure, the faculty of pain, the faculty of mental pleasure, the faculty of mental displeasure, and the faculty of indifference.

original: de la dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba bde ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i sems kyi tshor ba bde ba ste /
analyzed: de la dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba bde ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i sems kyi tshor ba bde ba ste /
translated: The faculty of pleasure is the pleasant feeling associated with the consciousness that has a material faculty as its basis, and the pleasant feeling that is the mental consciousness in the third meditative absorption.

original: de gnyis ka yang bde ba'i dbang po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang bde ba'i dbang po zhes brjod do //
translated: Both of these are called the faculty of pleasure.

original: dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba bde ba ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba bde ba ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of pain is the unpleasant feeling associated with the consciousness that has a material faculty as its basis.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba bde ba ni yid bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba bde ba ni yid bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of mental pleasure is the pleasant feeling associated with the mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi de nyid mi bde ba ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: yid kyi de nyid mi bde ba ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of mental displeasure is the unpleasant feeling associated with the mental consciousness.

original: de dag thams cad kyi bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of equanimity is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: rgyu cis she na /
analyzed: rgyu cis she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gi phyir @244b sems kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal phal cher rnam par rtog pa las 'byung gi lus kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir @244b sems kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal phal cher rnam par rtog pa las 'byung gi lus kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Because pleasure and pain are mostly mental, not physical.

original: lus kyi dbang gis dgra bcom pa rnams la yang 'byung ngo //🔽gzhan yang lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal bzung ba dang gtong bar bya ba ni mi brtan par 'byung la /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang gis dgra bcom pa rnams la yang 'byung ngo // gzhan yang lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal bzung ba dang gtong bar bya ba ni mi brtan par 'byung la /
translated: Even for the arhats, pleasure and pain arise due to the body.🔽Moreover, the pleasure and pain of the body arise and cease due to the body,

original: gzhan pa sems kyi ni brtan par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan pa sems kyi ni brtan par 'byung ngo //
translated: but the pleasure and pain of the mind arise and cease due to the mind.

original: btang snyoms kyi ni rnam par gzhag pa de dag med de /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi ni rnam par gzhag pa de dag med de /
translated: The faculty of equanimity is not like that.

original: mdor bsdus nas rnam par shes pa drug gi ris ni btang snyoms zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas rnam par shes pa drug gi ris ni btang snyoms zhes brjod do //
translated: In brief, it is said that equanimity is the six collections of consciousness.

original: tshor ba de nyid yang rten drug gi bye brag gis drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshor ba de nyid yang rten drug gi bye brag gis drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: That same feeling is sixfold due to the distinction of the six bases.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba dang / rna pa dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba dang / rna pa dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The feeling that arises from the contact of the eye, the feeling that arises from the contact of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: tshor ba'i phung po bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregate of feeling has been explained.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa /
translated: The aggregate of perception is described in terms of the following:

original: 'di la bum pa dang / ras yug dang / shing rta'i ngo bo la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams 'dus pa nyid du mtshungs na yang so sor nges pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi bye brag yod par rgyu dang rkyen gyi bye brag la ltos nas yangs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag yod do //
analyzed: 'di la bum pa dang / ras yug dang / shing rta'i ngo bo la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams 'dus pa nyid du mtshungs na yang so sor nges pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi bye brag yod par rgyu dang rkyen gyi bye brag la ltos nas yangs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag yod do //
translated: Although forms such as a pot, a cloth, a chariot, etc., are all alike in being a collection, there is a difference in their individual determinations, because their causes and conditions are different. The difference in their causes and conditions is based on the difference in their size, etc.

original: bye brag de nyid rgyu mtshan zhes brjod de /
analyzed: bye brag de nyid rgyu mtshan zhes brjod de /
translated: That difference is called the reason.

original: des don rnams kyi khyad par 'jal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des don rnams kyi khyad par 'jal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the determination of the difference of the objects.

original: bum pa dang / ras yug la sogs pa'i mtshan ma de sems las byung ba'i chos gang gis 'dzin pa de 'du shes te yongs su gcod par byed pa dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid ni 'du shes zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bum pa dang / ras yug la sogs pa'i mtshan ma de sems las byung ba'i chos gang gis 'dzin pa de 'du shes te yongs su gcod par byed pa dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid ni 'du shes zhes brjod do //
translated: That mental factor which apprehends the sign of a pot, cloth, etc. is perception. It is described as perception because it has the nature of apprehending a sign and determining an object.

original: 'du shes don gyi mtshan ma la 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: 'du shes don gyi mtshan ma la 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Perception engages the sign of the object’s meaning.

original: rnam par shes pa ni don tsam gyi 'dzin par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni don tsam gyi 'dzin par zhugs pa ste /
translated: Consciousness engages the mere apprehension of the object.

original: don gyi khyad par 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi tshos sems las byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pas ni don gyi khyad par 'dzin pa'i nus pa dang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gyi khyad par 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi tshos sems las byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pas ni don gyi khyad par 'dzin pa'i nus pa dang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also endowed with the capacity to apprehend the object’s particularities because it is concomitant with mental factors that have the nature of apprehending the object’s particularities.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos gang gis bum pa dang ras yug dang / shing rta la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i don gyi khyad par yongs su gcod par 'gyur ba ni 'du shes zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos gang gis bum pa dang ras yug dang / shing rta la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i don gyi khyad par yongs su gcod par 'gyur ba ni 'du shes zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, that mental factor concomitant with consciousness which determines the object’s particularity, the entity of a pot, cloth, chariot, etc. is described as perception.

original: de lta bu'i 'du shes ni mi ldan pa'i ming dang don gcig la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'du shes ni mi ldan pa'i ming dang don gcig la 'jug ste /
translated: Such a notion is synonymous with the term “unreal imagination.”

original: ming gis ni don @245a * //
analyzed: ming gis ni don @245a * //
translated: Name makes the object

original: gsal bar byed la /
analyzed: gsal bar byed la /
translated: clear.

original: 'du shes kyis ni yang dag par shes par byed de /
analyzed: 'du shes kyis ni yang dag par shes par byed de /
translated: Notion makes it known in reality.

original: des na ming dang don gyi mtshan ma'i brda shes pa ni gsal ba ste /
analyzed: des na ming dang don gyi mtshan ma'i brda shes pa ni gsal ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of the conventional symbol of the sign of name and object is clear.

original: de ni tshig ming la 'jug la ming ni don la ste /
analyzed: de ni tshig ming la 'jug la ming ni don la ste /
translated: Name enters into the word, and the word enters into the object.

original: de'i phyir ngag ming la 'jug la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngag ming la 'jug la /
translated: Therefore, speech enters into name,

original: ming gis ni don rjod par byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: ming gis ni don rjod par byed ces bya'o //
translated: and name is said to express the object.

original: tha snyad la ma byang ba'i 'du shes ni mi gsal ba'i phyir ming gis don la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: tha snyad la ma byang ba'i 'du shes ni mi gsal ba'i phyir ming gis don la mi 'jug ste /
translated: Notion that is not skilled in conventional expressions is unclear, and therefore it does not enter into the object by means of name.

original: ming gis don sgrub par yang mi nus so //
analyzed: ming gis don sgrub par yang mi nus so //
translated: It is also unable to establish the object by means of name.

original: de nyid ni ming don dang bcas pa la 'dzin pas 'du shes so //
analyzed: de nyid ni ming don dang bcas pa la 'dzin pas 'du shes so //
translated: It is just that notion grasps name and object together.

original: rten gyi bye brag gis ni drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: rten gyi bye brag gis ni drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: It is of six kinds, according to the different sense organs,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bar du'o //
translated: from that associated with eye consciousness to that associated with mind consciousness.

original: yang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: There are three types of each of these.

original: chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa'o //
translated: They are small, medium, and great.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregate of perception has been explained.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa /
translated: The aggregate of formation is described from the perspective of the aggregate of formation.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The aggregate of formation is twofold:

original: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: that which is associated with mind and that which is not associated with mind.

original: de la rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang rdzas mtshungs pas sems dang mnyam du rab tu 'jug pas sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de la rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang rdzas mtshungs pas sems dang mnyam du rab tu 'jug pas sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
translated: That which is associated with mind is so called because it operates in conjunction with mind through the sameness of basis, object, aspect, time, and substance.

original: sems pa la sogs pa nas tha ma bzod pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sems pa la sogs pa nas tha ma bzod pa'i bar du'o //
translated: It is from intention up to discernment.

original: de dag gi nang nas rtsod pa'i bar gyur pa dang / 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur mas tshor ba dang / 'du shes phyung nas logs shig tu phung por gzhag go //
analyzed: de dag gi nang nas rtsod pa'i bar gyur pa dang / 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur mas tshor ba dang / 'du shes phyung nas logs shig tu phung por gzhag go //
translated: From among those, the aggregate of formation is established separately by extracting feeling and perception, which are the causes of dispute and the causes of cyclic existence.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba sems pa la sogs pa dang / thob pa la sogs pa sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed 'di dag nyid 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba sems pa la sogs pa dang / thob pa la sogs pa sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed 'di dag nyid 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: The other mental factors such as volition, and the formations dissociated from the mind such as acquisition, are the formations aggregate.

original: de la sems dang mtshungs par ldan pas ni sems pa dang reg pa dang yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang /
analyzed: de la sems dang mtshungs par ldan pas ni sems pa dang reg pa dang yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang /
translated: Among them, the mental factors that are concomitant with the mind are volition, contact, attention, aspiration, resolution, faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang // dpyod pa dang / bag med pa dang / bag yod pa dang / skyo ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / shin tu ma sbyangs pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang // dpyod pa dang / bag med pa dang / bag yod pa dang / skyo ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / shin tu ma sbyangs pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang /
translated: discursive thought, investigation, nonembarrassment, embarrassment, depression, joy, pliancy, nonpliancy, violence,

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod @245b pa dang / btang snyoms dang / rnam par grol ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod @245b pa dang / btang snyoms dang / rnam par grol ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba dang /
translated: non-violence, shame, embarrassment, equanimity, liberation, roots of virtue, roots of non-virtue, roots of neutral [phenomena],

original: kun tu sbyor ba dang / nges par 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / zag pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa dang / mdud pa dang /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba dang / nges par 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / zag pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa dang / mdud pa dang /
translated: fetters, bonds, negative tendencies, secondary afflictions, entanglements, defilements, floods, bonds, appropriators, knots,

original: sgrib pa dang / shes pa dang / bzod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang / shes pa dang / bzod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: obstructions, cognitions, and acceptances.

original: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ming bstan zin to //
analyzed: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ming bstan zin to //
translated: The names of those that are concomitant with the mind have been explained.

original: yang 'du byed kyi chos gzhan gang dag gzugs can ma yin pa nyid du mtshungs pas sems dang rigs gcig pa de dag ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed de /
analyzed: yang 'du byed kyi chos gzhan gang dag gzugs can ma yin pa nyid du mtshungs pas sems dang rigs gcig pa de dag ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed de /
translated: Now, those other phenomena that are conditioned and similar in being non-physical, and of the same type as the mind, are called mental factors.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: thob pa dang / ma thob pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / srog gi dbang po dang / skal pa mnyam pa dang / gnas so sor thob pa dang /
analyzed: thob pa dang / ma thob pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / srog gi dbang po dang / skal pa mnyam pa dang / gnas so sor thob pa dang /
translated: obtainment, nonobtainment, the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, the meditative attainment of cessation, nondiscernment, the faculty of life force, homogeneity, the obtainment of a specific realm,

original: dngos po so sor thob pa dang / skye mched so sor thob pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs dang / rkyen tshogs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po so sor thob pa dang / skye mched so sor thob pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs dang / rkyen tshogs pa med pa dang /
