translated: the obtainment of a specific entity, the obtainment of a specific sense base, birth, aging, enduring, impermanence, the collection of names, the collection of words, the collection of letters, the nonassembly of conditions,

original: rkyen tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen tshogs pa ste /
translated: and the assembly of conditions.

original: 'di rnams ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed do //
translated: These are the formations not concomitant with mind.

original: de la sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las te /
analyzed: de la sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las te /
translated: Intention is the mental activity that forms the mind and is mental karma.

original: ji ltar rgyal po rnams blon pos bya ba de dang / de la 'jug par byed pa de bzhin du sems kyang sems pas bya ba dang bcas pa'i ngo bor de dang der ston par byed do ;
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po rnams blon pos bya ba de dang / de la 'jug par byed pa de bzhin du sems kyang sems pas bya ba dang bcas pa'i ngo bor de dang der ston par byed do ;
translated: Just as a king is the one who acts and engages in various activities, so too the mind is the one who acts and engages in various activities, because it is the one who shows itself in various activities through intention.

original: / de ni 'du byed rnams 'byung ba la sa bon gyi ngo bor gnas te /
analyzed: / de ni 'du byed rnams 'byung ba la sa bon gyi ngo bor gnas te /
translated: It is the seed of the arising of formations.

original: 'gro ba sna tshogs las las skyes la de ni las kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba sna tshogs las las skyes la de ni las kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The various destinies of sentient beings arise from karma, and intention is the nature of karma.

original: yang de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is threefold:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.

original: yang dbye na sems pa'i tshogs drug tu 'gyur te ;
analyzed: yang dbye na sems pa'i tshogs drug tu 'gyur te ;
translated: Moreover, it is divided into six groups of intentions:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bar du'o //
translated: those associated with eye consciousness up to those associated with mental consciousness.

original: de la reg pa gang zhe na /🔽ji ltar chu la char bab par gyur pa las /
analyzed: de la reg pa gang zhe na /🔽ji ltar chu la char bab par gyur pa las /
translated: What is contact?🔽It is the coming together of three.

original: chu'i chu bur 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du dbang po rnams rang rang gi yul @246a * //🔽la 'jug pa las mig la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs mthong ba la sogs pa'i rang rang gi rnam par shes pa nye bar 'byung ba'am yang na pha dang ma la brten nas bu la sogs pa 'byung ba de bzhin du dbang po dang yul
analyzed: chu'i chu bur 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du dbang po rnams rang rang gi yul @246a * // la 'jug pa las mig la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs mthong ba la sogs pa'i rang rang gi rnam par shes pa nye bar 'byung ba'am yang na pha dang ma la brten nas bu la sogs pa 'byung ba de bzhin du dbang po dang yul
translated: Just as bubbles arise in water, so too, when the sense faculties engage their objects, the respective consciousnesses such as eye consciousness arise in dependence on the eye and form.

original: la brten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na de la bu'i gnas lta bu'am /
analyzed: la brten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na de la bu'i gnas lta bu'am /
translated: Or, just as a son arises in dependence on a father and mother, so too, when consciousness arises in dependence on a sense faculty and object, it is like the abode of a son.🔽Or, it is like the abode of a water bubble.

original: chu'i chu bur gyi gnas lta bu'i rnam par shes pa dang / yul dang dbang po gsum nye bar 'dus pa las skyes pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i chu bur gyi gnas lta bu'i rnam par shes pa dang / yul dang dbang po gsum nye bar 'dus pa las skyes pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: Contact arises from the union of the three: the consciousness that is like the abode of a son or like the abode of a water bubble, the object, and the sense faculty.

original: yang na reg pa'i rgyur dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams nye bar 'dus pa na ste /
analyzed: yang na reg pa'i rgyur dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams nye bar 'dus pa na ste /
translated: Or, when the sense faculty, object, and consciousness unite as the cause of contact.

original: nye bar 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni gsum po rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor gnas pa rnams kyi gang phan tshun ltos pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni gsum po rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor gnas pa rnams kyi gang phan tshun ltos pa'o //
translated: The term “coming together” refers to the mutual dependence of the three that exist in the nature of cause and result.

original: yang de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, that coming together is of three types:

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: that which is experienced as pleasure, that which is experienced as pain, and that which is experienced as neither pleasure nor pain.

original: yang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: It is also of six types:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'dus te reg pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'dus te reg pa'i bar du'o //
translated: from the coming together of the eye consciousness up to the coming together of the mind consciousness.

original: yid la byed pa ni sems yul la 'jug pa ste yul la gtod po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems yul la 'jug pa ste yul la gtod po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Attention is the engagement of the mind with an object. It is what directs the mind to an object.

original: sems ni rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba ste spre'u lta bu yin pas de ni chos gzhan dang ma 'brel bar yul la mi gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems ni rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba ste spre'u lta bu yin pas de ni chos gzhan dang ma 'brel bar yul la mi gnas pa nyid de /
translated: The mind is naturally restless, like a monkey. It does not remain on an object without being tethered by another factor, namely, attention.

original: yul gzhan gyi bya ba la mi 'jug par yul la gnas par ni chos gzhan dang 'brel ba med par mi srid de /
analyzed: yul gzhan gyi bya ba la mi 'jug par yul la gnas par ni chos gzhan dang 'brel ba med par mi srid de /
translated: It is impossible for it to abide in an object without being related to other factors.

original: de bas na gang dang ldan pas rnam par shes pa mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la gtod pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba ni sems 'jug pa zhes bya ba ste /🔽sems kyi bya ba'i ngo bor nye bar mtshon pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos la yid la byed pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na gang dang ldan pas rnam par shes pa mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la gtod pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba ni sems 'jug pa zhes bya ba ste / sems kyi bya ba'i ngo bor nye bar mtshon pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos la yid la byed pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: Therefore, that which causes consciousness to be directed toward the object that is desired is called the “engagement of mind.”🔽The factor that is the nature of the activity of mind is called mental attention.

original: yid la byed bas na yid la byed pa ste /🔽yul 'ga' zhig la sems gnas par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don nam /
analyzed: yid la byed bas na yid la byed pa ste / yul 'ga' zhig la sems gnas par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don nam /
translated: It is called mental attention because it attends to the mind.🔽It has the meaning of causing the mind to abide in a certain object.

original: yul yid la byed pa na yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: yul yid la byed pa na yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Or, it is called mental attention because it attends to the object.

original: gang gi stobs kyis rnam par shes pa yul yid la byed pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi stobs kyis rnam par shes pa yul yid la byed pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the consciousness that attends to the object by the power of mental attention.

original: ting nge 'dzin na rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po'i chos te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin na rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po'i chos te /
translated: In samādhi, it is the factor that is the antidote to distraction.

original: sems kyi rgyun dmigs pa gcig pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun dmigs pa gcig pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is the cause of the continuity of mind being focused on a single object.

original: yid la byed pa ni yul la sems de'i dus su mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni yul la sems de'i dus su mi gtong ba'o //
translated: The mental application is the non-abandonment of the mind with regard to the object at that time.

original: yang de ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang de ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it is threefold:

original: @246b slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: @246b slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin no //
translated: the training, the non-training, and that which is neither the training nor the non-training.

original: de la gang zag bdun ni slob pa ste /
analyzed: de la gang zag bdun ni slob pa ste /
translated: The seven persons are the training.

original: nyon mongs pa lhag ma spang bar bya ba ni phyir bslab par bya ba yod pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa lhag ma spang bar bya ba ni phyir bslab par bya ba yod pas so //
translated: Because the training is still to be undertaken in order to abandon the remaining defilements.

original: bdun po gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: bdun po gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: Which are the seven?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mnon  du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mnon  du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang /
translated: The one who has entered into the result of stream-enterer, the stream-enterer, the one who has entered into the result of once-returner, the once-returner, the one who has entered into the result of non-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya ba 'di rnams so //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya ba 'di rnams so //
translated: the non-returner, and the one who has entered into the result of arhatship.

original: gang zag bdun po rnams kyi rgyud la zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa de ni slob pa'i yid la byed pa'o //🔽dgra bcom pa ni mi slob pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag bdun po rnams kyi rgyud la zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa de ni slob pa'i yid la byed pa'o // dgra bcom pa ni mi slob pa ste /
translated: The mental attention of the learner is the uncontaminated meditative concentration concomitant with the mindstreams of the seven learners.

original: de'i zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni mi slob pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni mi slob pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The mental attention of the nonlearner is the uncontaminated meditative concentration concomitant with the mindstream of the arhat.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The mental attention of neither learner nor nonlearner is concomitant with contaminated minds.

original: de ltar yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Thus there are three types of mental attention.

original: 'dun pa ni rnam par shes pa'i byed pa 'dod pa nyid de ;
analyzed: 'dun pa ni rnam par shes pa'i byed pa 'dod pa nyid de ;
translated: Aspiration is the desire to cognize.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang 'brel pas bza' ba dang / 'gro ba dang / gtso bo dang / bum pa dang / snam bu dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba la bdag gis 'di bya'o snyam du byed 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems las byung ba'i chos ni 'dun pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang 'brel pas bza' ba dang / 'gro ba dang / gtso bo dang / bum pa dang / snam bu dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba la bdag gis 'di bya'o snyam du byed 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems las byung ba'i chos ni 'dun pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The mental factor that is associated with the mind and that is characterized by the desire to act, thinking “I will do this” in regard to eating, walking, the main point, a pot, a cloth, virtue, or nonvirtue is called aspiration.

original: yid la byed 'dod pa yod pas byed 'dod pa ste de'i ngo bo ni byed 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid la byed 'dod pa yod pas byed 'dod pa ste de'i ngo bo ni byed 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: It is the desire to act because it is the desire to mentally engage. Its nature is the desire to act.

original: de'i ngo bo gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is its nature?

original: de ni 'dun pa nyid do gang gis de byed 'dod par 'gyur ro //🔽de la ji ltar za ma tog gi nang du bcug nas kha bcad pa'i sbrul ni 'byung zhing 'gro ba'i bya ba la rtsol ba glod de gnas la ;
analyzed: de ni 'dun pa nyid do gang gis de byed 'dod par 'gyur ro // de la ji ltar za ma tog gi nang du bcug nas kha bcad pa'i sbrul ni 'byung zhing 'gro ba'i bya ba la rtsol ba glod de gnas la ;
translated: It is aspiration itself, by which one desires to act.🔽In this regard, a snake that is placed in a box and whose head is covered remains without exerting itself in the activity of emerging.

original: sbrul 'dzin byed pas bskul zhing bslang ba na ni 'byung ba'i bya ba la rtsol ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbrul 'dzin byed pas bskul zhing bslang ba na ni 'byung ba'i bya ba la rtsol ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: But when it is urged and aroused by a snake charmer, it emerges with exertion.

original: de bzhin du sems kyang sems las byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pas nye bar gyur ba'i yul la rtsol ba med pa bor nas rtsol ba dang bcas pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o //🔽de lta bu ni @247a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyang sems las byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pas nye bar gyur ba'i yul la rtsol ba med pa bor nas rtsol ba dang bcas pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o // de lta bu ni @247a * //
translated: In the same way, the mind, having become associated with mental factors, is directed to the object to which it is directed, and it occurs with effort, having abandoned the effortless.🔽This is the activity of attention.

original: sems las byung ba'i las so //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i las so //
translated: The activity of mental factors

original: ji ltar yul gang la bya ba dang bcas pa'i sbrul de nyid yul de la gtod pa dang bcas pas gtod par gyur pa de bzhin du yul gang la sems las byung ba gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems bya ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba'i yul de
analyzed: ji ltar yul gang la bya ba dang bcas pa'i sbrul de nyid yul de la gtod pa dang bcas pas gtod par gyur pa de bzhin du yul gang la sems las byung ba gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems bya ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba'i yul de
translated: Just as the snake, having activity with regard to its object, is directed to that object, in the same way, the mind, having activity with regard to its object, is directed to that object by attention.🔽This is the difference in the activity of attention.

original: nyid la yid la byed pas ni gtod pa dang bcas par 'gyur bas 'di ni yid la byed pa'i las kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: nyid la yid la byed pas ni gtod pa dang bcas par 'gyur bas 'di ni yid la byed pa'i las kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The activity of the formative forces associated with thought

original: de ltar brjod pa'i chos sems pa dang yid la byed pa'i sngon du 'dun pa 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i chos sems pa dang yid la byed pa'i sngon du 'dun pa 'gro ba ste /
translated: Desire precedes the mental factors of thought and attention that have been described.

original: gang du 'dun pa zhugs pa der sems pa dang yid la byed pa dag 'byung ba na yang rta'i bya ba'i khyad par ltar sngon du nye bar mtshon te sems pa dang yid la byed pa dag rang gi yul la 'jug pa na skul bar byed pa nyid
analyzed: gang du 'dun pa zhugs pa der sems pa dang yid la byed pa dag 'byung ba na yang rta'i bya ba'i khyad par ltar sngon du nye bar mtshon te sems pa dang yid la byed pa dag rang gi yul la 'jug pa na skul bar byed pa nyid
translated: When intention and mental attention arise in relation to an object, then just as the particular action of a horse is indicated prior to the action of the rider, intention and mental attention are said to be the instigators of the mind that engages its object.

original: kyis so // gal te byed par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'dun pa kha cig tu 'byung bar ma gyur na ni yul nges par ma mthong bas rang bzhin gyis bems bo ltar gang yang 'jug par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: kyis so // gal te byed par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'dun pa kha cig tu 'byung bar ma gyur na ni yul nges par ma mthong bas rang bzhin gyis bems bo ltar gang yang 'jug par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: If the desire that is characterized by the wish to act does not occur in relation to a particular object, then the mind will not engage any object, just as if it were inert matter, because it would not see the object as something definite.

original: de bas na 'di ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can /
translated: Therefore, it is said that “these five appropriated aggregates have desire as their root,

original: 'dun pa'i rgyu can /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i rgyu can /
translated: desire as their source,

original: 'dun pa las kun du 'byung zhing 'dun pa'i mthus 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa las kun du 'byung zhing 'dun pa'i mthus 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: desire as their origin, and desire is what brings them into existence.”

original: 'di dang sred pa la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di dang sred pa la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between this and craving?

original: ji ltar la cas shing tsha ba gnyis 'byar bar byed pa ltar sred pa ni sems yul la mngon par zhen cing chags pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar la cas shing tsha ba gnyis 'byar bar byed pa ltar sred pa ni sems yul la mngon par zhen cing chags pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Just as a glue that sticks two pieces of wood together, craving is the cause of the mind's attachment and clinging to objects.

original: 'dun pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dun pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Aspiration is not like that.

original: de ni bya ba'i bsam pa tsam nyid kyis 'jug pas sred pa las 'dun pa de ltar tha dad do ;
analyzed: de ni bya ba'i bsam pa tsam nyid kyis 'jug pas sred pa las 'dun pa de ltar tha dad do ;
translated: It engages by merely the intention to act. Thus aspiration is different from craving.

original: / de yang 'di ltar 'di na gnas pa'i gang zag 'ga' khams gong ma 'dod pas gsol ba 'debs te /
analyzed: / de yang 'di ltar 'di na gnas pa'i gang zag 'ga' khams gong ma 'dod pas gsol ba 'debs te /
translated: Moreover, a person who lives here in the desire realm may aspire to higher realms and pray,🔽Alas, how can I attain the absorptions or formless states?

original: ae ma'o bsam gtan nam gzugs med pa bdag gis ji ltar 'thob ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du ji ltar bdag gis zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ae ma'o bsam gtan nam gzugs med pa bdag gis ji ltar 'thob ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du ji ltar bdag gis zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: Similarly, How can I manifest the elimination of the contaminants? and How can I realize the path?

original: de ltar smon pa de ni sred pa zhes brjod par mi bya'o 'on kyang de ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar smon pa de ni sred pa zhes brjod par mi bya'o 'on kyang de ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa yin te /
translated: Aspiration is not called craving, but it is aspiration for virtuous Dharmas.

original: sred pa dang 'gal ba'i yul la skyes pas so //
analyzed: sred pa dang 'gal ba'i yul la skyes pas so //
translated: It arises in relation to objects that are incompatible with craving.

original: sems yul la lhag par 'dod pa ni mos pa ste /
analyzed: sems yul la lhag par 'dod pa ni mos pa ste /
translated: Interest is the desire for a special object.

original: lhag pa'i sgra ni dbang du bya ba @247b ste ;
analyzed: lhag pa'i sgra ni dbang du bya ba @247b ste ;
translated: The prefix adhi in adhimukti means “special.”

original: rang gi yul la mos pa'i shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo gang me la phye ma leb ltar lhag par mos pa ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi yul la mos pa'i shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo gang me la phye ma leb ltar lhag par mos pa ni mos pa'o //
translated: Interest is the desire for a special object, like a moth for a flame.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang ldan pas rnam par shes pa yul la so so ma yin par bsdus par gyur pa de ni sems las byung ba'i chos mos pa'o //🔽yid la byed pa dang khyad par ni yul yid la byed pa ni yid la lhag par byed pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang ldan pas rnam par shes pa yul la so so ma yin par bsdus par gyur pa de ni sems las byung ba'i chos mos pa'o // yid la byed pa dang khyad par ni yul yid la byed pa ni yid la lhag par byed pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The mental factor of interest is the mental factor that causes consciousness to be drawn to an object without resistance.🔽Attention is the directing of the mind to an object.

original: 'di ni yul la lhag par byed pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di ni yul la lhag par byed pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: The difference between attention and interest is that attention is the directing of the mind to an object, while interest is the desire for a special object.

original: dad pa ni bden pa dang / dkon mchog dang / las dang 'bras bu la mngon par yid ches pa'o //🔽de la bden pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: dad pa ni bden pa dang / dkon mchog dang / las dang 'bras bu la mngon par yid ches pa'o // de la bden pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: Faith is the clarity of mind that is the opposite of the three types of doubt.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Doubt is the uncertainty that thinks, “Is this the path or not?🔽Is this a virtuous or nonvirtuous action?🔽Is there a result or not?🔽Is there a Buddha or not?🔽Is there a Dharma or not?🔽Is there a Sangha or not?”🔽Faith is the opposite of that.🔽It is the clarity of mind that is the opposite of the three types of doubt.

original: yang na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or else, there are two:

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the conventional and the ultimate.

original: dkon mchog ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog ni gsum ste /
translated: The Jewels are three:

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun no //
translated: the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: las ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: las ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Action is meritorious, non-meritorious, and unshakable.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The result is the ripened effect and the effect of uniform outflow.

original: de dag nyid la skur pa 'debs pa ni log par lta ba ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid la skur pa 'debs pa ni log par lta ba ste /
translated: Denial of these is wrong view,

original: med pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
translated: which is the absence of the idea of existence.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ste /🔽de lta bu'i yang dag pa'i lta bas rtogs pa'i yod pa la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ste / de lta bu'i yang dag pa'i lta bas rtogs pa'i yod pa la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: Right worldly view is the idea of existence.🔽Faith is the aspect of conviction in the existence that is understood by such right view.

original: dad pa'i stobs kyis yod pa de dag nges par 'dzin pa de ni ma dad pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs kyis yod pa de dag nges par 'dzin pa de ni ma dad pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'o //
translated: The power of faith is the apprehension of that existence. It is the antidote to lack of faith.

original: de yang ji ltar rnyog pa dang bcas pa'i chu la nor bu chu'i dang byed kyis chu'i rnyog pa rnams bas la nas chu rab tu dang bar byed pa de bzhin du dad pa'i nor bu yang sems kyi rdzing bung byung nas ma dang pa'i rnyog pa bsal🔽te yid dang bar byed do //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rnyog pa dang bcas pa'i chu la nor bu chu'i dang byed kyis chu'i rnyog pa rnams bas la nas chu rab tu dang bar byed pa de bzhin du dad pa'i nor bu yang sems kyi rdzing bung byung nas ma dang pa'i rnyog pa bsal te yid dang bar byed do //
translated: Just as a water-purifying gem, placed in a muddy pond, does not make the water clear by its mere presence, but rather when the pond is stirred, then the particles of mud settle to the bottom and the water becomes clear; in the same way, the gem of faith, when it is placed in the pond of the mind, does not immediately clear the turbidity of the mind, but rather when the mind is stirred by the wind of wisdom, then the particles of mental turbidity settle to the bottom and the mind becomes clear.

original: yid dang bar byas pas ji ltar yongs su dag pa'i me long la gzugs brnyan gyi tshul gyis bden pa dang dkon mchog la sogs pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid dang bar byas pas ji ltar yongs su dag pa'i me long la gzugs brnyan gyi tshul gyis bden pa dang dkon mchog la sogs pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having become clear, the mind becomes like a clear mirror, in which the images of the truths, the jewels, etc. appear.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i chos la spro ba ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i chos la spro ba ste /
translated: Diligence is the delight in virtue.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang ldan pas sems dge ba'i chos bsdu ba la spro bar 'gyur ba le lo'i gnyen por gyur ba'i chos ni brtson 'grus so //🔽gang byas pa dang byed pa'i @248a * //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang ldan pas sems dge ba'i chos bsdu ba la spro bar 'gyur ba le lo'i gnyen por gyur ba'i chos ni brtson 'grus so // gang byas pa dang byed pa'i @248a * //
translated: It is that mental factor which, when present, causes the mind to delight in the collection of virtuous dharmas, and which is the antidote to laziness.

original: las la sems kyi brjed pa med pa ste /
analyzed: las la sems kyi brjed pa med pa ste /
translated: It is the non-forgetting of what has been done and what is being done.

original: sems kyi mngon par brjod pa ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi mngon par brjod pa ni dran pa'o //
translated: Mental expression is memory.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: Concentration is one-pointedness of mind.

original: rtse ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rtse ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: The peak is the objective support.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang ldan pas sems kyi rgyun dmigs pa gcig la nges par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang ldan pas sems kyi rgyun dmigs pa gcig la nges par gnas pa ste /
translated: It is a factor of the mind that causes the stream of mind to remain fixed on a single objective support.

original: de ni sems las byung ba'i chos ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sems las byung ba'i chos ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called concentration, a factor of the mind.

original: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Discrimination is the thorough differentiation of dharmas.

original: rnam par 'byed pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo mang po ril po gcig lta bur gyur pa'i don la 'dis so sor rtogs pas rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo mang po ril po gcig lta bur gyur pa'i don la 'dis so sor rtogs pas rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Thorough differentiation is the thorough differentiation of the meaning of the totality of the entities of existence, as if they were a single whole.

original: khyad par can du rnam par 'byed pa ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par can du rnam par 'byed pa ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Thorough differentiation is the thorough differentiation of the special.

original: blo yid dngos po'i cha rnam par phye nas 'di'i rang gi ngo bo ci zhes te /
analyzed: blo yid dngos po'i cha rnam par phye nas 'di'i rang gi ngo bo ci zhes te /
translated: Having differentiated the aspects of the entities of existence with the mind, one thinks, “What is its own nature?”

original: nye bar dmigs pa'i don la nges par snying po ci zhig yod ces de lta bu'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa'i don la nges par snying po ci zhig yod ces de lta bu'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Engaging in that way, one thinks, “What is the essence of the object that is apprehended?”

original: dper na chu shing gi sdong po la snying po 'dod pas rnam par phye ba lta bu ste /🔽ji ltar 'ga' zhig snying po 'dod pas chu shing gi sdong po shun pa dang shun pa tha dad du legs bar rnam par phye nas btsal ba na snying po cung zad kyang mi rnyed pa ltar blo gros dang ldan pas gang zag dang chos rnams kyi rang
analyzed: dper na chu shing gi sdong po la snying po 'dod pas rnam par phye ba lta bu ste / ji ltar 'ga' zhig snying po 'dod pas chu shing gi sdong po shun pa dang shun pa tha dad du legs bar rnam par phye nas btsal ba na snying po cung zad kyang mi rnyed pa ltar blo gros dang ldan pas gang zag dang chos rnams kyi rang
translated: It is like the trunk of a plantain tree, which, when peeled, has no core.

original: gi ngo bo yongs su btsal ba na snying po cung zad kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gi ngo bo yongs su btsal ba na snying po cung zad kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: Just as someone seeking the core of a plantain tree peels away the outer layers, and when searching well, does not find even the slightest core, so when the wise search for the intrinsic reality of persons and things, they do not observe even the slightest core.

original: de la gang zag ces bya ba ni bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba'o //🔽de yang 'di ltar khyim dang / phreng ba dang / shing rta dang / nags tshal la sogs pa ltar nye bar brten nas rnam par gdags te /
analyzed: de la gang zag ces bya ba ni bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba'o // de yang 'di ltar khyim dang / phreng ba dang / shing rta dang / nags tshal la sogs pa ltar nye bar brten nas rnam par gdags te /
translated: Here, a person is a self, a sentient being, a living being, and a nourished being.🔽Moreover, it is imputed in dependence, like a house, a garland, a chariot, a forest, and so on.

original: ji ltar khyim ni rtsva dang 'od ma dang sa la sogs pa'i rgyu la nye bar brten nas sgrub ste /
analyzed: ji ltar khyim ni rtsva dang 'od ma dang sa la sogs pa'i rgyu la nye bar brten nas sgrub ste /
translated: A house is established in dependence on causes such as grass, bamboo, and earth.

original: de yongs su rdzogs par gyur ba dang / char dang / rlung dang / nyi ma yongs su skyong ba la mkho bar gyur na yang rang gi ngo bor grub pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs par gyur ba dang / char dang / rlung dang / nyi ma yongs su skyong ba la mkho bar gyur na yang rang gi ngo bor grub pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When it is completely finished, even though it is useful for protecting against rain, wind, and sun, it does not exist in its own intrinsic reality.

original: gal te de'i ngo bor yod na rtsva la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang gzung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de'i ngo bor yod na rtsva la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang gzung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it existed in its own intrinsic reality, it would be apprehended even without depending on grass, etc.

original: 'di dag ni rgyur gyur pa rtsva la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rgyur gyur pa rtsva la sogs pa'o //
translated: These are the causes, grass, etc.

original: 'di ni de'i 'bras bur gyur pa khyim mo zhes bya bar gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i 'bras bur gyur pa khyim mo zhes bya bar gyur na /
translated: This is the effect, the house.

original: de ltar na ni mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni mi 'dzin te /
translated: But it is not apprehended in that way.

original: de bas na 'di rang gi ngo bor ni med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di rang gi ngo bor ni med do //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist in its own intrinsic reality.

original: gal te 'di rang gi ngo bor yod na ni des na gzhan la brten par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'di rang gi ngo bor yod na ni des na gzhan la brten par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it existed in its own intrinsic reality, then it would not depend on another,

original: rang gi ngo bor @248b grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor @248b grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be established in its own intrinsic reality.

original: gang rang gi ngo bor grub pa ni gzhan la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rang gi ngo bor grub pa ni gzhan la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is established in its own intrinsic reality does not depend on another.

original: gzhan la ltos pa ma yin pa ni ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa ma yin pa ni ma byas pa'o //
translated: That which does not depend on another is not a product.

original: gang la byas pa ni rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: gang la byas pa ni rtag pa yin la /
translated: That which is a product is permanent.

original: rtag pa ni rgyu med pa yin pas rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos pa'i rtag pa ni mo gsham gyi bu ltar yod pa ma yin na yang 'jig rten na khyim zhes bya ba yang yod de /
analyzed: rtag pa ni rgyu med pa yin pas rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos pa'i rtag pa ni mo gsham gyi bu ltar yod pa ma yin na yang 'jig rten na khyim zhes bya ba yang yod de /
translated: However, in the world, there is something called a “house.”

original: des na de rang gi ngo bor grub pa ni med la /
analyzed: des na de rang gi ngo bor grub pa ni med la /
translated: Therefore, it is not established as its own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bor grub pa med pas med pa nyid du ltung bar 'gyur ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor grub pa med pas med pa nyid du ltung bar 'gyur ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not established as its own nature, it does not fall into nonexistence.

original: gal te mo gsham gyi bu ltar gyur na rtsva la sogs pa la nye bar brten nas /🔽rnam par gdags par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te mo gsham gyi bu ltar gyur na rtsva la sogs pa la nye bar brten nas / rnam par gdags par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it were like the son of a barren woman, it would not be imputed in dependence on grass and so on.

original: char dang nyi ma la sogs pa skyob par yang mi 'gyur ro //🔽de lta bas na rang gi ngo bor med pas ni de med la /
analyzed: char dang nyi ma la sogs pa skyob par yang mi 'gyur ro // de lta bas na rang gi ngo bor med pas ni de med la /
translated: It would not be protected from rain, sun, and so on.🔽Therefore, since it does not exist as its own nature, it is not nonexistent.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas byas pa'i yod pa nyid kyis de med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas byas pa'i yod pa nyid kyis de med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Since it exists as a dependent arising, it is not nonexistent.

original: rdzas su yod par gyur pa bden par yod pa nyid kyis zhen par yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: rdzas su yod par gyur pa bden par yod pa nyid kyis zhen par yang 'gyur na /
translated: If it were to exist substantially, it would be apprehended as truly existent.

original: rdzas su med de gzugs brnyan lta bu'o //
analyzed: rdzas su med de gzugs brnyan lta bu'o //
translated: It is not substantially real, like a reflection.

original: zhen pa las ni 'khor ba na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhen pa las ni 'khor ba na 'gyur ro //
translated: From attachment, there is cyclic existence.

original: dngos po med pas ye med pa nyid ces bya bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po med pas ye med pa nyid ces bya bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is not a real entity, it is not non-existent.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la nye bar brten pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la nye bar brten pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the presentation of dependent origination would be undermined.

original: des na 'di ltar rjes su med pa'i dngos po'i don rnam par gnas pa ni kun rdzob tsam du gnas pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon par zhen par bya ba'i gnas su ma gyur pa gang la bde ba'i don du sgro btags
analyzed: des na 'di ltar rjes su med pa'i dngos po'i don rnam par gnas pa ni kun rdzob tsam du gnas pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon par zhen par bya ba'i gnas su ma gyur pa gang la bde ba'i don du sgro btags
translated: Thus, the meaning of a non-existent entity is established as mere convention, empty of intrinsic reality, not a basis for the noble ones to cling to, and is imputed for the sake of happiness.

original: pas ni phyin ci log nyid de /
analyzed: pas ni phyin ci log nyid de /
translated: It is a mistake

original: gzhan dag tu gnas la gzhan dag tu bzung ba nyid kyis thag pa bsdogs pa la sbrul du bzung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu gnas la gzhan dag tu bzung ba nyid kyis thag pa bsdogs pa la sbrul du bzung ba lta bu'o //
translated: to apprehend it as something else, like apprehending a coiled rope as a snake.

original: khyim gyi bshad pa 'di nyid kyis phreng ba dang / nags tshal dang / shing rta'i bshad pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim gyi bshad pa 'di nyid kyis phreng ba dang / nags tshal dang / shing rta'i bshad pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The explanations of the “garland,” the “forest,” and the “chariot” should be understood in the same way as the explanation of the “house.”

original: ji skad bshad pa'i khyim la sogs pa ltar bdag dang chos kyang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i khyim la sogs pa ltar bdag dang chos kyang bshad par bya'o //
translated: The self and phenomena should be explained in the same way as the house and so on.

original: ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How so?

original: de la rtsva la sogs pa la nye bar brten nas khyim rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la rjes su brten nas bdag ces nye bar 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: de la rtsva la sogs pa la nye bar brten nas khyim rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la rjes su brten nas bdag ces nye bar 'dogs pa'am /
translated: Just as a house is posited in dependence on such things as grass, in the same way, the self is imputed in dependence on the five appropriated aggregates called form, feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness.

original: @249a * // khams drug pos dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: @249a * // khams drug pos dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Or it is imputed in dependence on the six constituents called earth, water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug po mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba la nye bar brten nas 'dogs so //
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug po mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba la nye bar brten nas 'dogs so //
translated: The six bases of contact are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: de lta bu'i bdag ni bdag tu rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu la ma ltos par grub pa med pa nyid de khyim la sogs pa rang gi ngo bor med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bdag ni bdag tu rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu la ma ltos par grub pa med pa nyid de khyim la sogs pa rang gi ngo bor med pa lta bu'o //
translated: Such a self is not established without depending on the cause for positing a self, just as a house, etc., do not exist by way of their own nature.

original: gal te yod na ni rang gi rgyu la ma ltos par nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar dmigs pa yang med do //
analyzed: gal te yod na ni rang gi rgyu la ma ltos par nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar dmigs pa yang med do //
translated: If it existed, it would be perceived without depending on its cause, but it is not perceived in that way.

original: des na rang gi ngo bor ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na rang gi ngo bor ni med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist by way of its own nature.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bor yod na ni rang gi ngo bor de ltar gnas pa nyid kyis gzhan la ltos par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bor yod na ni rang gi ngo bor de ltar gnas pa nyid kyis gzhan la ltos par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it existed by way of its own nature, it would not depend on another because it would remain just as it is by way of its own nature.

original: gzhan la mi ltos pa ni byas pa ma yin pas rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la mi ltos pa ni byas pa ma yin pas rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And since it would not depend on another, it would not be produced and would be permanent.

original: rtag pa ni rgyu med pa yin la /
analyzed: rtag pa ni rgyu med pa yin la /
translated: And the permanent is causeless.

original: rgyu med pa nyid ni bong bu'i rva bzhin du dmigs par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid ni bong bu'i rva bzhin du dmigs par mi 'gyur na /
translated: And since it would be causeless, it would not be perceived, like the horn of an ass.

original: bdag 'di ni rang gi rgyu'i tshogs pa la nye bar brten nas dmigs te khyim bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag 'di ni rang gi rgyu'i tshogs pa la nye bar brten nas dmigs te khyim bzhin no //
translated: This self is perceived in dependence on the collection of its causes, like a house.

original: de lta bas na rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not permanent.

original: gang gi mi rtag pa nyid ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi mi rtag pa nyid ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The impermanence of that is non-existence.

original: gang dngos po med pa ni yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dngos po med pa ni yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: That which is non-existent is neither existent nor non-existent.

original: rang gi rgyu rkyen las byung ba nyid dang / rang gi ngo bor ma grub pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu rkyen las byung ba nyid dang / rang gi ngo bor ma grub pa nyid kyis te /
translated: Because it arises from its own causes and conditions, and because it does not exist as its own nature.

original: rang gi nye bar len pa la brten nas gzhag pa'i phyir dang / de la 'phags pa rnams kyis zhen pa'i gnas su ma gyur pas gzugs brnyan la tha snyad byed pa ltar rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa la brten nas gzhag pa'i phyir dang / de la 'phags pa rnams kyis zhen pa'i gnas su ma gyur pas gzugs brnyan la tha snyad byed pa ltar rnam par gnas so //
translated: Because it is posited in dependence on its own appropriation, and because it is like a reflection, being a basis for conventional usage without being a basis for the attachment of the noble ones.

original: phyin ci log tu zhugs pas ji ltar gnas pa'i rang gi ngo bo la rmongs pa'i dbang gis 'di ltar rang gi ngo bor sgro btags nas bdag ni yod do zhes 'dod de /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu zhugs pas ji ltar gnas pa'i rang gi ngo bo la rmongs pa'i dbang gis 'di ltar rang gi ngo bor sgro btags nas bdag ni yod do zhes 'dod de /
translated: Because of engaging in error, through the power of delusion regarding the nature of its existence, one superimposes its own nature and asserts, “The self exists.”

original: de ni nges par rtag pa'i mthar ltung ngo //
analyzed: de ni nges par rtag pa'i mthar ltung ngo //
translated: That is definitely falling to the extreme of permanence.

original: gang yang bdag ni med do zhes 'dod pa de yang chad pa'i mthar ltung ste /
analyzed: gang yang bdag ni med do zhes 'dod pa de yang chad pa'i mthar ltung ste /
translated: Also, the assertion that “there is no self at all” falls into the extreme of annihilation.

original: sngar khas blangs pa'i dngos po de med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: sngar khas blangs pa'i dngos po de med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because it is observed that the thing previously asserted does not exist.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' po bdag yod do zhes 'dod na de ni rtag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' po bdag yod do zhes 'dod na de ni rtag par lta ba'o //
translated: The Lord has said, “Ānanda, if you assert that the self exists, that is the view of eternalism.🔽Ānanda, if you assert that the self does not exist, that is the view of annihilation.”

original: kun dga' bo bdag med do zhes 'dod na chad par lta ba'o zhes gsungs pas thams cad du yang bdag rdzas su med pa la bden par rdzas su sgro btags te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo bdag med do zhes 'dod na chad par lta ba'o zhes gsungs pas thams cad du yang bdag rdzas su med pa la bden par rdzas su sgro btags te /
translated: Therefore, in all cases, the substantial reality of the self is imputed to be truly existent, but it is imputed to be either existent or nonexistent.

original: yod pa nyid dam @249b med pa nyid du brtags pa ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis su ltung bar zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dam @249b med pa nyid du brtags pa ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis su ltung bar zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The imputation of existence or nonexistence falls into the two extremes of eternalism and annihilationism.

original: gang gis nye bar len pa las rnam par gnas pa phyin ci ma log pa la ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba de ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis su ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis nye bar len pa las rnam par gnas pa phyin ci ma log pa la ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba de ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis su ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those who see the self as it is, without error, in dependence on the appropriated aggregates, do not fall into the two extremes of eternalism and annihilationism.

original: de'i rten du gyur pa'i dngos po nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten du gyur pa'i dngos po nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the thing that is its basis is not perceived.

original: de yang rdzas rjes su ma dmigs pas ni rtag par lta bar mi ltung la /
analyzed: de yang rdzas rjes su ma dmigs pas ni rtag par lta bar mi ltung la /
translated: Moreover, one does not fall into the view of eternalism by not perceiving a substance,

original: nye bar len pa las rnam par gzhag pa tsam gyis bdag khas blangs pas ni chad par lta bar mi ltung ngo //🔽de lta bu'i mtha' gnyi ga spangs nas dbu ma pa'i sgrub pas brten nas 'byung bar nye bar len pa las rnam par gnas pa'i bdag 'phags pas ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs te 'khor ba las rnam
analyzed: nye bar len pa las rnam par gzhag pa tsam gyis bdag khas blangs pas ni chad par lta bar mi ltung ngo // de lta bu'i mtha' gnyi ga spangs nas dbu ma pa'i sgrub pas brten nas 'byung bar nye bar len pa las rnam par gnas pa'i bdag 'phags pas ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs te 'khor ba las rnam
translated: and one does not fall into the view of nihilism by accepting a self that is merely established from the appropriated aggregates.

original: par grol lo //
analyzed: par grol lo //
translated: Having thus abandoned both extremes, the noble ones realize the self that is dependent origination, which is established from the appropriated aggregates, by means of the Madhyamaka practice. Having abandoned the conception of self in all its forms, they are liberated from saṃsāra.

original: de ltar re zhig 'di ni gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'di ni gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
translated: Thus, this is the selflessness of the person.

original: chos la bdag med pa ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni med pa'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni med pa'o //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is the essencelessness of phenomena.

original: de la mdor bsdu na chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, phenomena are of two kinds:

original: gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
translated: those that have form and those that do not have form.

original: de la gzugs can la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gzugs can la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Form is also twofold:

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: primary and derivative.

original: gang gzugs can ma yin pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs can ma yin pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: That which is not form is also twofold: conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de la gzugs can ma yin pa 'dus byas la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs can ma yin pa 'dus byas la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: That which is conditioned and not form is threefold:

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dang sems dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dang sems dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: mind, mental factors, and factors not associated with mind.

original: gang yang gzugs can ma yin pa 'dus ma byas la ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gang yang gzugs can ma yin pa 'dus ma byas la ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: That which is unconditioned and not form is fourfold:

original: nam mkha' dang ; so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang / chos rnams kyi chos nyid do //🔽de la re zhig 'dus ma byas rnams ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyis kyang rang gi ngo bor med la /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ; so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang / chos rnams kyi chos nyid do // de la re zhig 'dus ma byas rnams ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyis kyang rang gi ngo bor med la /
translated: space, analytical cessation, nonanalytical cessation, and the reality of dharmas.🔽Among these, the unconditioned do not exist as their own nature because they are not dependently arisen.

original: byas pa ma yin pas kyang rang gi ngo bor med de /
analyzed: byas pa ma yin pas kyang rang gi ngo bor med de /
translated: They also do not exist as their own nature because they are not created.

original: 'dus ma byas ni tshig tsam yin pas rnam par dpyad pa gzhug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni tshig tsam yin pas rnam par dpyad pa gzhug par mi bya'o //
translated: The unconditioned is mere words. It is not to be examined.🔽In the fivefold classification of form by way of the primary elements and the derivative form, the four primary elements are mutually dependent, since they do not abandon each other. They arise by the power of each other.🔽The primary elements are mutually dependent.🔽The primary elements are mutually dependent.🔽The primary elements are mutually dependent.

original: gang 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bye brag gis gzugs rnam pa de lnga po de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni phan tshun mi 'dor bas phan tshun gyi stobs kyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bye brag gis gzugs rnam pa de lnga po de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni phan tshun mi 'dor bas phan tshun gyi stobs kyis 'byung ste /
translated: The primary elements are mutually dependent.🔽The primary elements are mutually dependent.

original: 'byung @250a * //🔽ba chen po gsum la brten nas sa'i khams 'grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'byung @250a * // ba chen po gsum la brten nas sa'i khams 'grub par 'gyur la /
translated: The primary elements are mutually dependent.🔽The primary elements are mutually dependent.🔽The primary elements are mutually dependent.🔽The primary elements are mutually dependent.

original: sa'i khams la brten nas kyang 'byung ba chen po gsum 'grub po //
analyzed: sa'i khams la brten nas kyang 'byung ba chen po gsum 'grub po //
translated: The primary elements are mutually dependent.
