original: de bas na 'di dag ni phan tshun du brten nas 'grub par gnas te /🔽sa la ma ltos par yang 'byung ba gsum po sa la brten pa'i ngo bo 'thob par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag ni phan tshun du brten nas 'grub par gnas te / sa la ma ltos par yang 'byung ba gsum po sa la brten pa'i ngo bo 'thob par ga la 'gyur /
translated: The primary elements are mutually dependent.

original: gang du 'byung ba gsum po med pa der yang sas 'byung ba gsum la brten pa'i ngo bo gang las 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang du 'byung ba gsum po med pa der yang sas 'byung ba gsum la brten pa'i ngo bo gang las 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: The primary elements are

original: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang rang gi ngo bo ma grub par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang rang gi ngo bo ma grub par sbyar ro //
translated: So too, the rest should be applied in the same way, with the non-establishment of their own intrinsic reality.

original: gal te 'di dag rang gi ngo bor grub par gyur na de dag rang gi ngo bor grub pa nyid kyis phan tshun ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag rang gi ngo bor grub par gyur na de dag rang gi ngo bor grub pa nyid kyis phan tshun ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If these were to be established by their own intrinsic reality, then they would not be mutually dependent due to being established by their own intrinsic reality.

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: One might think as follows:

original: gang skye ba'i sngon rol du 'byung ba'i rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa de lta na yang phan tshun ltos nas grub pa yod pas rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: gang skye ba'i sngon rol du 'byung ba'i rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa de lta na yang phan tshun ltos nas grub pa yod pas rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: Even though the intrinsic reality that occurs prior to arising is not established, since establishment exists through mutual dependence, there is intrinsic reality.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ma skyes pa'i sngon rol nas de dag gi rang gi ngo bor med pas de la ni re zhig ltos pa yod pa ma yin pas grub pa med do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i sngon rol nas de dag gi rang gi ngo bor med pas de la ni re zhig ltos pa yod pa ma yin pas grub pa med do //
translated: Since they do not exist by their own intrinsic reality prior to arising, since they do not exist as mutual dependence, they are not established.

original: grub pa med par gyur pas rang gi ngo bor grub pa gang las 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: grub pa med par gyur pas rang gi ngo bor grub pa gang las 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Since they are not established, from what would intrinsic reality arise?

original: gang du de dag gi rang gi ngo bor grub pa med pa der bdag dang nags tshal la sogs pa ltar sa la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
analyzed: gang du de dag gi rang gi ngo bor grub pa med pa der bdag dang nags tshal la sogs pa ltar sa la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
translated: Where they are not established as their own nature, there is no establishment of the nature of earth, etc., like a self, a forest, etc.

original: yang ngo bo nyid du ma grub pas sa la sogs pa btags pa tsam du med do zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: yang ngo bo nyid du ma grub pas sa la sogs pa btags pa tsam du med do zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Moreover, one should not say that earth, etc., do not exist as mere designations because they are not established as natures.

original: 'di ltar lus kyi dbang pos dmigs pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar lus kyi dbang pos dmigs pas so //
translated: Because they are perceived by the body faculty.

original: de bas na 'di dag nye bar dmigs pa nyid kyis mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa ltar med pa ni ma yin pa nyid de rnam par brtags na ni rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bor grub pa ni med de /
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag nye bar dmigs pa nyid kyis mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa ltar med pa ni ma yin pa nyid de rnam par brtags na ni rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bor grub pa ni med de /
translated: Therefore, they are not nonexistent like the son of a barren woman, etc., because they are perceived. But when examined, they do not exist as natures because they are not established as their own nature.

original: de lta bas na nges pa kho nar brten nas yang dag par 'byung ba 'di rnams ni gzugs brnyan bzhin du ngo bo nyid med par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na nges pa kho nar brten nas yang dag par 'byung ba 'di rnams ni gzugs brnyan bzhin du ngo bo nyid med par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that these, which definitely arise in dependence, are like reflections, which are devoid of nature.

original: de ltar byas na 'jig rten pa dang yang 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'jig rten pa dang yang 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, one does not contradict the world,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la nye bar brten pa'i rnam par gzhag pa khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la nye bar brten pa'i rnam par gzhag pa khas blangs pas so //
translated: because one accepts the presentation that is based on dependent origination.

original: de kho na nyid dang yang 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid dang yang 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: And one does not contradict reality,

original: med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sgro @250b ma btags pas mngon bar zhen pa yang bzlog par gyur pa nyid de /
analyzed: med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sgro @250b ma btags pas mngon bar zhen pa yang bzlog par gyur pa nyid de /
translated: because one has eliminated the reification that is due to the superimposition of an unreal essence,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can nyid du rab tu rtogs pas so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can nyid du rab tu rtogs pas so //
translated: because one has realized that dependent origination is false and deceptive.

original: mngon bar zhen pa med par gyur na mngon bar zhen pa'i rgyu can gyi 'khor ba las ldog pa yang bde bar 'grub bo //
analyzed: mngon bar zhen pa med par gyur na mngon bar zhen pa'i rgyu can gyi 'khor ba las ldog pa yang bde bar 'grub bo //
translated: When one has eliminated reification, it is easy to establish that one turns away from cyclic existence, which is caused by reification.

original: de ltar gzugs brnyan bzhin du 'byung ba chen po rnams dngos po med pa des na de'i rgyu can gyi 'byung ba las gyur pa mig la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs brnyan bzhin du 'byung ba chen po rnams dngos po med pa des na de'i rgyu can gyi 'byung ba las gyur pa mig la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Since the great elements are like reflections, they are unreal. Therefore, it is easy to understand that the eyes, etc., which are derived from the elements and have them as their cause, are also essenceless.

original: gzhan yang thams cad las phra ba'i gzugs kyi ngo bo ni rdul phra rab ces brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang thams cad las phra ba'i gzugs kyi ngo bo ni rdul phra rab ces brjod do //
translated: Moreover, the most subtle form is called the most subtle particle.

original: de 'dod pa'i khams na dbang po las phyi rol du gyur pa ni rdzas brgyad dang ldan par 'byung ste /🔽de la rdzas brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de 'dod pa'i khams na dbang po las phyi rol du gyur pa ni rdzas brgyad dang ldan par 'byung ste / de la rdzas brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In the desire realm, the most subtle particle that is external to the sense faculties arises possessing eight substances.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'o //
translated: The eight substances are the four primary elements and form, smell, taste, and the tangible.

original: nang gi bdag nyid can lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa ni rdzas dgu'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid can lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa ni rdzas dgu'o //
translated: The most subtle particle that possesses the body faculty arises possessing nine substances.

original: de las gzhan pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ni rdzas bcu'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ni rdzas bcu'o //
translated: The most subtle particle that possesses the eye faculty and so on arises possessing ten substances.

original: yang de dag gi rdul phra rab rnams sgra dang ldan pa la ni rdzas dgu dang / bcu dang / bcu gcig dang ldan par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang de dag gi rdul phra rab rnams sgra dang ldan pa la ni rdzas dgu dang / bcu dang / bcu gcig dang ldan par 'byung ngo //
translated: The most subtle particle that possesses sound arises possessing nine, ten, or eleven substances.

original: de la rdzas brgyad dang ldan pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdzas brgyad ni se'u 'bru'i 'bras bu ltar rang gi ngo bo so sor gnas pa ni med kyi 'on kyang sman gyi tshod ma la ko la'i 'bras bu dang sran ma la sogs pa dang btung ba la
analyzed: de la rdzas brgyad dang ldan pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdzas brgyad ni se'u 'bru'i 'bras bu ltar rang gi ngo bo so sor gnas pa ni med kyi 'on kyang sman gyi tshod ma la ko la'i 'bras bu dang sran ma la sogs pa dang btung ba la
translated: The eight substances of a subtle particle that possesses eight substances do not exist as individual entities like the fruit of the emblic myrobalan.

original: bu ram dang tin di li'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i ro ltar 'dres par gyur nas gnas so //
analyzed: bu ram dang tin di li'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i ro ltar 'dres par gyur nas gnas so //
translated: However, they exist like the taste of molasses and the taste of tinduka fruit in a soup, or like the taste of beans and so on in a stew.

original: de la yang rdul phra rab kyi rdzas bdun bdun la ltos pa med par re re mi 'grub pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bor grub pa ni med do //
analyzed: de la yang rdul phra rab kyi rdzas bdun bdun la ltos pa med par re re mi 'grub pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bor grub pa ni med do //
translated: Moreover, since each of the seven substances of a subtle particle is not established without relying on the others, they do not exist as established in their own nature.

original: gal te yod na ni re re zhing rdzas bdun bdun la ltos pa nyams par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yod na ni re re zhing rdzas bdun bdun la ltos pa nyams par 'gyur la /
translated: If they did, the reliance of each on seven substances would be undermined.

original: des na rgyu med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rgyu med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore they would be without cause.

original: rgyu med par ni la lar 'ga' yang grub pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu med par ni la lar 'ga' yang grub pa med do //
translated: Without a cause, nothing is established anywhere.

original: rdzas bdun bdun la ltos pa dang bcas par dmigs pas sa la sogs pa dang / khyim la sogs pa ltar rang gi ngo bor ni mi dmigs so ;
analyzed: rdzas bdun bdun la ltos pa dang bcas par dmigs pas sa la sogs pa dang / khyim la sogs pa ltar rang gi ngo bor ni mi dmigs so ;
translated: But they are not perceived as substances, like earth, etc., or like a house, etc., because they are perceived in dependence on seven substances each.

original: / thams cad du med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: / thams cad du med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not totally nonexistent,

original: re re zhing rdzas bdun bdun la brten nas nye bar btags pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re re zhing rdzas bdun bdun la brten nas nye bar btags pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are perceived as designations in dependence on each of the seven substances.

original: gang rdzas brgyad dang ldan pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rigs pa de nyid rdzas dgu dang / bcu dang bcu gcig dang ldan pa'i rdul phra rab la yang sbyang bar bya'o //🔽des @251a * //
analyzed: gang rdzas brgyad dang ldan pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rigs pa de nyid rdzas dgu dang / bcu dang bcu gcig dang ldan pa'i rdul phra rab la yang sbyang bar bya'o // des @251a * //
translated: The same argument applies to atoms that possess eight, nine, ten, or eleven substances.

original: na 'di ltar mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga gzugs la sogs pa don lnga dang bcas pa ni gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: na 'di ltar mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga gzugs la sogs pa don lnga dang bcas pa ni gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the five sense faculties such as the eye, together with the five objects such as form, are like reflections.

original: gang yang sems dang sems las byung ba gang dag mig la sogs pa la brten cing /
analyzed: gang yang sems dang sems las byung ba gang dag mig la sogs pa la brten cing /
translated: And the mind and mental activities that are supported on the eye, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs nas nye bar 'byung ba de dag kyang gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid las mi 'da' ba nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs nas nye bar 'byung ba de dag kyang gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid las mi 'da' ba nyid de /
translated: And those that arise in dependence on form, etc. are not beyond being like a reflection.

original: gzugs brnyan lta bu'i rten dang dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan lta bu'i rten dang dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise from a support and an object that are like a reflection.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams phan tshun ltos nas 'byung ba nyid kyis rang gi ngo bor grub pa ni med pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba rnams kyang phan tshun gyi stobs la brten nas grub pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bor grub
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams phan tshun ltos nas 'byung ba nyid kyis rang gi ngo bor grub pa ni med pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba rnams kyang phan tshun gyi stobs la brten nas grub pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bor grub
translated: Moreover, just as the great elements do not exist as established in their own intrinsic reality by the mutual dependence of their arising, in the same way, the mental factors do not exist as established in their own intrinsic reality by their establishment in dependence on the power of each other.

original: pa med pa nyid de gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: pa med pa nyid de gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid las mi 'da'o //
translated: They are not beyond being like a reflection.

original: de bzhin du de dag gi mtshan nyid rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de dag gi mtshan nyid rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of those should be applied in the same way.

original: de lta bas na chos thams cad dngos po med pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos thams cad dngos po med pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are unreal.🔽That which superimposes true existence on things is mistaken, because things exist in one way,

original: gang gis dngos po bden par sgro 'dogs pa de ni phyin ci log yin te dngos po ni gzhan du gnas la /
analyzed: gang gis dngos po bden par sgro 'dogs pa de ni phyin ci log yin te dngos po ni gzhan du gnas la /
translated: but appear in another.

original: chos ni gzhan du gzung ba nyid kyis smig rgyu la chur 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos ni gzhan du gzung ba nyid kyis smig rgyu la chur 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Dharma is the grasping of something else, like the grasping of water in a mirage.

original: gang gis mi rtag pa nyid du khas blangs nas yang dngos po bden par 'dod pa des ni dngos po'i ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes te /
analyzed: gang gis mi rtag pa nyid du khas blangs nas yang dngos po bden par 'dod pa des ni dngos po'i ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes te /
translated: One who accepts impermanence but still believes in the reality of things does not understand the nature of things as it is.

original: phyin ci log la yang dag par 'du shes pas re zhig dang por bdag nyid bslus pa yin la /
analyzed: phyin ci log la yang dag par 'du shes pas re zhig dang por bdag nyid bslus pa yin la /
translated: He is mistaken about the truth, and so first of all he deceives himself.

original: de nas ni gzhan dag yin no //
analyzed: de nas ni gzhan dag yin no //
translated: Then he deceives others.

original: de dag ni de'i grub pa'i mtha' la zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni de'i grub pa'i mtha' la zhen pa yin te /
translated: He is attached to his own philosophical theory.

original: de dag gis rdzas su bden pa'i ngo bo nyid du rab tu sgrub pa na lung gis sam rigs pas sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gis rdzas su bden pa'i ngo bo nyid du rab tu sgrub pa na lung gis sam rigs pas sgrub par byed do //
translated: When he establishes the nature of things as real in substance, he does so by scripture or by reasoning.

original: de la re zhig lung ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig lung ni 'di yin te /
translated: Now, as for scripture, it is as follows:

original: de lta bas na kun dga' bo gang na gang med pa de ni des stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na kun dga' bo gang na gang med pa de ni des stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, Ananda, where something is absent, that is its emptiness.

original: lhag ma gang yin pa de ni yod pa nyid do zhes shes pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma gang yin pa de ni yod pa nyid do zhes shes pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //
translated: The remainder exists. This is knowledge in accordance with reality.

original: zhes de skad brjod pa ni phyin ci ma log par stong pa nyid rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig gang stong pa de yang mi 'dod la /
analyzed: zhes de skad brjod pa ni phyin ci ma log par stong pa nyid rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig gang stong pa de yang mi 'dod la /
translated: Thus, to say this means to understand emptiness without error.🔽 Likewise, some virtuous ascetics and brahmins do not assert that which is empty,

original: gang gis stong pa de yang mi 'dod pa de lta bu'i rnam pa ni stong pa nyid nyes par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gis stong pa de yang mi 'dod pa de lta bu'i rnam pa ni stong pa nyid nyes par bzung ba yin no //
translated: and they do not assert that by which it is empty. Such a kind of emptiness is a mistaken apprehension of emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gis stong pa de ni med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang gis stong pa de ni med pa nyid yin la /
translated: That by which it is empty is non-existent.

original: @251b gang stong pa de ni yod pa nyid yin pas stong pa nyid ces rigs so //
analyzed: @251b gang stong pa de ni yod pa nyid yin pas stong pa nyid ces rigs so //
translated: That which is empty is existent. Therefore, it is reasonable to say emptiness.

original: thams cad med na gang gang gis stong par 'gyur /
analyzed: thams cad med na gang gang gis stong par 'gyur /
translated: If everything is non-existent, what and by what would it be empty?

original: de nyid des stong par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid des stong par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that it is empty of that very thing.

original: de lta bas na nyes par gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na nyes par gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it becomes a mistaken apprehension.

original: ji ltar na stong pa nyid legs par bzung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na stong pa nyid legs par bzung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is emptiness well-apprehended?

original: gang na gang med pa de ni des stong pa nyid do zhes yang dag par mthong la /
analyzed: gang na gang med pa de ni des stong pa nyid do zhes yang dag par mthong la /
translated: That which is not in something is empty of that. This is seen correctly.

original: lhag ma ni yod pa nyid do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'o zhes de ltar brjod pa ni stong pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: lhag ma ni yod pa nyid do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'o zhes de ltar brjod pa ni stong pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: rtag pa'i dngos po med pa ste //
analyzed: rtag pa'i dngos po med pa ste //
translated: There is no permanent thing.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa nyid //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa nyid //
translated: The dependent is real.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur 'debs pa'i //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur 'debs pa'i //
translated: The extreme of superimposition and the extreme of denial

original: mthar rtogs pa ni brlag par 'gyur //🔽zhes kyang gsungs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthar rtogs pa ni brlag par 'gyur // zhes kyang gsungs so zhes bya'o //
translated: Are destroyed by the realization of the middle way.

original: de dag gi rigs pa yang rdzas tsam yang med na gdags pa'i mtshan ma med pas btags pa yang yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag gi rigs pa yang rdzas tsam yang med na gdags pa'i mtshan ma med pas btags pa yang yod par 'gyur la /
translated: The reason for this is that if there is not even the mere thing, then since there is no sign of designation, designation also exists.

original: de med na las kyi 'bras bu la sogs pa yang nyams par 'gyur ro zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de med na las kyi 'bras bu la sogs pa yang nyams par 'gyur ro zhes brjod do //
translated: If that does not exist, then karma, effect, and so on also degenerate.

original: de la khyed kyis dngos po yod par bsgrubs na ni de skad brjod par rigs na /
analyzed: de la khyed kyis dngos po yod par bsgrubs na ni de skad brjod par rigs na /
translated: In response to this, if you prove that things exist, then it is correct to say that.

original: bsgrubs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrubs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not proven.

original: 'jigs pas dal bus smras pa lta bur shes so //
analyzed: 'jigs pas dal bus smras pa lta bur shes so //
translated: It is understood to be like the slow speech of one who is afraid.

original: ji skad smras pa'i rigs pas dngos po bden par yod pa gsal bas dngos po med pa'i don la yang dngos po'i don du mtshon nas las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa thams cad rigs par rtogs so //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i rigs pas dngos po bden par yod pa gsal bas dngos po med pa'i don la yang dngos po'i don du mtshon nas las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa thams cad rigs par rtogs so //
translated: Since the reasoning stated above clearly shows that things truly exist, the meaning of non-existence is also indicated by the meaning of existence, and one can understand that all such things as karma and its effects are reasonable.

original: lung dang 'gal ba'i don yang sngar nye bar brjod do //
analyzed: lung dang 'gal ba'i don yang sngar nye bar brjod do //
translated: We have already explained how this contradicts scripture.

original: de lta mod kyi lung gis ni mngon bar 'dod pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo yod par sgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi lung gis ni mngon bar 'dod pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo yod par sgrub par mi nus so //
translated: However, scripture cannot prove that the nature of the entity that is asserted to exist exists.

original: yod pa nyid tsam nye bar brjod pas ni bden par yod pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: yod pa nyid tsam nye bar brjod pas ni bden par yod pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: Merely stating that it exists does not prove that it truly exists.

original: btags pa tsam la yang yod do zhes nye bar brjod do //
analyzed: btags pa tsam la yang yod do zhes nye bar brjod do //
translated: We also say that it exists as a mere designation.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag lnga po 'di rnams ni 'du shes tsam dang / dam bca' ba tsam dang / kun rdzob tsam dang / tha snyad tsam ste /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag lnga po 'di rnams ni 'du shes tsam dang / dam bca' ba tsam dang / kun rdzob tsam dang / tha snyad tsam ste /
translated: The Bhagavān also said, “Monks, these five are mere ideation, mere designation, mere convention, mere conceptualization,

original: 'di lta ste 'das pa'i dus dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / nam mkha' dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gang zag ces bya ba'o zhes de ltar 'du shes tsam du mngon bar bsgrubs nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'das @252a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'das pa'i dus dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / nam mkha' dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gang zag ces bya ba'o zhes de ltar 'du shes tsam du mngon bar bsgrubs nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'das @252a * //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān has said, “Monks, if past form had not existed, then the noble śrāvakas who possess hearing would not see past form and not see it.

original: pa'i gzugs byung bar ma gyur na thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos dag 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir 'das pa'i gzugs yod pas de'i phyir thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos 'das pa'i gzugs🔽la mi lta'o ;
analyzed: pa'i gzugs byung bar ma gyur na thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos dag 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir 'das pa'i gzugs yod pas de'i phyir thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta'o ;
translated: But because past form exists, the noble śrāvakas who possess hearing do see past form.

original: / dge slong dag gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs 'byung bar mi 'gyur na thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon bar mi dga' bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: / dge slong dag gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs 'byung bar mi 'gyur na thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon bar mi dga' bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Monks, if future form were not to arise, then the noble śrāvakas who possess hearing would not delight in future form and not delight in it.🔽But because future form arises, the noble śrāvakas who possess hearing do delight in future form.

original: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pas de'i phyir thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par mi dga'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pas de'i phyir thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par mi dga'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because future form will arise, therefore the noble disciple who possesses learning does not delight in future form.

original: de lta bas na btags par yod pa la yang yod par nye bar brjod pas yod par nye bar gsungs pa tsam gyis bden pa nyid kyi dngos po 'grub par mi nus so //
analyzed: de lta bas na btags par yod pa la yang yod par nye bar brjod pas yod par nye bar gsungs pa tsam gyis bden pa nyid kyi dngos po 'grub par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, since it is said that even that which exists as a designation exists, it cannot be established that something is a real thing just because it is said to exist.

original: de lta bas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the reality of dependent origination is non-existence.

original: dngos po med pa yin na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid dang ni mi 'gal te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yin na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid dang ni mi 'gal te /
translated: If it is non-existence, it is not contradictory to dependent origination.

original: gang gi phyir byas pa can gyi dngos po rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can 'di ni 'dir ngo bo dang / rdzas dang / dngos por med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byas pa can gyi dngos po rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can 'di ni 'dir ngo bo dang / rdzas dang / dngos por med do //
translated: Because a fabricated thing, which is dependent origination, is false and deceptive, it does not exist here as an entity, substance, or real thing.

original: de lta na yang byas pa can gyi dngos po bcos ma'i rang bzhin du ni yod de /
analyzed: de lta na yang byas pa can gyi dngos po bcos ma'i rang bzhin du ni yod de /
translated: Nevertheless, things that are created exist as having the nature of being created.

original: ngo bo nyid du med pa nyid kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du med pa nyid kyis stong pa'o //
translated: They are empty because they do not exist by way of their own intrinsic reality.

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān also said:

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i rgyun 'di yang //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i rgyun 'di yang //
translated: “In this way, this continuum of seeing

original: sgyu ma lta bur byis pa 'drid //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur byis pa 'drid //
translated: is like an illusion, enticing the childish.

original: gnod par byed dang zug rdu ste /
analyzed: gnod par byed dang zug rdu ste /
translated: It is harmful, like a thorn,

original: 'di la snying po yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di la snying po yod ma yin //
translated: and it has no essence.

original: ji ltar gang la rnam dpyad pas //
analyzed: ji ltar gang la rnam dpyad pas //

analyzed: de phyir dngos po med pa nyid // ces gsungs so //
translated: therefore they are essenceless.

original: gang de lta bu ni dngos po med pa'i don yin te /🔽de lta bu ni bdag @254a * //
analyzed: gang de lta bu ni dngos po med pa'i don yin te / de lta bu ni bdag @254a * //
translated: This is the meaning of essencelessness.

original: med pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: med pa'i don yin la /
translated: This is the meaning of selflessness.

original: dngos po ni bdag go //
analyzed: dngos po ni bdag go //
translated: Things are selves.

original: gal te de dngos por yod na ni bdag dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de dngos por yod na ni bdag dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they existed as things, they would have selves.

original: bdag dang bcas par gyur na rang dbang can du 'gyur la rang dbang can du gyur na ni rtag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag dang bcas par gyur na rang dbang can du 'gyur la rang dbang can du gyur na ni rtag par 'gyur la /
translated: If they had selves, they would be independent. If they were independent, they would be permanent.

original: dngos po rtag pa ni med du 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos po rtag pa ni med du 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Permanent things do not exist. All compounded things are impermanent.

original: des na slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
analyzed: des na slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Master [Nāgārjuna] also said:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen

original: de nyid khyod ni stong par bzhed //
analyzed: de nyid khyod ni stong par bzhed //
translated: That is explained to be emptiness.🔽Things that are not dependently arisen

original: dngos po rang dbang can med ces //
analyzed: dngos po rang dbang can med ces //
translated: Do not exist anywhere.

original: mnyam med khyod kyi seng ge'i sgra //
analyzed: mnyam med khyod kyi seng ge'i sgra //
translated: The lion’s roar of the unequaled one

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Is that there are no independent things.

original: 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
translated: Āryadeva also explained:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen

original: rang dbang can du de ma skyes //
analyzed: rang dbang can du de ma skyes //
translated: That is not arisen by its own power.

original: 'di dag thams cad rang dbang med //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad rang dbang med //
translated: All of these are without their own power.

original: des na bdag ni yod ma yin //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des na bdag ni yod ma yin // zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the self does not exist.

original: slob dpon ma ti tsi tras kyang //
analyzed: slob dpon ma ti tsi tras kyang //
translated: Master Maticitra also said:

original: rang dbang yod na byed por 'gyur //
analyzed: rang dbang yod na byed por 'gyur //
translated: If there were independence, there would be an agent.

original: byed po 'ga' yang mi rigs pas //🔽chos kun byed pa med pa yi //
analyzed: byed po 'ga' yang mi rigs pas // chos kun byed pa med pa yi //
translated: Since it is not logical that there is any agent,🔽You taught that all phenomena

original: tshul du khyod kyis gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: tshul du khyod kyis gsungs pa yin //
translated: Are devoid of an agent.

original: chos kyi rnga chen brdungs pa yi //
analyzed: chos kyi rnga chen brdungs pa yi //
translated: The great drum of Dharma is beaten:

original: stong nyid seng ge'i sgra 'di yis //
analyzed: stong nyid seng ge'i sgra 'di yis //
translated: By this lion's roar of emptiness,

original: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten las //🔽sa mtshams bcad par rnam par gnas //
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten las // sa mtshams bcad par rnam par gnas //
translated: the world with its gods

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: is frightened and stands in awe.

original: 'di ni re zhig chos dang gang zag dag rab tu 'byed pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig chos dang gang zag dag rab tu 'byed pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: This is the supramundane discrimination of the Dharma and the person.

original: 'jig rten pa'i ni mtha' med pas de ni gzhung mang ba nyid kyis 'dir brjod par mi nus pas gzhag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ni mtha' med pas de ni gzhung mang ba nyid kyis 'dir brjod par mi nus pas gzhag go //
translated: The mundane is infinite, and so it is set aside here because it cannot be treated in a treatise.

original: de ltar shes rab bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab bshad zin to //
translated: Thus wisdom has been explained.🔽What is imagination?

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan na rnam par shes pa 'bad pa chung ngur dmigs pa yongs su gcod pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan na rnam par shes pa 'bad pa chung ngur dmigs pa yongs su gcod pa nyid de /
translated: When a dharma that is a mental factor is associated with consciousness, it is the determination of the object that is perceived with little effort.

original: dmigs par gtogs pa la brtags pa phra mo mi byed pa de ni kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba ste rnam par rtog pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dmigs par gtogs pa la brtags pa phra mo mi byed pa de ni kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba ste rnam par rtog pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That which does not examine subtle inclusion in the object is called imagination, also called discursive thought.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: 'ga' zhig gis thag ring po nas 'di ltar bum pa dang kham phor la sogs pa mthong ba nyid na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis thag ring po nas 'di ltar bum pa dang kham phor la sogs pa mthong ba nyid na /
translated: when someone sees from a distance a pot, a water jar, etc.,

original: der gtogs pa la dpyad pa ma byas par bzung ba tsam du dpyod pas des 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dmigs pa la yongs su dpyad pa rtsing bar 'jug go //
analyzed: der gtogs pa la dpyad pa ma byas par bzung ba tsam du dpyod pas des 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dmigs pa la yongs su dpyad pa rtsing bar 'jug go //
translated: The investigation of the object is gross, because it is an investigation of the object as it is grasped, without analyzing the object itself.

original: de dang mtshungs par mi ldan na ni de ltar 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par mi ldan na ni de ltar 'jug pa med do //
translated: If the mind is not associated with that investigation, it does not operate in that way.

original: de lta bas na sems @254b rtsing ba'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par rtog pa zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na sems @254b rtsing ba'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par rtog pa zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, the mind is called gross when it is discursive.

original: rnam par shes pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag nyid ni rtsing ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin no //🔽chos mngon pa las ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag nyid ni rtsing ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin no // chos mngon pa las ni /
translated: But the consciousness itself is not gross, because it is not material.

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum 'byung ste /
translated: In the Abhidharma, three types of discursiveness are mentioned:

original: ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / kun tu nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / kun tu nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: discursiveness of essence, discursiveness of full investigation, and discursiveness of memory.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa de rnams las gang ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni bshad pa de nyid do //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa de rnams las gang ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni bshad pa de nyid do //
translated: Among these, the discursiveness of essence is the same as the above.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i yid kyi shes rab ni kun du nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i yid kyi shes rab ni kun du nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of the non-concentrated mind is the discursive thought of complete investigation.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa dang ma bzhag pa'i yid kyi dran pa thams cad ni rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa dang ma bzhag pa'i yid kyi dran pa thams cad ni rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: All the memories of the concentrated and non-concentrated mind are the discursive thought of recollection.

original: de yang ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du /
translated: And it is said:🔽“A person who has visual consciousness knows blue, but not that ‘blue exists.’”

original: skyes bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa la rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa zhes bya ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i
analyzed: skyes bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa la rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa zhes bya ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i
translated: The associated ones are called discursive thought and investigation.

original: bye brag brjod pa'i khyad par yongs su gcod pa na de'i rnam par byung ba ni sngon po shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag brjod pa'i khyad par yongs su gcod pa na de'i rnam par byung ba ni sngon po shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the specific characteristics of the Abhidharma are discerned, the arising of that is called the knowledge of blue.

original: de nyid la yang kun du nges par rtog pa gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba zhes bya ba dag gis yid kyi rnam par shes pas yongs su gcod pa ni sngon po'o zhes shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la yang kun du nges par rtog pa gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba zhes bya ba dag gis yid kyi rnam par shes pas yongs su gcod pa ni sngon po'o zhes shes pa'o //
translated: It is also determined by the mental consciousness, which is either clear or unclear, and it is known as “blue.”

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan na rnam par shes pas dmigs pa la zhib par yongs su dpyod pa de ni sems las byung ba'i chos dpyod pa zhes bya ste //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan na rnam par shes pas dmigs pa la zhib par yongs su dpyod pa de ni sems las byung ba'i chos dpyod pa zhes bya ste //
translated: When the mind is associated with a mental factor called investigation, it examines the object of consciousness in detail.

original: sems phra ba'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: sems phra ba'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: This is the characteristic of a subtle mind.

original: 'di lta ste bum pa dang / kham por la sogs pa de dag nyid lags pa dang / ma gas pa yongs su dpyod cing yongs su dpyad nas 'di ni gas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste bum pa dang / kham por la sogs pa de dag nyid lags pa dang / ma gas pa yongs su dpyod cing yongs su dpyad nas 'di ni gas pa'o //
translated: For example, when one examines and analyzes a pot, a bowl, etc., and having analyzed them, one observes and investigates in this way: “This is broken,

original: 'di ni sra ba'o zhes de lta bu'i rnam pa la dmigs shing phra bar dpyod pa la 'jug pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos dpyod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni sra ba'o zhes de lta bu'i rnam pa la dmigs shing phra bar dpyod pa la 'jug pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos dpyod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: this is solid,” this is called the mental factor of investigation.

original: gang rnam par dpyod pa dang / gang yang bshad ma thag pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyis ni ngag 'du byed par brjod de /
analyzed: gang rnam par dpyod pa dang / gang yang bshad ma thag pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyis ni ngag 'du byed par brjod de /
translated: The two kinds of discursive thought, that which analyzes and that which has just been explained, are said to be the formative force that is speech,

original: ngag kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they motivate speech.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /🔽rnam par brtags rnam par dpyad nas tshig tu brjod kyi ma @255a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang / rnam par brtags rnam par dpyad nas tshig tu brjod kyi ma @255a * //
translated: The Lord has said,

original: brtags ma dpyad par ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags ma dpyad par ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “One speaks words after having analyzed and investigated, not without having analyzed and investigated.”

original: bag med pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams mi sgom zhing gces su mi 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: bag med pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams mi sgom zhing gces su mi 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Negligence is the noncultivation and noncherishing of virtuous things.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bag yod pa las bzlog ste sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bag yod pa las bzlog ste sbyar ro //
translated: It is the opposite of the heedfulness that will be explained.

original: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams sgom pa la gces su byed pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
analyzed: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams sgom pa la gces su byed pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
translated: Heedfulness is the cultivation and cherishing of virtuous things.

original: sems kyi rgyun dge ba'i chos la gzhol bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun dge ba'i chos la gzhol bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of the phrase, “one causes the stream of mind to flow to virtuous things.”

original: de la dge ba'i don ni bde ba'i don te /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i don ni bde ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of virtuous is the meaning of happiness.

original: 'tshe ba thams cad log pa nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa ni thams cad du bde ba ste nad med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba thams cad log pa nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa ni thams cad du bde ba ste nad med pa lta bu'o //
translated: Nirvana is happiness in all ways, like the absence of disease, because of the cessation of all harm.

original: lam gyi bden pa yang de thob par byed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis bde bas so //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa yang de thob par byed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis bde bas so //
translated: The truth of the path is happiness because it is the cause for attaining nirvana.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa ni rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par smin pa'i dngos po 'dod pa thob par byed pas so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa ni rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par smin pa'i dngos po 'dod pa thob par byed pas so //
translated: Other than that, all that is virtuous and possesses the outflows is happiness because it causes the attainment of the desired object that is in accordance with its ripening.

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa zhes bya ba 'di dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis dge ba ste /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa zhes bya ba 'di dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis dge ba ste /
translated: In this regard, the three roots of virtue and that which is called conscience and shame are virtuous by nature.

original: gzhan dang ldan pa dang kun nas slong ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir phan pa'i sman lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang ldan pa dang kun nas slong ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir phan pa'i sman lta bu'o //
translated: They are like beneficial medicine because they do not depend on anything else or on a motivating factor.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa'i chos de dag dang mtshungs par ldan nas mtshungs par ldan pas dge ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa'i chos de dag dang mtshungs par ldan nas mtshungs par ldan pas dge ba'o //
translated: That which is virtuous by being concomitant is concomitant with those dharmas that are the three roots of virtue and conscience and shame.

original: sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba lta bu ste /
translated: like a drink mixed with medicine.

original: de dag dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa rnams ni dge ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa rnams ni dge ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not virtuous because they are not concomitant with virtue.

original: lus dang ngag gi las dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed thob pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'i chos de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pas kun nas bslang ba ni kun nas bslang bas dge ba ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed thob pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'i chos de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pas kun nas bslang ba ni kun nas bslang bas dge ba ste /
translated: The virtuous roots, etc., of bodily and vocal karma, and the acquisition of the non-concomitant formative forces, birth, etc., are motivated by that which is concomitant with those dharmas, the virtuous roots, etc.

original: sman dang sbyar ba'i chu las byung ba'i 'o ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: sman dang sbyar ba'i chu las byung ba'i 'o ma lta bu'o //
translated: They are virtuous by motivation, like milk that comes from a cow that has eaten a special mixture.

original: kun nas slong bar byed pas ni kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas slong bar byed pas ni kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: Motivation is that which motivates.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽rgyu'i kun nas slong ba dang / de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te / rgyu'i kun nas slong ba dang / de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: It is twofold:🔽the causal motivation and the motivation at the time.

original: de la lus dang ngag gi las 'gogs pa kun du 'byung ba'i dus su gang gis kun nas slong ba de ni de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: de la lus dang ngag gi las 'gogs pa kun du 'byung ba'i dus su gang gis kun nas slong ba de ni de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: The motivation at the time is that which motivates at the time of the arising of the cessation of bodily and vocal karma.

original: rgyu'i kun nas slong ba ni de la sbyor ba'i dus kyi ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i kun nas slong ba ni de la sbyor ba'i dus kyi ste /
translated: The causal motivation is at the time of preparation.

original: de las 'dir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i dbang gis dge ba dang mi dge @255b ba dang / lung du ma bstan par rjod par byed kyi de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las 'dir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i dbang gis dge ba dang mi dge @255b ba dang / lung du ma bstan par rjod par byed kyi de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the mental consciousness to be abandoned by the path of meditation is expressed as virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral by the power of its engagement. It is not like the motivation at the time of the action.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan pas 'khor ba'i skyon mthong ba nyid kyis sems 'khor ba las skyo ba nyid de /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan pas 'khor ba'i skyon mthong ba nyid kyis sems 'khor ba las skyo ba nyid de /
translated: The mental factor that is concomitant with the mind is called regret because it causes the mind to be weary of samsara by seeing the faults of samsara.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa spong ba la rjes su mthun pas nges par skyo ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa spong ba la rjes su mthun pas nges par skyo ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Since it is compatible with the abandonment of afflictions, it is called definite regret.

original: sems kyi rab tu dga' ba ni sems kyi mgu ba ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rab tu dga' ba ni sems kyi mgu ba ste /
translated: Mental delight is mental satisfaction.

original: yid bde ba las tha dad du gyur pa ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: yid bde ba las tha dad du gyur pa ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Mental satisfaction is different from mental bliss.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus dang sems dag las su rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus dang sems dag las su rung ba nyid do //
translated: Pliancy is the serviceability of the body and mind.

original: shin tu ma sbyangs pa'i lus dang sems lci ba nyid de /
analyzed: shin tu ma sbyangs pa'i lus dang sems lci ba nyid de /
translated: It is a heaviness of body and mind that is not pliable.

original: lci na ni mi gsal ba'i phyir de ni bying ba dang rmugs pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: lci na ni mi gsal ba'i phyir de ni bying ba dang rmugs pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: If it is heavy, it is unclear, and it is by nature laxity and torpor.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gang de dang bral ba ting nge 'dzin 'byung bar byed pa de ni shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gang de dang bral ba ting nge 'dzin 'byung bar byed pa de ni shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: Pliability is a mental factor that is the opposite of that, and it makes concentration arise.

original: ji ltar lus shin tu sbyangs pas bde bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar lus shin tu sbyangs pas bde bar 'gyur la /
translated: Just as it is said, “When the body is pliable, there is bliss.

original: bde ba las ni sems rtse gcig par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o ;
analyzed: bde ba las ni sems rtse gcig par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o ;
translated: And from bliss, the mind becomes one-pointed.”

original: / sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan na khro ba'i rkyen gyis khu tshur dang thal lcag la sogs pas gzhan la rnam par tho 'tshams par byed pa de ni rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: / sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan na khro ba'i rkyen gyis khu tshur dang thal lcag la sogs pas gzhan la rnam par tho 'tshams par byed pa de ni rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Harmfulness is a mental factor that, when it is present, causes one to harm others through clenched fists, slaps, and so on, due to the condition of anger.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i chos ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba ste /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i chos ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba ste /
translated: Nonharmfulness is the opposite of that.

original: gang gi dbang gis gzhan la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis gzhan la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'o //
translated: It is the power not to harm others.

original: bdag nyid kyi rigs dam pa las skyes pa dang / thos pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos sdig pa la zhugs par gyur na nyams par 'gyur bar dmigs te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rigs dam pa las skyes pa dang / thos pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos sdig pa la zhugs par gyur na nyams par 'gyur bar dmigs te /
translated: If one is born in a family of high caste, or if one has heard the Dharma, or has morality, etc., and then engages in evil, one’s family, etc., are damaged.

original: 'di dag ni rigs pa ma yin no snyam nas gang gi dbang gis bdag gam chos kyi dbang du byas nas sdig pa la mi 'jug pa de ni ngo tsha dang ldan pas sdig pa las ldog pa'i rgyu'i chos 'dzem pa zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rigs pa ma yin no snyam nas gang gi dbang gis bdag gam chos kyi dbang du byas nas sdig pa la mi 'jug pa de ni ngo tsha dang ldan pas sdig pa las ldog pa'i rgyu'i chos 'dzem pa zhes bshad pa ste /
translated: Thinking that this is not right, one does not engage in evil, either for the sake of oneself or for the sake of the Dharma. This is called “avoiding evil through shame and embarrassment,” which is the cause of turning away from evil.

original: ngo tsha shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called “shame.”

original: gzhan la ltos nas nyes pa la 'dzem pa de ni khrel yod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos nas nyes pa la 'dzem pa de ni khrel yod pa'o //
translated: Embarrassment is avoiding evil through considering others.

original: des na 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos gnyis ni 'jig rten skyong ba yin te /🔽ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos gnyis ni 'jig rten skyong ba yin te /🔽ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus the Bhagavān said, “Two things protect the world: shame and embarrassment.”

original: yang sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang ldan pas sems dmigs pa'i yul la 'bad pa med par mnyam du 'jug pa de ni sems mnyam pa nyid de btang @256a * //
analyzed: yang sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang ldan pas sems dmigs pa'i yul la 'bad pa med par mnyam du 'jug pa de ni sems mnyam pa nyid de btang @256a * //
translated: The mind's equanimity is that by which the mind enters into the object of meditation without effort, when it is associated with a certain mental factor.

original: snyoms zhes brjod do //🔽de ni 'di ltar yul la rjes su chags pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: snyoms zhes brjod do // de ni 'di ltar yul la rjes su chags pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is called upeksa, equanimity.

original: khong khro ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: khong khro ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is so called because it is neither attached to the object nor averse to it.

original: de yang de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two kinds:

original: so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms so //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms so //
translated: equanimity through judgment and equanimity through non-judgment.

original: dgra bcom pa'i shes par gtogs pa ni so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i shes par gtogs pa ni so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms so //
translated: The equanimity of the Arhat is through judgment.

original: so so'i skye bo'i mi shes pa'i rjes su song ba ni so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i mi shes pa'i rjes su song ba ni so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms so //
translated: The equanimity of the ordinary man is through non-judgment.

original: rnam par grol ba ni sems kyi dri ma dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni sems kyi dri ma dang bral ba ste /
translated: Liberation is the mind's freedom from defilement.

original: nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs pas rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba'i sems las byung ba'i chos 'byung ba gang gis sems dri ma dang bral bar gyur pa de rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs pas rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba'i sems las byung ba'i chos 'byung ba gang gis sems dri ma dang bral bar gyur pa de rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The element of the mind called “liberation” is the arising of a mental factor that is the complete abandonment of the afflictions. It is the liberation of the mind that has become free from stains.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three roots of virtue:

original: ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'o //
translated: nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion.

original: de la ma chags pa ni sred pa'i gnyen por gyur ba'i chos dngos po'i don la zhen pa'i mtshan nyid do ;
analyzed: de la ma chags pa ni sred pa'i gnyen por gyur ba'i chos dngos po'i don la zhen pa'i mtshan nyid do ;
translated: Nonattachment is the antidote to craving. It is the quality of not clinging to the meaning of things.

original: / zhe sdang med pa ni khong khro ba'i gnyen po'i chos sems can rnams la sems rtsub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: / zhe sdang med pa ni khong khro ba'i gnyen po'i chos sems can rnams la sems rtsub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Nonhatred is the antidote to anger. It is the quality of not being harsh toward sentient beings.

original: gti mug med pa ni ma rig pa'i gnyen po'i chos shes rab kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gti mug med pa ni ma rig pa'i gnyen po'i chos shes rab kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: Nondelusion is the antidote to ignorance. It is the essence of wisdom.

original: 'di dag ni rang gi bdag nyid kyang dge ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang gi bdag nyid kyang dge ba yin la /
translated: These are virtues in and of themselves.

original: dge ba gzhan rnams kyi yang rtsa bar gyur par dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba gzhan rnams kyi yang rtsa bar gyur par dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: They are also the roots of other virtues.

original: 'di ltar shing rnams kyi rtsa ba 'dab ma la sogs pa skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyur gyur pa ltar /
analyzed: 'di ltar shing rnams kyi rtsa ba 'dab ma la sogs pa skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyur gyur pa ltar /
translated: Just as the root of trees is the cause for the arising, abiding, and growth of branches and leaves,

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rtsa bar dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po 'di dag nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rtsa bar dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po 'di dag nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: so too should these three roots of virtue be known as the root of all virtuous qualities.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po 'di dag las bzlog pa gsum ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po 'di dag las bzlog pa gsum ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: The three roots of nonvirtue are the opposite of these three roots of virtue.

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go //
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go //
translated: They are attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'dod chags thams cad ni chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'dod chags thams cad ni chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: Among them, all attachment belonging to the desire realm is the nonvirtuous root of attachment.

original: de ni gcig tu mi dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gcig tu mi dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a nonvirtuous root in only one way.

original: zhe sdang thams cad ni zhe sdang ste mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang thams cad ni zhe sdang ste mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: All aversion is the nonvirtuous root of aversion.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i gti mug ma gtogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma rig pa thams cad ni gti mug ste mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i gti mug ma gtogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma rig pa thams cad ni gti mug ste mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: All ignorance in the realm of desire, except for the delusion associated with the afflicted view of the self and the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, is the root of non-virtue.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three roots of the indeterminate:

original: sred pa dang / ma rig pa dang / blo @256b gros so //
analyzed: sred pa dang / ma rig pa dang / blo @256b gros so //
translated: craving, ignorance, and pride.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i gti mug ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ni mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i gti mug ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ni mi dge ba ste /
translated: Among them, all the afflictions and secondary afflictions in the realm of desire, except for the delusion associated with the afflicted view of the self, the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, and those views, are non-virtuous.

original: rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Because their karmic maturation is undesirable.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa gsum po ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa gsum po ste /
translated: All the afflictions and branch afflictions of the form and formless realms and the three of the afflicted view of the self, extreme view, etc. of the desire realm.🔽

original: de dag thams cad ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: All the afflictions and secondary afflictions of the form and formless realms, and the three views of the perishable composite, extreme views, and false views in the desire realm are neutral.

original: de la la la ni sred pa lung du ma bstan pa las /🔽la la ni ma rig pa lung du ma bstan pa las /
analyzed: de la la la ni sred pa lung du ma bstan pa las / la la ni ma rig pa lung du ma bstan pa las /
translated: Some are neutral due to craving,🔽some due to neutral ignorance,

original: la la ni shes rab lung du ma bstan pa las te /
analyzed: la la ni shes rab lung du ma bstan pa las te /
translated: and some due to neutral wisdom.

original: des na thams cad lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba zhes brjod de /
analyzed: des na thams cad lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba zhes brjod de /
translated: Therefore, they are called the roots of neutral states.

original: rang nyid kyang lung du ma bstan pa nyid yin la /🔽de las gzhan pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'i yang rtsa bar gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyang lung du ma bstan pa nyid yin la / de las gzhan pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'i yang rtsa bar gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are neutral by nature,🔽and they are the roots of other neutral states.

original: gzhan dag ni mi bstan pa nyid dang / mthon por 'jug pa'i phyir rtsa ba dang chos mi mthun pas lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mi bstan pa nyid dang / mthon por 'jug pa'i phyir rtsa ba dang chos mi mthun pas lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba ma yin no //
translated: Others are not roots of neutral states because they are not similar to roots in that they do not project or nourish.

original: kun du sbyor ba ni kun du sbyor ba dgu ste /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba ni kun du sbyor ba dgu ste /
translated: The fetters are the nine fetters.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor ba dang / nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor ba dang / nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang /
translated: the fetter of attachment, the fetter of repugnance, the fetter of pride, the fetter of ignorance, the fetter of views, the fetter of adherence,

original: the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba dang / phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba dang / ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba dang / phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba dang / ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the fetter of doubt, the fetter of envy, and the fetter of avarice.

original: de la rjes su chags pa ni sred pa dang / kun du zhen pa dang / chags pa dang / 'dod chags te /
analyzed: de la rjes su chags pa ni sred pa dang / kun du zhen pa dang / chags pa dang / 'dod chags te /
translated: Among them, attachment is craving, complete immersion, passion, and desire.

original: de dag gnyis kyis srid pa'i sdug bsngal la rab tu sbyor bas na kun du sbyor bas na kun du sbyor ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag gnyis kyis srid pa'i sdug bsngal la rab tu sbyor bas na kun du sbyor bas na kun du sbyor ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Since they connect one to the suffering of existence, they are called fetters.

original: khong khro ni gnod sems dang zhe sdang ste /
analyzed: khong khro ni gnod sems dang zhe sdang ste /
translated: Repugnance is malice and hatred.

original: sems can gyi yul la mnar sems pa ni khong khro pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi yul la mnar sems pa ni khong khro pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Hostility is the fetter of ill will.

original: nga rgyal bdun ni nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor bar brjod do //
analyzed: nga rgyal bdun ni nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor bar brjod do //
translated: Seven types of pride are called the fetter of pride.🔽They are pride, excessive pride,🔽pride of superiority, inordinate pride,🔽pride of inferiority,

original: 'di lta ste nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i @257a * //🔽nga rgyal lo //🔽de ni bdag nyid gzhan dag pas bden pa mi bden pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig yongs su brtags nas khengs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i @257a * // nga rgyal lo // de ni bdag nyid gzhan dag pas bden pa mi bden pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig yongs su brtags nas khengs par byed pa ste /
translated: pride of conceit, and false pride.🔽It is an afflicted mental factor that causes the mind to become inflated by imagining that one is superior to others in some way, whether that be true or not.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin 'gyur ba 'byung ba'i rgyu sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin 'gyur ba 'byung ba'i rgyu sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: It is a cause for the mind to become distorted and change.

original: 'di ni re zhig nga rgyal spyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig nga rgyal spyi'o //
translated: This is the general definition of pride.

original: de ni 'jug pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: de ni 'jug pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bdun no //
translated: It has seven types based on its different modes of operation.

original: de la 'jig rten ni dman pa dang / bar ma dang / mchog gi bye brag tu phan tshun ltos nas rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten ni dman pa dang / bar ma dang / mchog gi bye brag tu phan tshun ltos nas rnam par gnas so //
translated: The world is established in relation to one another as inferior, middling, and superior.

original: de la gang dman pa la ltos nas rnam pa gsum du rtog pa de la thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / rigs dang ; gzugs dang / dbang phyug la sogs pas dman pa las bdag nyid dman no snyam du khengs pa gang sems kyi rang bzhin 'gyur bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid can de yang re zhig nga rgyal zhes bstan to //🔽gang yang dman pa dang bdag mtshungs par dmigs pas ji ltar yongs su brtags pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pa 'di yang nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang dman pa la ltos nas rnam pa gsum du rtog pa de la thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / rigs dang ; gzugs dang / dbang phyug la sogs pas dman pa las bdag nyid dman no snyam du khengs pa gang sems kyi rang bzhin 'gyur bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid can de yang re zhig nga rgyal zhes bstan to // gang yang dman pa dang bdag mtshungs par dmigs pas ji ltar yongs su brtags pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pa 'di yang nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, that which is conceived as threefold in relation to the inferior is the pride that thinks, “I am inferior” in relation to those who are inferior in learning, morality, family, body, power, etc. That is also called pride, since it is a transformation of the nature of the mind.🔽That which is called pride is also that which generates the distinctions that are imagined in relation to the inferior, thinking, “I am like that.”

original: gang yang dman pa las bdag lhag par nye bar dmigs nas kun du rtog pa'i khyad par 'byung ba de yang nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gang yang dman pa las bdag lhag par nye bar dmigs nas kun du rtog pa'i khyad par 'byung ba de yang nga rgyal lo //
translated: That which is called pride is also that which arises from the distinctions of imagination when one observes that one is superior to the inferior.

original: gang yang mtshungs pa dang bdag nyid mtshungs par nye bar dmigs pa'i yongs su rtog pa'i khyad par 'byung ba de yang nga rgyal te /
analyzed: gang yang mtshungs pa dang bdag nyid mtshungs par nye bar dmigs pa'i yongs su rtog pa'i khyad par 'byung ba de yang nga rgyal te /
translated: Pride is the notion that one is equal or superior to one's equals or inferiors, respectively.

original: srid pa'i dbang du byas nas mu bzhir rnam par gzhag go //🔽gang dag shin tu dman par yin pa las 'di dang bdag mtshungs so snyam nas lhag par nga rgyal byed pa de ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal te /
analyzed: srid pa'i dbang du byas nas mu bzhir rnam par gzhag go // gang dag shin tu dman par yin pa las 'di dang bdag mtshungs so snyam nas lhag par nga rgyal byed pa de ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal te /
translated: It is established as having four varieties in terms of existence.🔽Excessive pride is the notion that one is superior to those who are superior.🔽It is excessive pride because it exceeds the characteristic of pride.🔽Pride of thinking I is the notion that one is superior to those who are equal.

original: nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid las shin tu 'das nas 'jug pas lhag pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid las shin tu 'das nas 'jug pas lhag pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: It is pride of thinking I because it is the cause for the application of the term I in the sense of I am.

original: gang khyad par du 'phags pa las kyang /🔽bdag khyad par can du rnam par brtags nas khengs par byed pa de ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal te /
analyzed: gang khyad par du 'phags pa las kyang / bdag khyad par can du rnam par brtags nas khengs par byed pa de ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal te /
translated: Pride of conceit is the notion that one is superior to those who are superior.🔽It is pride of conceit because it is the cause for the application of the term conceit in the sense of I am superior.🔽Pride of inferiority is the notion that one is superior to those who are manifestly superior.

original: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal gyi sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu ni sngar gyi de dag las kyang sdig pa la 'jug pa nyid du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal gyi sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu ni sngar gyi de dag las kyang sdig pa la 'jug pa nyid du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pride of inferiority because it is the cause for the application of the term inferiority in the sense of I am superior.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po stong pa nyid la gang bdag go zhes yongs su rtog pa ni nga'i snyam pa'i nga rgyal te bdag tu nga rgyal byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po stong pa nyid la gang bdag go zhes yongs su rtog pa ni nga'i snyam pa'i nga rgyal te bdag tu nga rgyal byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The pride of “I am” is the pride that thinks “I am” in regard to the five appropriating aggregates which are empty. The meaning of the expression “pride in self” is the same as “pride in ‘I am.’”

original: bdag tu rnam par brtag pa'i rgyur gyur pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po ni nye bar @257b len pa'i phung po'o //🔽yang na nye bar len pa ste /
analyzed: bdag tu rnam par brtag pa'i rgyur gyur pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po ni nye bar @257b len pa'i phung po'o // yang na nye bar len pa ste /
translated: The appropriating aggregates are the aggregates that are the cause of the conception of self.

original: nyon mongs pa dag las rab tu byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po ste rtsva dang phub ma'i me zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag las rab tu byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po ste rtsva dang phub ma'i me zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Or, they are the appropriating aggregates because they are the result of the afflictions.

original: nye bar len pa la rag lus pa nyid kyis kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po ste rgyal po'i skyes bu bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa la rag lus pa nyid kyis kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po ste rgyal po'i skyes bu bzhin no //
translated: They are the appropriating aggregates because they are dependent on appropriation, like a king’s man.

original: nye bar len pa rnams de dag las byung ba nyid kyis kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po ste me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa rnams de dag las byung ba nyid kyis kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po ste me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing bzhin no //
translated: They are the appropriating aggregates because the appropriators arise from them, like a flower tree and a fruit tree.

original: de ni stong pa ste nye bar brten nas btags pas /
analyzed: de ni stong pa ste nye bar brten nas btags pas /
translated: It is empty, since it is imputed in dependence.

original: bdag gi rdzas dang bral ba nyid kyis ngo bo med pa nyid de /
analyzed: bdag gi rdzas dang bral ba nyid kyis ngo bo med pa nyid de /
translated: It is essenceless, since it is devoid of a substantial self.

original: de dag de lta bu'i tshul la rmongs pas bdag go zhes 'dzin pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: de dag de lta bu'i tshul la rmongs pas bdag go zhes 'dzin pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Since they are confused about that mode, they grasp it as a self. That is the pride of “I am.”

original: gong ma'i khyad par rtogs par bya ba ma thob par de bdag gis thob bo snyam du gang la mngon du phyogs nas khengs par byed pa de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gong ma'i khyad par rtogs par bya ba ma thob par de bdag gis thob bo snyam du gang la mngon du phyogs nas khengs par byed pa de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The pride of thinking “I am” is the inflation that occurs when one thinks, “I have attained what is to be realized, the special state of a higher being,” when in fact one has not attained it.

original: de la gong ma'i khyad par rtogs par bya ba ni mi'i chos tha mal pa 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa las shin tu 'das nas gang rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la gong ma'i khyad par rtogs par bya ba ni mi'i chos tha mal pa 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa las shin tu 'das nas gang rnam par gnas pa ste /
translated: In this regard, the realization of the special state of a higher being is the state of one who has completely transcended the ordinary human condition of desire and attachment to sense objects.

original: 'di lta ste bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu la sogs pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu la sogs pa shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the meditative concentrations, the results of the meditative concentrations, the meditative absorptions, the results of the meditative absorptions, and so on.

original: log pa'i las la zhugs pas gang log pa'i las mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can gyi chos gsod pa la sogs pa'i las byed pa la nga rgyal te /
analyzed: log pa'i las la zhugs pas gang log pa'i las mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can gyi chos gsod pa la sogs pa'i las byed pa la nga rgyal te /
translated: The pride of false view is the pride of one who, having engaged in false actions, is proud of the action of killing, etc., which is the cause of an undesirable result.

original: gang spro bar byed cing 'jug pa'i nga rgyal ni log pa'i nga rgyal zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang spro bar byed cing 'jug pa'i nga rgyal ni log pa'i nga rgyal zhes brjod do //
translated: The pride of false view is called the pride of one who is proud of and engages in false actions.

original: bya ba thams cad sgrub pa la bdag la nus pa med do zhes btags te bdag la dmigs nas brnyas pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba thams cad sgrub pa la bdag la nus pa med do zhes btags te bdag la dmigs nas brnyas pa ste /
translated: The pride of thinking “I am” is the pride of one who, having no ability to accomplish any action, thinks “I am” and despises others, focusing on the self.

original: gang bdag la dam pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa de ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gang bdag la dam pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa de ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The pride of thinking “I am a little” is the pride of one who thinks “I am not the best” in regard to the self.

original: nga rgyal bdun bshad zin to //
analyzed: nga rgyal bdun bshad zin to //
translated: These are the seven types of pride.

original: ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fetter of ignorance?

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang ldan pas de log pa'i yid kyis bden pa'i don mi mthong ba dang / dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs pa de ni ma rig pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dang ldan pas de log pa'i yid kyis bden pa'i don mi mthong ba dang / dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs pa de ni ma rig pa zhes brjod do //
