translated: It is that mental factor through the possession of which the mind does not see the truth of things as they are, and which is the superimposition of an entity’s own nature. This is called ignorance.

original: de ma rig pa ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi yul la zag pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ma rig pa ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi yul la zag pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Ignorance is the non-defiled knowledge of the reality of dharmas.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bor gnas pa dkon mchog gsum dang bden pa la sogs pa mi shes pa tsam mo //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bor gnas pa dkon mchog gsum dang bden pa la sogs pa mi shes pa tsam mo //
translated: It is the mere non-knowledge of the Three Jewels, the Truths, etc., which is the opposite of that.

original: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fetter of views?

original: lta ba gsum po dag la lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba zhes @258a * //
analyzed: lta ba gsum po dag la lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba zhes @258a * //
translated: The three views are called the fetter of views.

original: brjod do // 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brjod do // 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba'o //
translated: the view of individuality, the view of grasping extremes, and wrong views.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po la gang zag la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa la phyin ci log tu sgro btags te bden pa'i ngo bo nyid du zhen cing rnam pa nyi shur 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po la gang zag la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa la phyin ci log tu sgro btags te bden pa'i ngo bo nyid du zhen cing rnam pa nyi shur 'jug pa ste /
translated: Among them, the view of individuality is the adherence to the five aggregates of attachment, form, etc., as real, i.e., as having the nature of a real being, etc., and the adherence to them as having a real nature, i.e., as having the nature of truth, through the superimposition of the opposite of what is not so. It operates in twenty aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: gzugs bdag yin par lta ba dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / gzugs bdag gi yin pa dang / gzugs la bdag gnas par lta ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs bdag yin par lta ba dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / gzugs bdag gi yin pa dang / gzugs la bdag gnas par lta ba ste /
translated: The four parts of the afflicted view of the self are the view that form is the self, the view that the self possesses form, the view that the self is in form, and the view that form is in the self.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag ni gzugs kyi phung po gtsor bzung nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i cha bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag ni gzugs kyi phung po gtsor bzung nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i cha bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, these four parts of the afflicted view of the self are based on the form heap.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du gtsor bzung nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i cha bzhi bzhi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du gtsor bzung nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i cha bzhi bzhi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, four parts of the afflicted view of the self are based on each of the other heaps up to consciousness.

original: rnam par nyams par 'gyur bas na 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par nyams par 'gyur bas na 'jig pa ste /
translated: It is perishable because it perishes.

original: khyad par du 'jig cing nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par du 'jig cing nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is perishable because it perishes in a special way.

original: rtsing nga ni bstsags pa ste bstsags par yod pa dang / gnas dang / tshogs pa dang / lus dang / nye bar zhi bar byed pa rnams la 'jug pa las 'dir k'a ya zhes bya ba bstsags pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rtsing nga ni bstsags pa ste bstsags par yod pa dang / gnas dang / tshogs pa dang / lus dang / nye bar zhi bar byed pa rnams la 'jug pa las 'dir k'a ya zhes bya ba bstsags pa la bya ste /
translated: It is coarse because it is a collection. It is a collection, an abode, an accumulation, a body, and a pacification. Here, kaya is a collection.

original: mang po dang tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mang po dang tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means a multitude and an accumulation.

original: 'jig pa yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas 'jig tshogs te /
analyzed: 'jig pa yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas 'jig tshogs te /
translated: It is a collection because it is a collection of many things.

original: 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can tshogs pa ni 'jig tshogs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can tshogs pa ni 'jig tshogs zhes brjod do //
translated: It is a collection of perishable things, thus it is a perishable collection.

original: de lta bu la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin par zhugs pa'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de lta bu la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin par zhugs pa'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The wisdom that is afflicted by engaging in the apprehension of the perishable collection as an “I” and “mine” is called the afflicted view of the perishable collection.

original: mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa ni mthar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa ni mthar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The apprehension of the two extremes is extreme view.

original: 'dzin pa ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Apprehension is firm adherence.

original: 'di lta bu'i mthar lta ba ni /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i mthar lta ba ni /
translated: This is the view of the two extremes.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba ste /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba ste /
translated: Extreme view is the view of the two extremes.🔽The afflicted view of the perishable collection superimposes the five appropriated aggregates as having the nature of an “I” and apprehends them as an “I.”

original: 'jig tshogs la lta bas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bdag gi ngo bo nyid du yod par sgro btags nas bdag nyid du bzung ba dang / gang bdag dang 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta bas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bdag gi ngo bo nyid du yod par sgro btags nas bdag nyid du bzung ba dang / gang bdag dang 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The view that “I” and the world are permanent or

original: gang bdag dang 'jig rten chad do zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gang bdag dang 'jig rten chad do zhes bya ba'am /
translated: the view that “I” and the world are annihilated

original: de bzhin du yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis su brtags nas 'jug pa'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta @258b ba'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis su brtags nas 'jug pa'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta @258b ba'o ;
translated: Likewise, the afflicted wisdom that engages by imagining the two extremes, such as existence and nonexistence, is the view grasping extremes.

original: / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog gsum dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa la skur pa 'debs shing med pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can ni log par lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog gsum dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa la skur pa 'debs shing med pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can ni log par lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The afflicted wisdom that deprecates causes, effects, the four truths, the three jewels, dependent origination and so on and engages in the aspect of nonexistence is called wrong view.

original: de lta bu'i lta ba gsum po dag lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i lta ba gsum po dag lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba zhes brjod do //
translated: These three views are called the fetter of view.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba du zhe na /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba du zhe na /
translated: How many fetters are there that grasp the highest?

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bstan te /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bstan te /
translated: Two types of grasping the highest are taught to be the fetter of grasping the highest.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are🔽grasping the highest view and

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: grasping the highest form of ethical conduct and ritual.

original: de la dman pa la dam par 'dzin pa'i lta ba ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dman pa la dam par 'dzin pa'i lta ba ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view that holds the inferior to be superior is the overesteeming of that which is inferior.

original: dman pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: dman pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is inferior?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad de /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad de /
translated: All things that are impure.

original: 'phags pas spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pas spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are abandoned by the noble ones.

original: de la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni gzhan de ma yin pa'i don la 'di dag ni dam pa'o zhes de ltar gang mngon par zhen pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni gzhan de ma yin pa'i don la 'di dag ni dam pa'o zhes de ltar gang mngon par zhen pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The overesteeming of that which is inferior is the adherence to the view that those things that are not the highest are the highest.🔽Since all things that are impure are overestimated as being the highest, it should be called the overesteeming of the impure as the highest.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad la dam pa nyid mchog tu 'dzin pas na zag pa dang bcas pa mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes brjod par bya ba yin na ci'i phyir lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes brjod /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad la dam pa nyid mchog tu 'dzin pas na zag pa dang bcas pa mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes brjod par bya ba yin na ci'i phyir lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes brjod /
translated: Why is it called the overesteeming of the view?

original: de lta ba kho na la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ba kho na la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not the overesteeming of the view alone.

original: des na 'dir sogs pa'i sgra phyis par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: des na 'dir sogs pa'i sgra phyis par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the word “etc.” should be supplied here.

original: lta ba la sogs pa rnams la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa rnams la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The grasping of views, etc. as supreme is the esteeming of views.

original: rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta ba dang / lam ma yin pa la lam du lta ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta ba dang / lam ma yin pa la lam du lta ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view of a cause in what is not a cause and the view of a path in what is not a path are the esteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras phyis par blta'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras phyis par blta'o //
translated: Here, the term “etc.” should be understood as referring to the view of a means of purification in what is not a means of purification.

original: de lta bas na dman pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam la mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin gyi zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad la dag pa dang / grol ba dang / nges par 'byin pa'i bdag nyid kyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dman pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam la mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin gyi zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad la dag pa dang / grol ba dang / nges par 'byin pa'i bdag nyid kyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not just a lowly morality and asceticism that are grasped as supreme, but all things that are possessed of outflows are grasped as having the nature of a path that is pure, liberated, and that definitely leads to release.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa 'di gnyis ni mchog tu 'dzin pa kun du sbyor ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa 'di gnyis ni mchog tu 'dzin pa kun du sbyor ba zhes brjod do //
translated: These two graspings as supreme are called the fetter of grasping as supreme.

original: bden pa dang dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la yod pa dang med pa'i rnam pa gnyis su rab tu zhugs pa'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gyis kun du sbyor ba'i bdag nyid ni the tshom ste /
analyzed: bden pa dang dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la yod pa dang med pa'i rnam pa gnyis su rab tu zhugs pa'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gyis kun du sbyor ba'i bdag nyid ni the tshom ste /
translated: Doubt is the afflicted wisdom that engages in the two aspects of existence and nonexistence in relation to the truths, the three jewels, and so on.

original: @259a * // de ni the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @259a * // de ni the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the fetter of doubt.

original: phrag dog ni gzhan gyi yon tan gyis gdung ba ste chos gang dang ldan na gang dang gang du pha rol du thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / gtong ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan tshogs pa nye ba la dmigs pa de dang der gang zag de la nang du shin tu gdung ba 'byung ste /🔽chos de ni phrag dog ces bya bar brjod de /
analyzed: phrag dog ni gzhan gyi yon tan gyis gdung ba ste chos gang dang ldan na gang dang gang du pha rol du thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / gtong ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan tshogs pa nye ba la dmigs pa de dang der gang zag de la nang du shin tu gdung ba 'byung ste / chos de ni phrag dog ces bya bar brjod de /
translated: Envy is the affliction of others' good qualities. When one possesses this dharma, wherever one goes, one is tormented by the internal arising of envy in relation to the assembly of others' good qualities, such as learning, ethics, generosity, physical beauty and so on.🔽This dharma is called envy.

original: chos de ni phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: chos de ni phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: This dharma is the fetter of envy.

original: chos dang mkhas pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa sbyin pa dang rab tu 'gal ba sems kyis kun tu 'dzin pa ni ser sna ste /
analyzed: chos dang mkhas pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa sbyin pa dang rab tu 'gal ba sems kyis kun tu 'dzin pa ni ser sna ste /
translated: The mental grasping of generosity and so on that is incompatible with generosity and so on is stinginess.

original: de ni ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the fetter of stinginess.

original: kun du sbyor ba dgu bshad zin to //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba dgu bshad zin to //
translated: The nine fetters have been explained.

original: nges par 'ching ba zhes bya ba las nges par 'ching ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: nges par 'ching ba zhes bya ba las nges par 'ching ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The three bonds are:

original: 'dod chags kyi nges par 'ching ba dang / zhe sdang gi nges par 'ching ba dang / gti mug gi nges par 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi nges par 'ching ba dang / zhe sdang gi nges par 'ching ba dang / gti mug gi nges par 'ching ba'o //
translated: the bond of desire, the bond of hatred, and the bond of delusion.🔽Since these bonds tightly bind the three realms, they are called the bonds.

original: 'ching ba 'di dag gis khams gsum po rnams rab tu bcings pas na 'di dag ni nges par 'ching bas phra rgyas zhes bya ba la 'dir drug ni phra rgyas kyi rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: 'ching ba 'di dag gis khams gsum po rnams rab tu bcings pas na 'di dag ni nges par 'ching bas phra rgyas zhes bya ba la 'dir drug ni phra rgyas kyi rtsa ba ste /
translated: Here, the six are the roots of the negative tendencies.

original: 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas dang / khong khro'i phra rgyas dang / nga rgyal gyi phra rgyas dang / ma rig pa'i phra rgyas dang / lta ba'i phra rgyas dang / the tshom gyi phra rgyas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas dang / khong khro'i phra rgyas dang / nga rgyal gyi phra rgyas dang / ma rig pa'i phra rgyas dang / lta ba'i phra rgyas dang / the tshom gyi phra rgyas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the proclivity of attachment, the proclivity of anger, the proclivity of pride, the proclivity of ignorance, the proclivity of views, and the proclivity of doubt.

original: phra rgyas drug po 'di dag las 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya bas 'dod chags rnam pa gnyis su dbye bas yang rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas drug po 'di dag las 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya bas 'dod chags rnam pa gnyis su dbye bas yang rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: From these six proclivities, attachment is divided into two types: attachment to the desire realm and attachment to existence. Thus, there are seven types.

original: phra rgyas drug po 'di dag las yang lta ba'i phra rgyas la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'i dbye bas phra rgyas bcur 'gyur te /
analyzed: phra rgyas drug po 'di dag las yang lta ba'i phra rgyas la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'i dbye bas phra rgyas bcur 'gyur te /
translated: From these six proclivities, the proclivity of views is divided into five types: the view of the perishing aggregates, etc. Thus, there are ten proclivities.

original: phra rgyas bcu po 'di dag rang gi ngo bo yang khams kyi dbye ba dang / bye brag gi dbye bas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas bcu po 'di dag rang gi ngo bo yang khams kyi dbye ba dang / bye brag gi dbye bas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: These ten proclivities are divided into ninety-eight by way of their intrinsic natures, realms, and specific types.

original: de la khams ni gsum ste /
analyzed: de la khams ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three realms:

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: The realm of desire, the realm of form, and the formless realm.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams ni gnas nyi shu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams ni gnas nyi shu 'di lta ste /
translated: The realm of desire is made up of twenty places:🔽eight great hells:

original: dmyal ba chen po brgyad la yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus 'joms dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / cha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba chen po brgyad la yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus 'joms dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / cha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the Reviving, the Black-Lined, the Crushing, the Howling, the Great Howling, the Heating, the Great Heating, and the Unrelenting.🔽two for the animals and the hungry ghosts;🔽four continents:

original: @259b byol song dang / yi dags gnyis dang / gling bzhi la 'dzam bu'i gling dang / shar gyi lus 'phags dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @259b byol song dang / yi dags gnyis dang / gling bzhi la 'dzam bu'i gling dang / shar gyi lus 'phags dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the Continent of Jambu, the Superior Body to the East, the Body-Enjoying to the West, and the Superior Sound to the North.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha ris drug ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha ris drug ni 'di lta ste /
translated: six classes of gods in the realm of desire:

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang// 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang// 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: the Four Great Kings, the Thirty-three, the Yāma, the Joyous, the Creative-Enjoyment, and the Controller of Others’ Creations.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi skye ba'i bsam gtan bzhi la spyir ni gnas gzhan bcu bdun te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi skye ba'i bsam gtan bzhi la spyir ni gnas gzhan bcu bdun te /
translated: In general, the form realm has seventeen other abodes of the four absorptions.

original: tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs pa chen po ste bsam gtan dang por skye ba'i gnas gzhan gsum mo //
analyzed: tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs pa chen po ste bsam gtan dang por skye ba'i gnas gzhan gsum mo //
translated: Brahmakayika, Brahmapurohita, and Mahabrahma are the three other abodes of birth in the first absorption.

original: 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i skye ba'i gnas gzhan gsum mo //
analyzed: 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i skye ba'i gnas gzhan gsum mo //
translated: Parittabha, Apramanabha, and Abhasvara are the three other abodes of birth in the second absorption.

original: dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas zhes bya ba 'di ni bsam gtan gsum par skye ba'i gnas gzhan gsum mo //
analyzed: dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas zhes bya ba 'di ni bsam gtan gsum par skye ba'i gnas gzhan gsum mo //
translated: Parittaśubha, Apramāṇaśubha, and Śubhakṛtsna are the three other abodes of birth in the third absorption.

original: sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i gnas gzhan 'di gsum dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang dang / 'og min zhes bya ba gnas gtsang ma'i ris gnas lnga dang brgyad po 'di dag ni bsam gtan bzhi ba ste /
analyzed: sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i gnas gzhan 'di gsum dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang dang / 'og min zhes bya ba gnas gtsang ma'i ris gnas lnga dang brgyad po 'di dag ni bsam gtan bzhi ba ste /
translated: These eight are the fourth meditation.

original: 'di dag ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: These are the realm of form.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni gzugs can ma yin pas gnas med do //🔽de ni skye ba las rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni gzugs can ma yin pas gnas med do // de ni skye ba las rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The formless realm has no location, since it is not form.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is fourfold from the point of view of birth:🔽the sphere of infinite space,🔽the sphere of infinite consciousness,🔽the sphere of nothingness,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba ste /
translated: and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'di dag ni gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: These are the formless realm.

original: 'di dag ni re zhig khams kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni re zhig khams kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: This is the classification of the realms.

original: bye brag gi dbye ba ni khams gsum po de rnams la re re zhing lnga lnga ste /
analyzed: bye brag gi dbye ba ni khams gsum po de rnams la re re zhing lnga lnga ste /
translated: The specific classification is that each of those three realms has five types.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris dang / kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris dang / kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called the class to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, the class to be abandoned by seeing the truths of origin, cessation, and path, and the class to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
translated: The truth of suffering is the five appropriated aggregates that are the result.

original: @260a * // de dag gi rgyur gyur pa ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: @260a * // de dag gi rgyur gyur pa ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of origin is the cause of those.

original: sred pa dang las yongs su zad pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa shin tu ma skyes pa snum dang snying po yongs su zad pa'i mar me lta bu'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang las yongs su zad pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa shin tu ma skyes pa snum dang snying po yongs su zad pa'i mar me lta bu'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the truth of cessation, which is the complete nonarising of the truth of suffering due to the complete exhaustion of craving and karma, like a butter lamp that is extinguished.

original: de 'thob pa'i thabs 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de 'thob pa'i thabs 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of the path is the method for attaining that, which is the eightfold noble path.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid du yid la byed pa na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid du yid la byed pa na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: When one focuses on the truth of suffering in the desire realm as impermanent, as suffering, as empty and as selfless, one has the acceptance of the knowledge of the phenomena of suffering.

original: chos shes pa zhes bya ba skye ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa zhes bya ba skye ste /
translated: When one focuses on the truth of suffering in the desire realm as impermanent, as suffering, as empty and as selfless, one generates the acceptance of the knowledge of the phenomena of suffering and the knowledge of the phenomena of suffering.

original: de dag gis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bcu po 'di rnams rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: de dag gis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bcu po 'di rnams rab tu spong ngo //
translated: By these one abandons the ten afflictions that are to be abandoned in the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yang de bzhin du yid la bya bas sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yang de bzhin du yid la bya bas sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa skye'o //
translated: Similarly, by focusing on the truth of suffering in the form and formless realms, one generates the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of suffering and the subsequent knowledge of suffering.

original: de dag gis khong khro ma gtogs pa'i gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dgu dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de dag gis khong khro ma gtogs pa'i gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dgu dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dgu ste /
translated: By these one abandons the nine afflictions of the form realm except for anger and the nine afflictions of the formless realm.

original: de ltar bco brgyad spong ste /
analyzed: de ltar bco brgyad spong ste /
translated: Thus one abandons eighteen.

original: de ltar khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs pa chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa'i rnam pa'i skad cig ma bzhis sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa brgyad rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs pa chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa'i rnam pa'i skad cig ma bzhis sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa brgyad rab tu spong ngo //
translated: Thus, one abandons the twenty-eight negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering of the three realms through four moments of perseverance for Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge that directly realize the truth of suffering and knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa brgyad po de rnams las 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs par phra rgyas gzhan bdun po ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung gi bden pa la rgyu nyid dang /
analyzed: phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa brgyad po de rnams las 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs par phra rgyas gzhan bdun po ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung gi bden pa la rgyu nyid dang /
translated: From among those twenty-eight negative tendencies, seven negative tendencies other than the afflicted view of the self, extreme view and clinging to rules and ritual as supreme are the cause of the truth of origin that is experienced in the desire realm.

original: kun 'byung ba nyid dang / rab tu skye ba nyid dang / rkyen nyid ces bya bar yid la byed pa na de ltar kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba nyid dang / rab tu skye ba nyid dang / rkyen nyid ces bya bar yid la byed pa na de ltar kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa skye ste /
translated: When one mentally attends to the truth of origin as cause, origin, strong generation and condition, perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin and Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin arise.

original: de dag gis spong ngo //
analyzed: de dag gis spong ngo //
translated: They abandon those.🔽The twelve negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin

original: de dag nyid las khong khro bor ba khams gnyis po dang / gzugs med pa ni spyod pa'i phra rgyas bcu gnyis kun 'byung ba'i bden pa mthong ba kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa dag gis rab @260b tu spong ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid las khong khro bor ba khams gnyis po dang / gzugs med pa ni spyod pa'i phra rgyas bcu gnyis kun 'byung ba'i bden pa mthong ba kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa dag gis rab @260b tu spong ste /
translated: are completely abandoned by the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin and by the subsequent knowledge that arises from seeing the truth of origin in the two realms and the formless realm.

original: de ltar phra rgyas bcu dgu ni kun 'byung mthong bas spong ngo //🔽de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i bden pa'i 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa bzhi yid la byed pas kun 'byung la bstan pa'i phra rgyas bdun po de dag 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar phra rgyas bcu dgu ni kun 'byung mthong bas spong ngo // de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i bden pa'i 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa bzhi yid la byed pas kun 'byung la bstan pa'i phra rgyas bdun po de dag 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: Thus nineteen negative tendencies are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa dag gis rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa dag gis rab tu spong ngo //
translated: Similarly, the seven negative tendencies that are taught to be the origin of suffering in the desire realm are completely abandoned by perseverance for the Dharma knowledge of cessation and by the Dharma knowledge of cessation that focuses on the four aspects of cessation, peace, excellence and definite emergence that are the truth of cessation of suffering.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa dag gis gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas bcu gnyis rab tu spong ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa dag gis gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas bcu gnyis rab tu spong ste /
translated: The perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation and the subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation abandon the twelve negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that focus on the truths of cessation and path in the form and formless realms.

original: de ltar na phra rgyas bcu dgu ni khams gsum po'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i bden pa mthong bas rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na phra rgyas bcu dgu ni khams gsum po'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i bden pa mthong bas rab tu spong ngo //
translated: Thus nineteen negative tendencies are abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation of the three realms.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyi bden pa la lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa bzhi yid la byed pa lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyi bden pa la lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa bzhi yid la byed pa lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: Similarly, the perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of the path and the knowledge of the truth of the path that focuses on the truth of the path that is the path going to the cessation of suffering in the desire realm and that possesses the four aspects of path,🔽reason, accomplishment and definite release abandon the eight negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that focus on the truth of the path in the desire realm.

original: chos shes pa dag gis sngar bstan pa'i bdun po la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa snga ma la med pa bsnan pa'i brgyad ni lam gyi bden pa mthong bas spong ngo //
analyzed: chos shes pa dag gis sngar bstan pa'i bdun po la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa snga ma la med pa bsnan pa'i brgyad ni lam gyi bden pa mthong bas spong ngo //
translated: The seven previously explained negative tendencies are augmented by the addition of the former overesteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang rjes su shes pa dag gis ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas bcu bzhi lam gyi bden pa mthong bas rab tu spong bar byed do //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang rjes su shes pa dag gis ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas bcu bzhi lam gyi bden pa mthong bas rab tu spong bar byed do //
translated: The perseverance for subsequent knowledge and the subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path completely eliminate the fourteen negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path and that are associated with the form and formless realms.

original: de ltar na phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa gnyis ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa gnyis ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Thus twenty two negative tendencies are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bsgoms pas ji ltar mthong ba'i rjes la spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bsgoms pas ji ltar mthong ba'i rjes la spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Those that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation are those that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation that is subsequent to the path of seeing the four noble truths such as suffering.

original: de la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya'o //
translated: Among them, attachment, aversion, pride and ignorance are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm.

original: khong khro ma gtogs pa rnams ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: khong khro ma gtogs pa rnams ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ste /
translated: Those except for aversion are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the form and formless realms.

original: kun bsdoms na phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: kun bsdoms na phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: In total, there are ninety eight negative tendencies.

original: de rnams las 'dod pa na spyod pa ni sum cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: de rnams las 'dod pa na spyod pa ni sum cu rtsa drug go //
translated: Among these, thirty-six are related to the realm of desire.

original: gzugs na spyod pa ni sum cu rtsa gcig / gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang sum cu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa ni sum cu rtsa gcig / gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang sum cu rtsa gcig go //
translated: Thirty-one are related to the realm of form. Thirty-one are related to the formless realm.

original: de dag las mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni brgyad cu rtsa brgyad @261a * //
analyzed: de dag las mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni brgyad cu rtsa brgyad @261a * //
translated: Among these, eighty-eight are to be abandoned by the path of insight.

original: do ; /'dir ji skad bshad pa'i phra rgyas spong ba'i ye shes dang ldan pas 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: do ; /'dir ji skad bshad pa'i phra rgyas spong ba'i ye shes dang ldan pas 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the noble persons who possess the knowledge that abandons the proclivities as they have been explained become eight in number.

original: ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is this?

original: de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de brjod par bya ste /
translated: This will be explained.

original: go rims bzhin du 'jug pa la //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du 'jug pa la //
translated: In order,

original: mthong lam skad cig bcu drug gis //
analyzed: mthong lam skad cig bcu drug gis //
translated: the path of insight in sixteen moments

original: gang zhig spangs pa'i 'bras bu de //
analyzed: gang zhig spangs pa'i 'bras bu de //
translated: is the fruit of the abandonment of the proclivities.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: One is then called a stream-winner.

original: 'dod na chags sdang nga rgyal rmongs //
analyzed: 'dod na chags sdang nga rgyal rmongs //
translated: In the realm of desire, the four, attachment, hostility, pride, and ignorance,

original: gong ma'i sa brgyad so so la //
analyzed: gong ma'i sa brgyad so so la //
translated: and in each of the eight stages of the higher realms,

original: zhe sdang ma gtogs bsgom spang bya //🔽bsdus nas che sogs rnam gsum la //
analyzed: zhe sdang ma gtogs bsgom spang bya // bsdus nas che sogs rnam gsum la //
translated: except for hostility, are to be abandoned by cultivation.🔽In summary, the great, etc., are of three kinds.

original: chen po'i che sogs bye brag gis //
analyzed: chen po'i che sogs bye brag gis //
translated: The great of the great, etc., are distinguished.

original: rnam pa yang ni gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: rnam pa yang ni gsum du 'dod //
translated: The aspects are held to be three.

original: nyon mongs pa ni rnam dgu la //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni rnam dgu la //
translated: The afflictions are nine in number.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs ni bzlog pas so //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs ni bzlog pas so //
translated: The antidote is the opposite of that.

original: 'dod pa'i rnam pa drug pa dang // dgu pa dag ni zad pa las //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam pa drug pa dang // dgu pa dag ni zad pa las //
translated: The sixth and ninth aspects of the desire realm

original: lan cig phyir ni 'ong ba dang // phyir mi 'ong ba'i gang zag 'gyur //🔽dgra bcom srid rtse'i mtha' zad pas //
analyzed: lan cig phyir ni 'ong ba dang // phyir mi 'ong ba'i gang zag 'gyur // dgra bcom srid rtse'i mtha' zad pas //
translated: are the persons who are once returners and nonreturners.🔽Arhats are those who have exhausted existence at the peak of existence.

original: lam la gnas pa bzhi po dag / de la sbyor bar zhugs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lam la gnas pa bzhi po dag / de la sbyor bar zhugs pa'i phyir //
translated: The four who abide in the path

original: de dag zhugs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag zhugs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: are called enterers because they have entered.

original: dgra bcom mi slob slob pa ni //
analyzed: dgra bcom mi slob slob pa ni //
translated: Arhats are nonlearners.

original: zad phyir slob pas gzhan bdun no //
analyzed: zad phyir slob pas gzhan bdun no //
translated: The other seven are learners because they have not exhausted.

original: skyes bu gang zag brgyad po 'di //
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag brgyad po 'di //
translated: These eight beings

original: dge 'dun zhes ni bya bar brjod //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes ni bya bar brjod //
translated: are called the saṅgha.

original: bdud rnams kun gyis mi phyed pas ;
analyzed: bdud rnams kun gyis mi phyed pas ;
translated: Because they cannot be divided by any demon,

original: /'di ltar dge 'dun zhes brjod do //🔽mi phyed dad pas rigs par ni //
analyzed: /'di ltar dge 'dun zhes brjod do // mi phyed dad pas rigs par ni //
translated: they are called the saṅgha.🔽Those who have faith in the saṅgha

original: sangs rgyas bden par rtogs phyir spang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bden par rtogs phyir spang //
translated: abandon the view of self through understanding the truth of the Buddha.

original: gnas pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i dngos po ji ltar 'byung ba'i dmigs pa la rab tu sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor bas phra rgyas zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gnas pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i dngos po ji ltar 'byung ba'i dmigs pa la rab tu sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor bas phra rgyas zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The object of observation is applied to the arising of things that are consistent with abiding.

original: phra ba'am bdag gi rgyud kyi rjes su 'brel pas phra rgyas so //
analyzed: phra ba'am bdag gi rgyud kyi rjes su 'brel pas phra rgyas so //
translated: Or, they are called “proclivities” because they are subtle or because they are related to one’s continuum.

original: phra rgyas bshad zin to //
analyzed: phra rgyas bshad zin to //
translated: The proclivities have been explained.

original: 'byung ba'i rim pa ni yang 'di dag las dngos po ji ltar gnas pa gzhan du mi rtogs pa dang / mi bden pa'i ngo bor sgro 'dogs pas thog mar ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rim pa ni yang 'di dag las dngos po ji ltar gnas pa gzhan du mi rtogs pa dang / mi bden pa'i ngo bor sgro 'dogs pas thog mar ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The order of their arising is as follows: First, there is ignorance, because one does not understand the way things are and superimposes an unreal nature on them.

original: de las ni yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyogs gnyis thos nas 'di bden nam mi bden zhes the tshom 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las ni yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyogs gnyis thos nas 'di bden nam mi bden zhes the tshom 'byung ngo //
translated: Then, having heard the two positions of the correct and the incorrect, doubt arises, thinking, “Is this true or not?”

original: de nas ni mi bden pa'i phyogs la goms pas bden pa'i dngos por yod pa nyid du sgro btags te /
analyzed: de nas ni mi bden pa'i phyogs la goms pas bden pa'i dngos por yod pa nyid du sgro btags te /
translated: Then, through habituation to the incorrect position, one superimposes the existence of a real entity.

original: phyin ci log tu lta ba ni log par zhugs pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu lta ba ni log par zhugs pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: The view that is contrary to reality is the view that engages in error.

original: gang log pa nyid du nges par 'byed pa de lta @261b bu'i bdag nyid can ni log par lta ba zhes bya bar gzung gi rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa'i bdag nyid can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang log pa nyid du nges par 'byed pa de lta @261b bu'i bdag nyid can ni log par lta ba zhes bya bar gzung gi rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa'i bdag nyid can ni ma yin no //
translated: That which is ascertained as wrong is held to be wrong view, not that which denies cause and effect.

original: log par lta ba de las ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba de las ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'byung ste /
translated: From that wrong view, the view of the transitory collection arises.

original: des ni nye bar len pa'i phung po la bdag gi ngo bo nyid du sgro btags nas mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: des ni nye bar len pa'i phung po la bdag gi ngo bo nyid du sgro btags nas mngon par zhen to //
translated: By that, one superimposes the nature of a self on the appropriated aggregates and becomes attached.

original: de las ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de las ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba 'byung ste /
translated: From that, the view grasping an extreme arises.

original: de las rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar rtog pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de las rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar rtog pa nyid kyis so //
translated: From that, one conceives the extremes of eternalism and annihilationism.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba las ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba las ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: From the view grasping an extreme, the view grasping rules and ritual as supreme arises.

original: de ltar mthar gzung ba gang yin pa de nyid kyis dag pa dang grol bar rtogs pas so ;
analyzed: de ltar mthar gzung ba gang yin pa de nyid kyis dag pa dang grol bar rtogs pas so ;
translated: By grasping an extreme in that way, one conceives it to be pure and liberated.

original: / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa las lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa las lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: From the view grasping rules and ritual as supreme, the view grasping mere rules and ritual arises.

original: gang gis dag par 'dzin pa de nyid la dam pa 'dzin pas so //🔽de las ni 'dod chags te /
analyzed: gang gis dag par 'dzin pa de nyid la dam pa 'dzin pas so // de las ni 'dod chags te /
translated: The same is true of the other defilements.

original: rang gi lta ba la'o //🔽de las ni lta ba la nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: rang gi lta ba la'o // de las ni lta ba la nga rgyal lo //
translated: From attachment, there is pride in one's own view.

original: gzhan gyi la ni zhe sdang ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi la ni zhe sdang ste /
translated: From that, there is hostility toward another's view.

original: go rims ni 'di ltar ro //
analyzed: go rims ni 'di ltar ro //
translated: The order is as stated.

original: de re re yang rgyu gsum gsum gyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: de re re yang rgyu gsum gsum gyis 'byung ste /
translated: Each of these defilements arises from three causes:

original: phra rgyas spangs par ma gyur pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed par gyur pa dang / yul nye bar gnas par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: phra rgyas spangs par ma gyur pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed par gyur pa dang / yul nye bar gnas par gyur pa ste /
translated: the non-abandoning of the proclivity, incorrect mental application, and the presence of the object-field.

original: rgyu dang / yul dang / sbyor ba'i stobs te 'di dag las 'byung ngo//
analyzed: rgyu dang / yul dang / sbyor ba'i stobs te 'di dag las 'byung ngo//
translated: They arise from the power of cause, object-field, and application.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa de la phra rgyas drug tu brjod pa de dag nyid du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi rgyur nyon mongs par byed pas 'di dag la nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa de la phra rgyas drug tu brjod pa de dag nyid du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi rgyur nyon mongs par byed pas 'di dag la nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The six proclivities mentioned above are called defilements because they defile the body, speech, and mind by means of the defilements.

original: de la re zhig nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can yin no //
translated: First, those that are defiled are secondary defilements.

original: gzhan gang sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan gang sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyid de /
translated: Other defiled mental factors included in the aggregate of formations are secondary defilements.

original: de dag gis sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are secondary defilements because they defile the mind.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sgyu dang / rgyags pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / 'tshig pa dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / g-yo la sogs pa rnam pa du ma chos mngon pa las byung ngo //
analyzed: sgyu dang / rgyags pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / 'tshig pa dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / g-yo la sogs pa rnam pa du ma chos mngon pa las byung ngo //
translated: The Abhidharma states that there are many kinds, such as deceit, arrogance, violence, spite, resentment, and guile.

original: de la sgyu ni gzhan slu ba ste /
analyzed: de la sgyu ni gzhan slu ba ste /
translated: Deceit is the deceiving of others.

original: ji ltar sgyu ni rang gi ngo bo sbas nas brdzun pa'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid du zhugs te 'jig rten sgrub bar byed pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba'i chos @262a * //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ni rang gi ngo bo sbas nas brdzun pa'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid du zhugs te 'jig rten sgrub bar byed pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba'i chos @262a * //
translated: Just as a magician conceals his own nature and engages in the false appearance of an illusion to deceive the world, so too does deceit.

original: gang dang ldan pas rang la ji ltar gnas pa'i chos sbas nas mi bden pa'i bdag nyid du zhugs te /
analyzed: gang dang ldan pas rang la ji ltar gnas pa'i chos sbas nas mi bden pa'i bdag nyid du zhugs te /
translated: It is called deceit because one hides the way things really are from oneself and engages in the false nature of things.

original: gzhan la slu ba'i chos de ni sgyu zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan la slu ba'i chos de ni sgyu zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called deceit because it is a phenomenon that deceives others.

original: rgyags pa'i khengs pa ste dregs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa'i khengs pa ste dregs pa'o //
translated: It is called arrogance because it is a swelling up of the mind.

original: gang gi stobs kyis gzhan la brnyas pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang sems kyi rgyun byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi stobs kyis gzhan la brnyas pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang sems kyi rgyun byung ba'o //
translated: It is a swelling up of the mind that occurs through the power of which one's body and mind become haughty and contemptuous of others.

original: khro ba'i rkyen gyis khu tshur dang thal lcag la sogs rab tu brdeg pa'i rgyu'i chos ni rnam par 'tshe bas na rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: khro ba'i rkyen gyis khu tshur dang thal lcag la sogs rab tu brdeg pa'i rgyu'i chos ni rnam par 'tshe bas na rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
translated: It is called violence because it is a phenomenon that causes one to strike others with fists, sticks, and so on through the condition of anger.

original: 'tshig pa ni sdig pa la rab tu zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshig pa ni sdig pa la rab tu zhen pa'o //
translated: It is called spite because it is a strong adherence to evil.

original: chos gang dang ldan pas sdig pa las mi zlogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang dang ldan pas sdig pa las mi zlogs pa ste /
translated: It is a phenomenon that possesses such a quality that one does not turn away from evil.

original: mche ba'am sen mos bzung ba ltar sdig pa rab tu bzung nas gnas pa ni 'tshig pa'o //
analyzed: mche ba'am sen mos bzung ba ltar sdig pa rab tu bzung nas gnas pa ni 'tshig pa'o //
translated: It is spite because it is like holding on to evil with one's teeth or nails and not letting go.

original: kho na du 'dzin pa ni khon du 'dzin pa ste khros par gyur par khros pa'i dngos po la so sor rtog pa ma yin pa mang bar yang dang yang du 'jug pas gang khon du 'dzin pa ni khon du 'dzin pa ste khros pa'i yul sems la
analyzed: kho na du 'dzin pa ni khon du 'dzin pa ste khros par gyur par khros pa'i dngos po la so sor rtog pa ma yin pa mang bar yang dang yang du 'jug pas gang khon du 'dzin pa ni khon du 'dzin pa ste khros pa'i yul sems la
translated: Resentment is the holding of a grudge. It is the frequent and repeated non-discernment of the object of anger, by one who is angry and who holds a grudge. One who holds a grudge is one who is angry.

original: mang du byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mang du byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one makes much of the object of anger.

original: g-yo ni sems kyi mi dran pa ste /
analyzed: g-yo ni sems kyi mi dran pa ste /
translated: Deceit is the non-discernment of mind.

original: g-yo'i ngo ni g-yo nyid do //
analyzed: g-yo'i ngo ni g-yo nyid do //
translated: The nature of deceit is deceit.

original: de la g-yo zhes bya ba ni chos gang dang ldan bas sems kyi rgyun gya gyu ba ste /
analyzed: de la g-yo zhes bya ba ni chos gang dang ldan bas sems kyi rgyun gya gyu ba ste /
translated: The term deceit is a dharma that is crookedness of the mind-continuum.

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i tshul dang tshul ma yin pa mi ston pa mi dran zhing mi gsal bar zhugs pa ni g-yo zhes bya'o //🔽de dag las sgyu dang / rgyags pa ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa'i dri ma'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i tshul dang tshul ma yin pa mi ston pa mi dran zhing mi gsal bar zhugs pa ni g-yo zhes bya'o // de dag las sgyu dang / rgyags pa ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa'i dri ma'o //
translated: It is the non-discernment and non-clarity of the way things are, and the way things are not, as they are. It is called deceit.🔽Among these, deceit and arrogance are defilements that are products of attachment.

original: khon du 'dzin pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba ni khong khro'i rgyu mthun pa'i'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba ni khong khro'i rgyu mthun pa'i'o //
translated: Resentment and violence are products of anger.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i ni 'tshig pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i ni 'tshig pa'o //
translated: The cause of the overesteeming of morality and ritual is anger.

original: g-yo ni log par lta ba'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ni log par lta ba'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: The cause of false view is deceit.

original: kun nas dkris pa ni kun nas dkris pa bcu ste /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa ni kun nas dkris pa bcu ste /
translated: The ten envelopments are:

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa'o //
translated: torpor, sleep, excitation, regret, envy, avarice, lack of conscience, lack of shame, anger, and concealment.

original: rmugs pa ni lus dang sems mi gsal bas lci pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir las su mi rung bar sbyor ba de ni rmugs pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa ni lus dang sems mi gsal bas lci pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir las su mi rung bar sbyor ba de ni rmugs pa'o //
translated: Torpor is the non-lucidity of body and mind, because it is a state of heaviness and unserviceability.

original: gnyid ni gang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i chos yid kyi rnam par shes pa sdud par byed pa'i rgyu de ni gnyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: gnyid ni gang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i chos yid kyi rnam par shes pa sdud par byed pa'i rgyu de ni gnyid ces brjod do //
translated: Sleep is the cause of the withdrawal of the five groups of consciousnesses, and it is the cause of the withdrawal of the mental consciousness.

original: rgod pa ni lus dang sems rab tu ma zhi ba nyid dang / ji ltar rlung dang 'brel pas chu @262b steng du bskyod na chu klung gi chu'i cha steng du 'byung ba ni rgod pa'o //
analyzed: rgod pa ni lus dang sems rab tu ma zhi ba nyid dang / ji ltar rlung dang 'brel pas chu @262b steng du bskyod na chu klung gi chu'i cha steng du 'byung ba ni rgod pa'o //
translated: Agitation is the non-tranquility of body and mind. Just as water agitated by wind does not reflect the face, so the mind agitated by the defilements does not reflect, i.e., does not grasp its object clearly.

original: de bzhin du sems las byung ba gang lus dang sems ma zhi bar 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni rgod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems las byung ba gang lus dang sems ma zhi bar 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni rgod pa'o //
translated: The agitation of the mind is the cause of the non-tranquility of body and mind.

original: 'gyod pa ni ngan par byas pa'i dngos po la phyis gdung zhing mya ngan byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni ngan par byas pa'i dngos po la phyis gdung zhing mya ngan byed pa ste /
translated: Regret is remorse for misdeeds.

original: phyi nas gdung ba las byung ba'i yid la gcags pa ni 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nas gdung ba las byung ba'i yid la gcags pa ni 'gyod pa'o //
translated: Regret is the remorse that arises from remorse.

original: phrag dog dang / ser sna ni kun du sbyor bar bshad zin to //
analyzed: phrag dog dang / ser sna ni kun du sbyor bar bshad zin to //
translated: Jealousy and avarice have already been explained as fetters.

original: ngo tsha med pa ni chos gang dang ldan pas bdag gi yon tan nyams par byed cing bdag nyid la ltos nas sdig pa la 'jug pa la mi 'dzem pa ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa ni chos gang dang ldan pas bdag gi yon tan nyams par byed cing bdag nyid la ltos nas sdig pa la 'jug pa la mi 'dzem pa ste /
translated: Lack of self-respect is the lack of dread of sin by reason of oneself.

original: nyes pa mi sdom pa'i rgyu rang bzhin gyis smad pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ngo tsha med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nyes pa mi sdom pa'i rgyu rang bzhin gyis smad pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ngo tsha med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That which is naturally reprehensible is called shamelessness.

original: khrel med pa zhes bya ba 'di yang 'dzem pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: khrel med pa zhes bya ba 'di yang 'dzem pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Lack of conscience is also non-embarrassment.

original: 'on kyang khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: However, there is a difference.

original: 'di ni gzhan la ltos nas nyes pa rnams la mi 'dzem pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan la ltos nas nyes pa rnams la mi 'dzem pa'o //
translated: This is non-embarrassment with regard to others.

original: khro ba ni sems rab tu 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba ni sems rab tu 'khrug pa'o //
translated: Anger is a disturbance of the mind.

original: de la gnod sems ni sems kyi yul la kun nas mnar sems pa yin la /
analyzed: de la gnod sems ni sems kyi yul la kun nas mnar sems pa yin la /
translated: Among them, malice is a mental distress with regard to an object.

original: khro ba ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i yul la yang kun nas mnar sems pa tsam mo //
analyzed: khro ba ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i yul la yang kun nas mnar sems pa tsam mo //
translated: Anger is a mere mental distress with regard to sentient beings and non-sentient objects.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni khros par gyur pas so sor ma brtags par gzhan dag la khu tshur dang thal lcag la sogs pas rab tu rdeg par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni khros par gyur pas so sor ma brtags par gzhan dag la khu tshur dang thal lcag la sogs pas rab tu rdeg par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Harmfulness is the cause of striking others with fists, sticks, etc., without careful consideration due to anger.

original: des na gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma yin pa'i sems rnam par 'khrug pa tsam ni khro ba'o //
analyzed: des na gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma yin pa'i sems rnam par 'khrug pa tsam ni khro ba'o //
translated: Therefore, anger is a mere disturbance of the mind that is neither malice nor harmfulness.

original: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho ba rab tu ma khyud pa ste /
analyzed: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho ba rab tu ma khyud pa ste /
translated: Concealment is the non-abandonment of a transgression.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis smad pa ni kha na ma tho ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis smad pa ni kha na ma tho ba'o //
translated: A transgression is that which is censured by the noble ones.

original: de rab tu mkhyud pa ni gzhan la rab tu mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: de rab tu mkhyud pa ni gzhan la rab tu mi ston pa'o //
translated: Non-abandonment is not revealing it to others.

original: de ni 'chab pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'chab pa ste /
translated: That is concealment.

original: gang gis gang zag de kha na ma tho bas bdag nyid shin tu spags shing mi gtsang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis gang zag de kha na ma tho bas bdag nyid shin tu spags shing mi gtsang bar byed pa'o //
translated: By that, the person is very much puffed up with the transgression and is made impure.

original: kun nas 'khri zhing sems la thams cad du dkris nas gnas pas kun nas dkris pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas 'khri zhing sems la thams cad du dkris nas gnas pas kun nas dkris pa ste /
translated: Envelopment is that which, having entangled the mind, remains there.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i bar chad byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i bar chad byed pa nyid do //
translated: It is an obstruction to engaging in virtue.

original: 'di dag las rmugs pa dang gnyid dang khrel med pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag las rmugs pa dang gnyid dang khrel med pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Among these, lethargy, sleep, and lack of conscience are concordant with ignorance.

original: 'gyod pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu mthun pa'o //🔽ngo tsha med pa dang rgod pa dang ser sna ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu mthun pa'o // ngo tsha med pa dang rgod pa dang ser sna ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Regret is concordant with doubt.🔽Lack of shame, excitation, and stinginess are concordant with attachment.

original: khro ba dang phrag dog ni khong khros kun nas bslang ba'o //
analyzed: khro ba dang phrag dog ni khong khros kun nas bslang ba'o //
translated: Anger and envy are motivated by anger.

original: @263a * // 'chab pa ni 'dod chags dang ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa ste /
analyzed: @263a * // 'chab pa ni 'dod chags dang ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa ste /
translated: Concealment is a homogeneous cause of desire and ignorance.

original: dri ma rnams dang bcu po 'di dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dri ma rnams dang bcu po 'di dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These ten, together with the defilements, are called secondary defilements.

original: zag pa ni 'di ltar zag pa gsum ste /
analyzed: zag pa ni 'di ltar zag pa gsum ste /
translated: The contaminants are as follows: there are three contaminants:

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: the contaminant of desire, the contaminant of existence, and the contaminant of ignorance.

original: de la ma rig pa ma gtogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa gzhan kun nas dkris pa bcu dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i zag par rig par bya ste rdzas bzhi bcu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ma gtogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa gzhan kun nas dkris pa bcu dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i zag par rig par bya ste rdzas bzhi bcu rtsa gcig go //
translated: Among them, the contaminant of desire should be known as the desire realm, except for ignorance, together with the ten entanglements, with thirty-one substances.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas ma rig pa ma gtogs pa rdzas lnga bcu rtsa gnyis ni srid pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas ma rig pa ma gtogs pa rdzas lnga bcu rtsa gnyis ni srid pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The contaminant of existence is the fifty-two substances of the proclivities of the form and formless realms, except for ignorance.

original: yang rgyu gang gis gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas rnams bsdoms nas srid pa'i zag par byas she na /
analyzed: yang rgyu gang gis gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas rnams bsdoms nas srid pa'i zag par byas she na /
translated: Again, by what cause are the proclivities of the formless realm combined and made into the contaminant of existence?

original: de gnyi ga yang lung du ma bstan pa dang / kha nang du bltas pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir chos mtshungs pa nyid gsum gyis gcig tu byas so //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang lung du ma bstan pa dang / kha nang du bltas pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir chos mtshungs pa nyid gsum gyis gcig tu byas so //
translated: Both are neutral, both are internal, and both are on the level of meditative equipoise.

original: khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa bco lnga ni ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa bco lnga ni ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The fifteen ignorances of the three realms are the contaminant of ignorance.

original: rgyu gang gis 'di logs shig tu gzhag ce na 'di ltar de nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa des na zag pa nyid du logs shig tu gzhag go //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis 'di logs shig tu gzhag ce na 'di ltar de nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa des na zag pa nyid du logs shig tu gzhag go //
translated: Why is it posited separately as a cause? Because it is the root of all afflictions, it is posited separately as a contaminant.

original: chu bo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chu bo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The so-called floods are

original: chu bo ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: chu bo ni bzhi ste /
translated: there are four floods:

original: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the flood of desire, the flood of existence, the flood of view, and the flood of ignorance.

original: de la lta ba las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i zag pa nyid ni 'dod pa'i chu bo ste rdzas nyi shu rtsa dgu'o //
analyzed: de la lta ba las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i zag pa nyid ni 'dod pa'i chu bo ste rdzas nyi shu rtsa dgu'o //
translated: The flood of desire is the contaminant of desire except for view, which is twenty-nine substances.

original: lta ba bor ba'i srid pa'i zag pa nyid srid pa'i chu bo ste /
analyzed: lta ba bor ba'i srid pa'i zag pa nyid srid pa'i chu bo ste /
translated: The flood of existence is the contaminant of existence except for view.

original: rdzas nyi shu rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: rdzas nyi shu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: There are twenty-eight real entities.

original: khams gsum pa'i lta ba ni lta ba'i chu bo ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i lta ba ni lta ba'i chu bo ste /
translated: The flood of afflicted views is the afflicted views of the three realms.

original: rdzas sum cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: rdzas sum cu rtsa drug go //
translated: There are thirty-six real entities.

original: ma rig pa'i zag pa nyid ni ma rig pa'i chu bo ste rdzas bco lnga'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i zag pa nyid ni ma rig pa'i chu bo ste rdzas bco lnga'o //
translated: The flood of ignorance is the flood of the ignorance of the three realms. There are fifteen real entities.

original: bzhi po 'di dag nyid sbyor ba bzhir rig par bya'o //🔽nye bar len pa ni nye bar len pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag nyid sbyor ba bzhir rig par bya'o // nye bar len pa ni nye bar len pa bzhi ste /
translated: These four floods should be understood as the four yokes.

original: 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang / lta ba nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang / lta ba nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The four clingings are the clinging to desire, the clinging to afflicted views, the clinging to morality and ascetic practices, and the clinging to a doctrine of self.

original: de la 'dod pa'i sbyor ba ma rig pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa ste rdzas sum cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i sbyor ba ma rig pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa ste rdzas sum cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The clinging to desire is the desire realm in connection with the flood of desire and the flood of existence. There are thirty-four real entities.🔽The clinging to afflicted views is the afflicted views in connection with the flood of afflicted views. There are thirty real entities.

original: lta ba'i sbyor ba nyid la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma @263b gtogs pa ni lta ba nye bar len pa ste rdzas sum cu'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i sbyor ba nyid la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma @263b gtogs pa ni lta ba nye bar len pa ste rdzas sum cu'o //
translated: The clinging to morality and ascetic practices is the flood of afflicted views in connection with the afflicted view of holding to an extreme. There are twenty-two real entities.🔽The clinging to a doctrine of self is the flood of ignorance in connection with the flood of ignorance. There are fifteen real entities.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa ni rdzas drug go //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa ni rdzas drug go //
translated: The grasping of morality and ascetic practices is six real entities.

original: srid pa'i sbyor ba nyid la ma rig pas bsnan pa ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i sbyor ba nyid la ma rig pas bsnan pa ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa ste /
translated: The grasping of the belief in a self is the belief in a self added to the grasping of existence.

original: rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang bcas pa la rdzas bzhi bcu'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang bcas pa la rdzas bzhi bcu'o //
translated: When torpor and dissipation are added, there are forty real entities.

original: ci'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa lta ba las logs shig tu gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa lta ba las logs shig tu gzhag ce na /
translated: Why is the grasping of morality and ascetic practices distinguished from the view of the belief in a self?

original: lam gyi dgrar gyur pa dang / phyogs gnyi ga slu bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lam gyi dgrar gyur pa dang / phyogs gnyi ga slu bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the enemy of the path and because it deceives both parties.

original: 'dis khyim pa yang zas mi za bar mtho ris su skye bar 'du shes pas rab tu bslus la /
analyzed: 'dis khyim pa yang zas mi za bar mtho ris su skye bar 'du shes pas rab tu bslus la /
translated: It deceives householders by making them believe that by fasting they will be reborn in heaven.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams kyang 'dod pa'i yul yongs su spangs pa nyid kyis 'dag par lta bas rab tu bslus so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams kyang 'dod pa'i yul yongs su spangs pa nyid kyis 'dag par lta bas rab tu bslus so //
translated: It deceives those gone forth by making them believe that they are purified by the mere fact of renouncing the objects of desire.

original: yang rgyu gang gis nye bar len pa'i skabs su ma rig pa bsres nas brjod kyi logs shig tu ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang rgyu gang gis nye bar len pa'i skabs su ma rig pa bsres nas brjod kyi logs shig tu ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is ignorance mentioned as mixed in the section on grasping, but not separately classified as a grasping?

original: gang gi phyir srid pa 'dzin pas nye bar len pa zhes bya ba na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srid pa 'dzin pas nye bar len pa zhes bya ba na /
translated: Because they appropriate the aggregates, they are called appropriators.

original: ma rig pa ni mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But ignorance is not an appropriator because it is not a real entity.

original: zag pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa rnams ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: zag pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa rnams ni bshad zin to //
translated: The contaminants, floods, bonds, and clingings have been explained.

original: de la zag pa ni 'khor bar zag pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la zag pa ni 'khor bar zag pa nyid de /
translated: Among them, the contaminants are so called because they cause one to be contaminated in cyclic existence.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo nas mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma nas 'dzag pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo nas mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma nas 'dzag pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Or, they are contaminants because they flow out of the wounds of the six sense spheres, from the peak of cyclic existence down to the deepest hell.

original: rgyu yul rnams las 'dzag par byed pas zag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu yul rnams las 'dzag par byed pas zag pa'o //
translated: Or, they are contaminants because they flow out from the causes, the objects.

original: khyer par byed pas na chu bo ste /
analyzed: khyer par byed pas na chu bo ste /
translated: They are floods because they carry one away.

original: de'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir de dag gis de dang ldan par khyer bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir de dag gis de dang ldan par khyer bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who possesses them is carried away by them because they conform to the current.

original: sdug bsngal sna tshogs la kun du sbyor ba'i phyir ram /🔽yang dang yang du rjes su 'brel bar 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: sdug bsngal sna tshogs la kun du sbyor ba'i phyir ram / yang dang yang du rjes su 'brel bar 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ram /
translated: They are bonds because they bind one to various kinds of suffering.🔽Or, they are bonds because they cause one to engage in the process of repeated rebirth.

original: yul la sbyor ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yul la sbyor ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
translated: Or, they are bonds because they bind one to objects.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len par byed /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len par byed /
translated: They are called appropriators because they appropriate the body.

original: 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'o //
translated: They are called appropriators because they appropriate and grasp the body.

original: mdud pa zhes bya ba la mdud pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdud pa zhes bya ba la mdud pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The four knots are:🔽the knot of covetousness, the knot of malice, the knot of holding morality and asceticism as paramount, and the knot of insisting “this is the truth.

original: brnab sems lus kyi mdud pa dang / gnod sems lus kyi mdud pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa lus kyi mdud pa dang / 'di bden pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa lus kyi mdud pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems lus kyi mdud pa dang / gnod sems lus kyi mdud pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa lus kyi mdud pa dang / 'di bden pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa lus kyi mdud pa'o //
translated: covetousness is a bodily fetter, ill-will is a bodily fetter, holding morality and asceticism as paramount is a bodily fetter, and clinging to a doctrine as supreme is a bodily fetter.

original: de la brnab sems lus kyi mdud pa ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs la @264a * //🔽rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la brnab sems lus kyi mdud pa ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs la @264a * // rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: Among them, the knot of covetousness is the uninterrupted engagement in the various aspects of desire.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to the remaining knots.

original: de la sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i ma rig pa 'dod par gtogs pa ni dang po'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i ma rig pa 'dod par gtogs pa ni dang po'o //
translated: Among them, the ignorance that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing of the truth of suffering and so on, which is associated with the desire realm, is the first.

original: khong khro ba lnga ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: khong khro ba lnga ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The five of anger are the second.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa drug ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa drug ni gsum pa'o //
