translated: The six of clinging to rules and ritual as supreme are the third.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa bcu gnyis ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa bcu gnyis ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The twelve of clinging to false views as supreme are the fourth.

original: sgrib pa zhes bya ba la sgrib pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa zhes bya ba la sgrib pa lnga ste /
translated: Obstructions. There are five obstructions:

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo ;
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo ;
translated: desire, malice, lethargy-sleep, excitation-regret, and doubt.

original: / sgrib pa ni 'dod par gtogs pa nyid kyis shin tu mi dge ba nyid kyi phyir dge ba'i phyogs la sgrib pas bsgribs pa'o //
analyzed: / sgrib pa ni 'dod par gtogs pa nyid kyis shin tu mi dge ba nyid kyi phyir dge ba'i phyogs la sgrib pas bsgribs pa'o //
translated: Obstructions are so called because they obstruct the wholesome side, since they are unwholesome by being related to the realm of desire.

original: shes pa ni shes pa bcu ste /🔽chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: shes pa ni shes pa bcu ste / chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang /
translated: Knowledges. There are ten knowledges:

original: mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: knowledge of the doctrine, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of others' minds, conventional knowledge, knowledge of suffering, knowledge of origin, knowledge of cessation, knowledge of the path, knowledge of elimination, and knowledge of nonproduction.

original: chos shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge of the doctrine?

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'gog pa la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'gog pa la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang /
translated: It is the uncontaminated knowledge that focuses on the formative predispositions associated with the realm of desire, the uncontaminated knowledge that focuses on the cause of the formative predispositions associated with the realm of desire, the uncontaminated knowledge that focuses on the cessation of the formative predispositions associated with the realm of desire,

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed spong bar byed pa'i lam la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed spong bar byed pa'i lam la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: and the uncontaminated knowledge that focuses on the path that relinquishes the formative predispositions associated with the realm of desire.

original: yang chos shes pa dang chos shes pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang chos shes pa dang chos shes pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni chos shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the uncontaminated knowledge that is both the knowledge of the Dharma and the knowledge of the Dharma is the knowledge of the Dharma.

original: rjes su shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is subsequent knowledge?

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'gog pa la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'gog pa la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang /
translated: It is the uncontaminated knowledge that takes as its object the formations associated with the form and formless realms, the uncontaminated knowledge that takes as its object the cause of the formations associated with the form and formless realms, the uncontaminated knowledge that takes as its object the cessation of the formations associated with the form and formless realms,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med @264b pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed spong bar byed pa'i lam la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med @264b pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed spong bar byed pa'i lam la gang dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and the uncontaminated knowledge that takes as its object the path that abandons the formations associated with the form and formless realms.

original: yang rjes su shes pa dang rjes su shes pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang rjes su shes pa dang rjes su shes pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Moreover, the uncontaminated knowledge that is subsequent knowledge and the uncontaminated knowledge that is knowledge of the path are called subsequent knowledge.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge of others' minds?

original: shes pa gang bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bsgoms pas rtogs pa 'thob la ma bral ba'i shes pa gang gis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos la gtad da mnyam par gzhag pas mngon sum du shes pa dang /
analyzed: shes pa gang bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bsgoms pas rtogs pa 'thob la ma bral ba'i shes pa gang gis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos la gtad da mnyam par gzhag pas mngon sum du shes pa dang /
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another is the knowledge of the mind and mental activities of another, acquired through meditation on the object of meditation which is the result of meditation.

original: gzhan yang zag pa med pa'i sems dang sems las shes pa'i chos shes pa la pha rol gyi sems shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang zag pa med pa'i sems dang sems las shes pa'i chos shes pa la pha rol gyi sems shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another is also called knowledge of the mind and mental activities of another, because it is the knowledge of the mind and mental activities of another, and because it is unhindered knowledge.

original: kun rdzob shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conventional knowledge?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab po //
translated: It is impure wisdom.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of suffering?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams la mi rtag pa nyid dang ; sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid du yid la byed pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams la mi rtag pa nyid dang ; sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid du yid la byed pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is the unhindered knowledge of the aggregates as impermanent, painful, empty, and insubstantial.

original: kun 'byung ba shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of the origin?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu la rgyu nyid dang / kun 'byung ba nyid dang / rab tu skye ba nyid dang / rkyen nyid du yid la byed pa'i gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin la de ni kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu la rgyu nyid dang / kun 'byung ba nyid dang / rab tu skye ba nyid dang / rkyen nyid du yid la byed pa'i gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin la de ni kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is the knowledge of the individual who, with regard to the cause of the impure, considers the cause as cause, the origin as origin, the antecedent condition as antecedent condition, and the direct antecedent as direct antecedent.

original: 'gog pa shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of cessation?

original: 'gog pa la 'gog pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid dang / gya nom pa nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid du yid la byed pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'gog pa la 'gog pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid dang / gya nom pa nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid du yid la byed pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is the knowledge of the individual who, with regard to cessation, considers cessation as cessation, calm as calm, excellence as excellence, and escape as escape.

original: lam shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lam shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of the path?

original: lam la lam nyid dang / rigs pa nyid dang / sgrub pa nyid dang / nges par 'byin pa nyid du yid la byed pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni lam shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: lam la lam nyid dang / rigs pa nyid dang / sgrub pa nyid dang / nges par 'byin pa nyid du yid la byed pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni lam shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is the knowledge of the individual who, with regard to the path, considers the path as the path, skill as skill, achievement as achievement, and the means of definite exit as the means of definite exit.

original: zad pa shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: zad pa shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of destruction?

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal ni yongs su shes so //
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal ni yongs su shes so //
translated: “I have fully understood suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba ni spangs so //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba ni spangs so //
translated: I have abandoned the origin.

original: 'gog pa ni mngon du byas so //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mngon du byas so //
translated: I have realized the cessation.

original: lam ni bsgoms so //🔽zhes rab tu shes pa la /
analyzed: lam ni bsgoms so // zhes rab tu shes pa la /
translated: I have cultivated the path.”

original: nye bar brten pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba @265a * //
analyzed: nye bar brten pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba @265a * //
translated: The knowledge, seeing,

original: dang / rigs pa dang / blo dang / rtog pa dang / shes rab dang / snang ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni zad pa shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dang / rigs pa dang / blo dang / rtog pa dang / shes rab dang / snang ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni zad pa shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: reasoning, understanding, discernment, wisdom, illumination, and realization that are based on that are called the knowledge of destruction.

original: mi skye ba shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of non-arising?🔽“I have fully understood suffering and there is no more to be fully understood,”🔽“I have abandoned the origin and there is no more to be abandoned,”

original: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes te yang yongs su shes par byar med do zhes bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba rab tu spangs te yang spang bar byar med do zhes bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du byas te yang mngon du byar med do zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes te yang yongs su shes par byar med do zhes bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba rab tu spangs te yang spang bar byar med do zhes bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du byas te yang mngon du byar med do zhes bya ba dang /
translated: “I have realized the cessation and there is no more to be realized,”🔽“I have cultivated the path and there is no more to be cultivated.”

original: lam bsgoms te yang bsgom par byar med do zhes bya bar shes pa la brten pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / rigs pa dang ; blo dang / rtog pa dang / shes rab dang / snang ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni mi skye ba shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: lam bsgoms te yang bsgom par byar med do zhes bya bar shes pa la brten pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / rigs pa dang ; blo dang / rtog pa dang / shes rab dang / snang ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni mi skye ba shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The knowledge, seeing, reasoning, understanding, thought, wisdom, light, and clear knowledge that is based on the knowledge that there is no more to cultivate in meditation is called the knowledge of non-arising.

original: bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is acquiescence?

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i bzod pa brgyad de /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i bzod pa brgyad de /
translated: It is the eight acquiescences of clear knowledge.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: They are: acquiescence in the knowledge of the teaching with regard to suffering, acquiescence in the subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering, acquiescence in the knowledge of the teaching with regard to the origin, acquiescence in the subsequent knowledge with regard to the origin, acquiescence in the knowledge of the teaching with regard to cessation,

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: acquiescence in the subsequent knowledge with regard to cessation, acquiescence in the knowledge of the teaching with regard to the path, and acquiescence in the subsequent knowledge with regard to the path.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The associated factors have been explained.

original: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams bshad par bya ste /
translated: We now must explain the dissociated factors.

original: de la thob pa gang zhe na /🔽rnyed pa dang ldan pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la thob pa gang zhe na / rnyed pa dang ldan pa gnyis te /
translated: What is possession?🔽It is the acquisition of that which has been obtained and the possession of that which has been obtained.

original: ma thob pa dang / rnam par nyams pa las so sor rnyed pa dang / thob nas kun tu ldan pa'o /
analyzed: ma thob pa dang / rnam par nyams pa las so sor rnyed pa dang / thob nas kun tu ldan pa'o /
translated: It is twofold: acquisition of that which has not been obtained and acquisition of that which has been lost.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: It is threefold:

original: grib ma ltar rjes su 'brang ba dang / khyu mchog ltar rjes su 'brang ba dang / be'u ltar rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: grib ma ltar rjes su 'brang ba dang / khyu mchog ltar rjes su 'brang ba dang / be'u ltar rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: possession that follows like a shadow, possession that follows like a leader of a herd, and possession that follows like a calf.

original: de la dang po ni 'di lta ste lung du ma bstan pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni 'di lta ste lung du ma bstan pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The first is, for example, the possession of the neutral views.

original: gnyis pa ni 'di lta ste gong ma nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'di lta ste gong ma nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi lta bu'o //
translated: The second is, for example, the possession of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma at the time of linking at death when one dies in a higher realm and is reborn in the desire realm.

original: gsum pa ni 'di lta ste lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'di lta ste lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i lta bu'o //
translated: The third is, for example, the possession of the nonconascent states of virtue that arise from hearing, contemplating, and meditating.

original: ma thob pa ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Non-possession is the opposite of possession.

original: thob pa dang ma thob pa @265b 'di dag ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa dang ma thob pa @265b 'di dag ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: Possession and non-possession do not exist in relation to the factors not related to thought, to cessation due to deliberation, and to cessation not due to deliberation.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the attainment of non-perception?

original: dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba gong ma'i ma yin pa nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba gong ma'i ma yin pa nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of thought and thought-concomitants by a person who is free from the attachment of the realm of fine-materiality, but not free from the attachment of the realm of immateriality, by a person who is detached from the lower stage but not from the higher stage, by a person who is intent on the escape from the realm of fine-materiality.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the attainment of cessation?

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yin la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yin la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of thought and thought-concomitants by a person who is free from the attachment of the sphere of nothingness, by a person who is intent on the escape of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'du shes med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-perception?

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of the mind and mental activities of the gods who are without ideation.

original: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of life?

original: khams gsum pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i tshe'o //
translated: It is the duration of the aggregates in the three realms.

original: skal pa mnyam pa gang zhe na /🔽sems can rnams mtshungs pa'o //🔽de ni sems can rnams kyi 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa gang zhe na / sems can rnams mtshungs pa'o // de ni sems can rnams kyi 'dra ba ste /
translated: What is homogeneity?🔽It is the similarity of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la gcig tu 'dod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gcig tu 'dod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is the cause of the desire for similarity among sentient beings.

original: gnas so sor thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas so sor thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is acquisition?

original: yul so sor thob pa'o //
analyzed: yul so sor thob pa'o //
translated: It is the acquisition of a place.

original: dngos po so sor thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po so sor thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the acquisition of a thing?

original: phung po so sor thob pa'o //
analyzed: phung po so sor thob pa'o //
translated: It is the acquisition of the aggregates.

original: skye mched so sor thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye mched so sor thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the acquisition of a sense-sphere?

original: nang dang phyi'i bdag nyid can gyi skye mched so sor rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i bdag nyid can gyi skye mched so sor rnyed pa'o //
translated: It is the acquisition of the sense-spheres, internal and external.

original: skye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is birth?

original: phung po mngon par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: phung po mngon par 'grub pa'o //
translated: It is the appearance of the aggregates.

original: rga ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rga ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is aging?

original: phung po yongs su smin pa'o /
analyzed: phung po yongs su smin pa'o /
translated: It is the decay of the aggregates.

original: gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is duration?

original: skyes pa'i chos rnams rnam par mi nyams pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i chos rnams rnam par mi nyams pa'o //
translated: It is the non-deterioration of the qualities of the noble ones.

original: mi rtag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is impermanence?

original: 'dus byas skyes pa rnams rnam par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas skyes pa rnams rnam par 'jig pa'o //
translated: It is the destruction of conditioned things as soon as they arise.

original: ming gi tshogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of names?

original: ming 'dogs pa nyid ni ming ngo //
analyzed: ming 'dogs pa nyid ni ming ngo //
translated: It is the designation of the particularities of things.

original: tshig gi tshogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of phrases?

original: don dag gi yi ge yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: don dag gi yi ge yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is the totality of syllables which express the meaning completely.

original: yi ge'i tshogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of syllables?

original: yi ge rnams nyid yi ge'i tshogs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yi ge rnams nyid yi ge'i tshogs zhes brjod do //
translated: It is the syllables themselves.

original: rkyen ma tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen ma tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the non-coalescence of conditions?

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba'o //
translated: It is the incompleteness of causes and conditions.

original: rkyen tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the coalescence of conditions?

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba nyid med do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba nyid med do //
translated: It is the completeness of causes and conditions.

original: sems dang mi ldan pa rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan pa rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The non-mental factors have been explained.

original: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /🔽'di ltar don @266a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na / 'di ltar don @266a * //
translated: What is consciousness?

original: yongs su 'dzin pa dang / don yongs su gcod pa dang / don rnam par shes pa dang / don kun du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa dang / don yongs su gcod pa dang / don rnam par shes pa dang / don kun du rtogs pa ste /
translated: It is the apprehension of the object, the discernment of the object, the perception of the object, the consciousness of the object.

original: ji ltar nor bu nye bar gyur pa'i tshon gyi rnam pa brten par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang yul gyi rnam pa yongs su gcod pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nor bu nye bar gyur pa'i tshon gyi rnam pa brten par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang yul gyi rnam pa yongs su gcod pa ste /
translated: Just as the color of a gem is dependent on the color of the thing near it, so too consciousness is the determination of the form of the object.

original: yul nye ba'i rnam par byung bas yul nye bar gcod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yul nye ba'i rnam par byung bas yul nye bar gcod pa yin gyi /
translated: Consciousness is the determination of the object because it arises in the aspect of the object that is near.

original: yul gyi rnam pa tsam nyid ni rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa tsam nyid ni rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: But consciousness is not just the form of the object.

original: yul de yang rnam par shes pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul de yang rnam par shes pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For then the object would be consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa las don gyi rnam pa gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las don gyi rnam pa gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the form of the object something other than consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa don gyi rnam pas stong par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa don gyi rnam pas stong par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: for then consciousness would be devoid of the form of the object.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi don du rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi don du rnam par gzhag la /
translated: Thus, the form that exists in consciousness is posited as an external object,

original: phyi rol gyi don gyi rnam par shes par gzhag ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyi rnam par shes par gzhag ste /
translated: and the form of the external object is posited as consciousness.

original: 'di ltar phan tshun ltos nas rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes par bya bar 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'di ltar phan tshun ltos nas rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes par bya bar 'grub bo //
translated: Thus, consciousness and the object of consciousness are established in mutual dependence.

original: yang rnam par shes pa de dbye na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa de dbye na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: Furthermore, consciousness is divided into six groups of consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called the eye consciousness, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and thought consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the eye consciousness?

original: mig gi dbang po la brten nas gzugs so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po la brten nas gzugs so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the perception of forms based on the eye faculty.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ear consciousness?

original: rna ba'i dbang po la brten nas sgra so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po la brten nas sgra so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the perception of sounds based on the ear faculty.

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nose consciousness?

original: sna'i dbang po la brten nas dri so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: sna'i dbang po la brten nas dri so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the perception of smells based on the nose faculty.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the tongue consciousness?

original: lce'i dbang po la brten nas ro so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: lce'i dbang po la brten nas ro so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the perception of tastes based on the tongue faculty.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the body consciousness?

original: lus kyi dbang po la brten nas reg bya so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po la brten nas reg bya so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: The body sense-faculty is the support of the tactile consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is mental consciousness?

original: yid kyi dbang po la brten nas chos so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po la brten nas chos so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the consciousness which has for its point of support the mental faculty.

original: phung po lnga po ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: phung po lnga po ni bshad zin to //
translated: The five aggregates have been explained.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis brjod par bya ste /
translated: The twelve sense-spheres should now be explained.

original: de la khams bcu dang / skye mched bcu ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la khams bcu dang / skye mched bcu ni bshad zin to //
translated: Among them, ten sense-spheres have already been explained, namely, the ten sense-spheres that are material.

original: yid kyi skye @266b mched dang / chos kyi skye mched bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi skye @266b mched dang / chos kyi skye mched bshad par bya ste /
translated: The mental sense-sphere and the sense-sphere of factors should now be explained.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs de dag gi nang nas rnam par shes pa gang dang gang 'gag ma thag pa de dang de ni 'dra ba'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa phyi ma mngon par 'grub pa'i rten gyi ngo bor gnas pas yid ces so /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs de dag gi nang nas rnam par shes pa gang dang gang 'gag ma thag pa de dang de ni 'dra ba'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa phyi ma mngon par 'grub pa'i rten gyi ngo bor gnas pas yid ces so /
translated: Among the groups of consciousness, the one which has just perished, is called mental faculty, because it is the point of support of the mental consciousness which will arise later, and because it is the point of support of the mental consciousness which has perished.

original: tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang / bdun po 'di dag ni chos kyi skye mched ces brjod do //🔽de la tshor ba la sogs pa gsum dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni bshad zin to //🔽'dus ma byas gsum bshad par bya ste /🔽de la nam mkha' gang zhe na /

translated: The aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of perception, non-informative form, space, analytical cessation, non-analytical cessation, and the cessation not due to deliberation.🔽These seven are called the sense-sphere of mental objects.🔽Among them, the three beginning with feeling have already been explained, as well as non-informative form.🔽The three unconditioned things will now be explained.🔽What is space?🔽
